La señora Blanca B., tiene 49 años de edad es soltera, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno esta a su cargo cursando el segundo año de secundaria, es madre soltera, su proposito es poder invertir fuertemente en su negocio de esta manera tener una fuente de ingresos para el hogar, su sueño es poder instalar una pulperia con venta de ropa, ya que actualmente ella se dedica al comercio de productos del hogar como es arroz, azucar, aceite, frijoles, detergentes, gaseosa, pollo y demas productos de consumo del hogar, teniendo tambien la venta de ropa usada actividad que lleva a cabo en el municipio de malpaisillo, ella tiene mas de doce años de ejercer dichos negocios y con los cuales a apoyado a sus hijos, dando inicio como una alternativa de subsistencia ya que no contaba con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, en la actualidad tiene varios ciclos de trabajar con nuestra institucion esperando contar siempre con el apoyo nuestro para desarrollar su proyecto.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 43 years old and has been working as a fisherman since 1993 at Tunle Sap Lake. He earns around 13,200 Riel (US $3.30) per day. His wife, Mrs. Nhem Touch, is 43 years old and earns around 8,300 Riel (US $2.00) a day working as a farmer. They have four children, one of whom works in his father's business, earning about 12,000 Riel (US $3.00) per day. The family lives in Anglung Samnor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. Heng wants to expand his business by purchasing more fishing tools but he lacks the capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Chorm

texts.en:
Mr. Chorm K. is 37 years old and his work as a driver of a plowing machine earns him 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) a day. His wife, Mrs. Pot Kear, is 50 years old and she has been selling fish for six years. She earns approximately 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day. They have five children; two are married and the oldest one helps her selling fish. They live in Chi Kreng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase his family's income, Chorm is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Riel (US $375.00) to purchase piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. is 44 years old and works selling vegetables in the market, earning approximately 15,000 Riel (US $3.75) a day. Her husband, Mr. Vann Loeng, operates a business selling oxen. He buys cows from a local villager and resells them for a profit. He earns about 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day. They live in Chi Kreng Commune, Siem Reap Province, and have three children, all of whom are in school.

Heng would like to request a loan of 2,000,000 Riel (US $500.00) to help her husband expand his business by purchasing more oxen for resale. The loan will allow them to increase their income and help them support their family.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business by purchasing more oxen to resell

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Mrs. Theng M., 33, is a farmer while her husband, Mr. Chhoeng Rit, is a bricklayer. They live in Kork Thlork Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Theng has been farming since 1990 and typically earns around 4,000 Riel (US $1.00) per day. Because her farming business is the main source of income for her family, she would like to request a loan to purchase a plot of land to expand her rice growing.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for her rice growing

loans.name: Muhabbathon

texts.ru:
Алимбаева Мухаббатхон 1961 года рождения, разведенная, имеет 3 детей.  У нее высшее образование и 10 лет опыта в сфере продаж женской одежды и обуви. Местом деятельности Мухаббатхон является торговый центр «Садбарг» города Душанбе.  Свои товары в основном закупает из поставщиков с Китая и Турции. 
Мухаббатхон имеет своих постоянных клиентов. В ассортименте ее товара можно найти обувь и одежду на любой вкус. Ее девиз «Клиент – всегда прав»! Учитываю этот девиз она старается  угождать своим клиентом разновидностью ассортиментов своих товаров.
Услышав о программе Кива, она захотела участвовать и в сезон осенней обуви расширить наименование товаров, увеличив товарооборот. Мухаббатхон хочет  получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbathon A. was born in 1961. She is divorced and has three children. She has a higher education and 10 years of experience selling women's clothing and shoes. She works out of the trade center "Sadbarg" in Dushanbe City. She purchases her products primarily from suppliers in China and Turkey. Muhabbathon has her regular clients. Her supply includes all kinds of styles of shoes and clothing. Her motto is "the client is always right" and she tries to provide her clients with a varied assortment of goods. Having heard about Kiva's programs, she wanted to participate and for the autumn season would like to expand her line of goods and increase her turnover. She would like to take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni for 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of product line

loans.name: Sumangul

texts.ru:
Сумангуль предприниматель с 10–и летним стажем. Ей 48 лет, у нее 3 детей. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды на оптовом рынке «Корвон».  С связи с тяжелым финансовым положением она при помощи знакомых решила начать свой бизнес. На свои сбережения она арендовала маленькое место на базаре «Саховат» и стала заниматься продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в ее семейном бюджете. Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и с поставщиков с Китая. Так сейчас сезон школьных форм ее ассортимент товара составляет разные детские школьные одежды как юбочки, брюки, кофточки и т.д. 
С наступлением осени ей хотелось пополнить ассортимент товара с подходящим детским и подростковым одеждами.  Сумангуль хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони  сроком на 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sumangul A. has been an entrepreneur for 10 years. She's 48 and has three children. She trades in children's clothing at the wholesale market "Korvon." Because of a difficult financial situation, she started in business with the assistance of her friends. She rented a small space at the "Sakhobat" bazar and began to sell children's clothes. Her income from her business became the main financial source for her family budget. She buys products from the "Korvon" wholesale market and from Chinese suppliers. As this is now the season for school uniforms, her supply line is mostly school clothing such as skirts, pants, trousers, etc. With the start of the autumn, she would like to increase her supply line with suitable clothing for children and youth, and would like to take out a loan of 2000 somoni for a five month period.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: La

texts.en: Mrs. La L. is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is married. The family lives in Kork Thlork Leu commune in the Siem Reap Province. She has been growing rice since 1980 and typically earns around 5,000 Riel (US $1.25) per day. Because growing rice is the main source of income in La's family, she wants to try to develop and increase her rice yield by purchasing another plot of farmland and improving farming techniques by using fertilizer and paying for labor. She faces the obstacle of lacking capital, and she is requesting a loan to achieve her plan.

loans.use: To purchase more farmland and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru:
Донаева Иноят родилась1960 года, замужем имеет 2 детей. Предпринимательством занимается уже больше 10–и лет.   Направление бизнеса продажа детской одежды. В данный момент большую часть ее товара составляет школьные формы, кофточки, юбочки с разнообразными оборками и тюлями. Также имеются в ассортименте одежда для мальчишек, это модные и стильные костюмы и брюки для повседневной носки. 
Иноят сама мать и знает вкус детей. Она занимается торговлей на оптовом рынке «Корвон» и закупает эти товары у оптовиков. С целю расширения бизнеса Иноят хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони  сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inoyat D. was born in 1960. She is married and has two children. She has been an entrepreneur for over 10 years selling children's clothes. At this time, most of her stock is school uniforms, blouses and skirts with a variety of frills and tulles. She also carries boys clothing, including fashionable suits and slacks for daily wear. Inoyat herself is a mother and knows children's tastes. She trades at the wholesale market "Korvon" and purchases her goods from the wholesalers. In order to expand her business, Inoyat would like to take a loan of 3000 somoni for six months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Мирзоеву Файзулло 39 лет, имеет 4 детей. У него особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа пищи. Этим делом он занимается 8 лет. Он взял в аренду маленькое помещение в Центральном универмаге города Душанбе, где наняв работников ведет свою предпринимательскую деятельность. В продаже все виды национальных блюд и кое что из европейской кухни. Там у него можно вкусно пообедать, выпить прохладительных напитков, покушать фруктов и овощей или просто посидеть с друзьями а главное недорого!  
  Узнав о программе Кива он захотела участвовать. Файзулло хочет  получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzullo M. is 39 years old and has 4 children. He has his own business. He prepares and sells food. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He rents a space in the central market of Dushanbe city, where he works with several additionaly hired people. He sells a wide range of European dishes. There, people can have a tasty lunch along with cold drinks, eat fruits and vegetables, or just sit with their friends and enjoy. The main thing is that it is not very expensive. When he found out about Kiva, he wanted to participate. Fayzullo would like to obtain a loan for 4,100 somoni for 12 months.


Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, rice, and drinks

loans.name: Zaynambi

texts.ru:
Зарифова Зайнамби замужем, имеет четырех детей. Она торгует мужской одеждой на рынке «Панчшер». У нее 5 лет опыта в этой деятельности. В ее ассортименте большое выбор джинсовых, шерстяных  и шелковы брюк, а также сорочек и обуви. Этот бизнес приносит ей хорошие доходы. Также Зайнамби дома занимается пошивом женской национальной одежды.  
Зайнамби нужны средства для проведения мероприятия и чтоб ее активы в бизнесе не уменьшились, она решила воспользоваться дополнительными средствами и хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони.
texts.en:
Zaynambi Z. is married and has 4 children. She sells men's clothing on the "Pancher" market. She has 5 years worth of experience in this business. She sells a large assortment of denim, wool, and silk shirts along with pants and shoes. This business earns her very good profits. In addition, Zaynambi sews traditional women's clothing at home.

Zaynambi needs funds for an event. So that she does not decrease the amount of money that is cycled through her business, she decided to use additional funds and obtain a loan for 4,100 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fund an event

loans.name: Iksan

texts.id: Iksan (36 tahun) bekerja sebagai tukang ojek, yaitu usaha angkutan sepeda motor. Usaha ini sudah dijalani bertahun-tahun dengan penghasilan rata-rata Rp.50.000 –Rp.70.000 per hari. Penghasilan bersih yang didapatnya disisihkan untuk diirimkan ke Jawa untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Saat ini, Iksan bersama istrinya Sukini tinggal di Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar kost dengan membayar per bulan. Istrinya bekerja sebagai penyulam atau penjahit. Rencananya pinjaman dari KIVA melalui DINARI bias dipakai untuk membeli sepeda motor bekas, dan nantinya dia akan mempekerjakan satu orang orang pekerja yang membantunya mencari penumpang. Dia berharap, dengan bertambahnya kendaraan yang dia miliki, usaha ini bias member dia penghasilan lebih sehingga dia bisa menabung untuk masa depan anaknya. Saat ini anak satu-satunya tinggal di Jawa bersama kakek dan neneknya.
texts.en:
Iksan 36 years old works as a motorcycle transporter, where he fetches people around on his bike. He has been working on this line for many years, and he earns about Rp.50.000 to Rp.70.000 per day. He sends his salary back to Jawa to support his child's education. At this moment he lives with his wife Sukini is Denpasar in a rented room. His wife works as a seamstress. With the financial assistance from Kiva via Dinari, he hopes to buy another motorcycle and employ one worker to help him. He hope that with an extra motorcycle he will be able to increase his income and start saving for his child's future. His only child currently live with his sister and grandmother in Jawa.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli Motor Bekar

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Mrs. Poy E. is 24 years old and married to Mr. Rik Vorn, who is pictured. They live in Kork Thlork Leu Commune in the Siem Reap Province and have no children. She has been raising pigs since 2004 and earns approximately 5,000 Riel (US $1.25) per day. Her husband saws wood and earns wages of around 4,000 Riel (US $1.00) per day. Poy and her husband work hard every day due to increasing family expenses.

She wants to expand her pig-raising business to increase her family's income. Because she lacks the capital, she is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: D. Dilorom is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Dilorom has been selling women's clothing and underwear at the clothing market of Spitamen town, Tajikistan, for the last six years. A dedicated entrepreneur, Dilorom runs her business day after day with a cheerful smile and a desire to meet the needs of her customers. She has gained a wealth of experience and loyal customers along the way. No one else in her market offers the selection and prices that she does. Forced to start her own business after she had to leave her previous job, Dilorom is grateful for the income it has provided through the years. IMON is happy to be able to assist entrepreneurs like Dilorom. She has proven to be an excellent loan client and has never had a late payment. She has requested a loan of $600 for the term of 6 months to help her purchase new inventory and update her product selection. We look forward to continuing to help her business develop and flourish.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
K. Zarrina is 29 years old. She is married with three children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Spitamen town, where the demand is always very consistent and high. National dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. K. is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works for these dresses. She is very perseverant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her store for 10 years. Zarrina has about $3500 in inventory at the moment.

Zarrina is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for quality results and Zarrina has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like her venture to continue to grow. Today, she is requesting a loan of $750 for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics and increase the range of goods

loans.name: Arslon

texts.en:
K. Arslon is 35 years old, married, and has four children. He owns a small stall at the Spitamen market, and sells children’s clothing. Since joining IMON’s loan program, his life and business have changed dramatically. Arslon now has enough income to provide for his family’s basic needs. He believes that the continued expansion of his business in crucial to his children’s future and success.

Arslon is requesting a loan of $1175 in order to improve his business and extend his customer base. This will help his family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise and goods

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
M. Gulnora is 36 years old. She is married with two adorable children. She currently sells men’s garments. For more than seven years she has worked in Spitamen, Tajikistan, which is one of the busiest markets and allows for a good number of sales. Apart from watching over her business, Gulnora is responsible for raising her two children. She states that it's not an easy job; you have to keep watch over the kids' education and check up on their homework in high school.

Gulnora is a dynamic, active and creative woman, and she is always looking to add more products to sell in her business. She recently started to sell shoes, and has earned good profits since the first month. She invested her previous loans from IMON in spring clothes and shoes. Now she would like to continue adding more products and variety to her business, and she is asking for a loan to obtain school supplies to sell. For this reason she is requesting 3300 Somoni ($975) for the term of 12 months. Gulnora hopefully waits for your favorable response.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and clothing.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alishier is married, and has four children. His wife is pictured here, helping him with their family business. Alishier began his own business 6 years ago selling clothes and shoes to provide a greater income for his family. He wanted to provide his children with a good education and a better quality of life. Since then, he has been hard at work and busy maintaining his business.

Alishier would like to request a loan of $925 in order to restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season. Be an important part of Alishier’s family life by contributing to the growth of his business. They sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and goods

loans.name: I Made Indra

texts.id: Indra B. (37) memiliki usaha sebagai petani agrobisnis yang bergerak dibidang pertanian padi dan palawija. Lahan yang dimiliki ditanam bergantian dengan tanaman lain seperti padi dan kedelai, tetapi yang dominan adalah padi. Usaha ini sudah dijalaninya beberapa tahun, dan untuk kali ii dia memerlukan dana untuk dipakai sebagai modal member sarana pendukung pertanian seperti traktor dan pupuk. Dia sangat berharap dari modal yang didapat dari KIVA kali ini bisa meningkatkan hasil dari panen padi nantinya. Selain itu, pendampingan dan penyuluhan bagi para petani di sekitarnya sering dilakukan, dengan tujuan agar mereka juga bisa mendapat hasil maksimal dari usaha pertanian mereka. Saat ini Indra B. tinggal di Buana Kubu - Denpasar dengan istri dan dua anaknya. Dengan menempati rumah sendiri, mereka tidak harus membayar sewa seperti kebanyakan orang dilingkungannya.
texts.en:
Indra B. (37) is in the business of agriculture. He grows paddy and soy bean. He needs fund to buy farming equipments such as tractor and fertilizers.

He hopes the capital that he gets from KIVA can help him improving the output of his agriculture business.

In addition, training to local farmers are given regularly to enable them to get optimum result from their farms.

Indra together with his wife and 2 children live in Buana Kubu - Denpasar. They live in their own house.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agriculture and farming equipments (Membali Sarana Pendukung Pertanian)

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.en:
S. Fakhriddin is 26 years old. He is a loving husband, and the father of two children. For a long time he has been running his own business in a store which he rents. Fakhriddin began his own store with his hard earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He has been selling different kinds of car paints and putties in his store for the past 3 years. Over the years, Fakhriddin has acquired the knowledge and skills required for his business. His brother, who is pictured in the photo, helps Fakhriddin with the business. Their goal for their business is to establish it as a great success.

Fakhriddin is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to provide a quality level of service for his customers. He will use the loan to purchase more merchandise and increase the range of his inventory. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To restock supplies and increase range of sold goods

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
S. is 25 years old, married, and has one daughter. She currently owns a small saloon where she sells and provides rentals of traditional wedding dresses and national wedding dresses. Because there are many clients in S.’s area, her business is steadily growing and expanding. Her business provides a substantial contribution to her family’s income.

S. would like to request a loan of $1125 in order to restock her inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season. S. has successfully completed five loans with IMON, and has been on time with each loan cycle. With your help she’ll be able to keep moving ahead.

loans.use: Purchasing new merchandise.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mr Chen S. and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Sngoun, have five children. He fishes in Tonle Sap Lake in Spean Thnort Commune, Siem Reap Province, and grows rice with his wife. They work hard every day and the main family income is from growing rice that produces one crop per year. The season for rice is beginning and in order to increase the crop yield, he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for plowing and laborers. Chen's wife is pictured because Chen is unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay for farmland plowing and laborers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
T. Ali is 47 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is pictured here, helping with the business. He is a market vendor at the local market, “Somon-bozor”, which is famous for its low prices. With three years of experience working in the market, Ali knows how to operate a successful business and establish loyal clients. T. and his wife want to provide a better life and quality education for their children, and believe that the business is crucial to that goal.

T. is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase merchandise and offer a wide selection of items for his customers and increase his income. He and his wife sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the new goods for selling.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Heang is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Sok Sann, is 37. They have been farming since 1990. Their combined income is 12,000 Riel (US $3.00) per day. They live in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province, and have two young children in school.

They would like to use a Kiva loan of 500,000 Riel (US $125.00) to purchase fertilizer and pay for farmland plowing during the rainy season that is the time for the rice crop. The loan will increase their income to sustain their family's living expenses and their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pay for farmland plowing

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Sakina J. is 34 and married. She has 3 boys and 1 girl, ages 19, 15, 8 and 3. She started her business two years ago Ð a shop where she sells clothes and toiletries. With these items, her monthly profit is about $171. Sometimes she is able to also stock drinks and phone vouchers which will increase her monthly profit to about $257. She works daily from 7am until 8pm.

Previously Sakina has borrowed and successfully paid pack two loans from Tujijenge, which were used to expand her business. This third loan she hopes to receive will also be used to increase the number and variety of supplies in her shop.

Sakina will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members sell clothes and charcoal. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing and toiletries.

loans.name: Thi Ly's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Lý Ms 06020001 năm nay 54 tuổi, chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, Đồng thời chị còn rất tích cực tham gia phong trào của nhóm, cụm. Lần này chị đăng ký tham gia vay ở mức 4.265.000 VND dể đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hàng tạp hoá, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây, con chị đi làm có thu nhập ổn định, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình mỗi ngày thu được từ 130.000 VND đến 150.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Dành Ms 06020002 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi
  • chị Nguyễn thị Cam Ms 06020004 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • anh Nguyễn văn Giang Ms 06020005 vay mức 1.568.000 VND để mua cám bò
  • Nguyễn thị Liễu Ms 06020013 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua than đóng gạch
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ly (ID Number 06020001), 54 years old, has already obtained one loan through the SEDA Fund and repaid the loan fully. She is always actively involved in the activities of the group. This time, she would like to borrow 4,265,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Everyday, she manages her general store in the market while her husband works as a construction worker. Her children are also all working with stable incomes, so her family's daily income reaches 130,000VND to 150,000VND (about 8.20USD to 9.40USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Danh (ID Number 06020002), borrows 4,256,000VND to raise cattle.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cam (ID Number 06020004), borrows 3.360,000VND to purchase breeding pigs.
  • Mr. Nguyen Van Giang (ID Number 06020005), borrows 1,568,000VND to purchase cow feeds.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Lieu (ID Number 06020013), borrows 4,256,000VND to make bricks.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Sakina Juma's Majohe Halisi Group

texts.en:
Sakina J. is 34 and married. She has 3 boys and 1 girl, ages 19, 15, 8, and 3. She started her business two years ago: a shop where she sells clothes and toiletries. With these items, her monthly profit is about US$ 170. Sometimes she is also able to stock drinks and phone vouchers which will increase her monthly profit to about US$ 260. She works daily from 7am until 8pm.

Previously Sakina has borrowed and successfully paid back two loans from Tujijenge, which were used to expand her business. This third loan she hopes to receive will also be used to increase the number and variety of goods in her shop.

Sakina will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members sell clothes and charcoal. These members guarantee for one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture Sakina is on the right in pink. Stellah, who sells charcoal, is in the center. Agness, who also sells clothing, is on the left. Magreth who is not pictured here is a teacher.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothing and toiletries

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mrs. Met P., 44 years old, and her husband, Mr. Phet Kav, 45, lives in Snam Preah Commune, Pursat Province, with their three children. One child is a student and the other two are construction workers. Met works as a farmer growing rice and raises pigs. She earns about US $2.00 per day. Her husband earns US $2.00 per day from his battery recharge service.

Her husband's business is growing and attracting customers, and she is requesting a loan of US $300.00 to replace her husband's battery-charging machine. This will allow her increasing income and better support his family's expenses. Mrs. P.'s husband is pictured because P. is unvalaible.

loans.use: To buy a replacement battery-charging machine

loans.name: Thi Liên's Group

texts.vi:
chị Trần thị Liên năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 06020006 chị tham gia vay vốn của chương trình được 1 chu kỳ, chị hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, đầy đủ và đúng giờ. Chị rất thích hình thức vay, trả này vì nó không phải trả số tiền lớn vào một thời điểm, mà lại được trả góp. Giúp chị tích luỹ được tiền. Lần này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 4.704.000 VND để chăn nuôi, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thợ xây, con đi lái xe nên có thu nhập thường xuyên đảm bảo cho việc trả vốn, mức thu của gia đình từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Trương thị Toàn Ms 06020007 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua bò
  • chị Nuyễn thị thanh Xuân Ms 06020008 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị Hoàng thị Chuyên Ms 06020010 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi
  • anh Lê tuấn Trường Ms 06020011 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh
  • anh Nguyễn quang Dự Ms 06020012 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh than
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hương Ms 06020023 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thêm Ms 06020009 vay mức 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi vịt, ngan,
texts.en:
Mrs Trần thị Liên is 48 years old. She has successfully paid back a loan in time. She likes this program very much because she can make small payments so it enables her to save. This time she is seeking 4.704.000 VND to raise livestock. Her husband is a contruction worker and her son is a truck driver so their family income is stable and it would be easy for her to make the weekly payment. Her family income is 150.000 VND - 200.000 VND a day. Other members of her group are:
  • Mrs Trương thị Toàn, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy calves
  • Mrs Nuyễn thị thanh Xuân, she is seeking 3.808.000 VND. She sells basic goods
  • Mrs Hoàng thị Chuyên Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raises livestock
  • Mr Lê tuấn Trường Ms, he is seeking 4.256.000 VND to start a business
  • Mr Nguyễn quang Dự Ms, he is seeking4.256.000 VND. He sells charcoal
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Hương Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raise pigs
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Thêm Ms, she is seeking 2.016.000 VND. She raise ducks and geese

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise livestock

loans.name: Ismail Rashid's Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Ismail R. is 47 and married with 5 children. For the past two years, he has run a vegetable business. He heads upcountry to places like Iringa and Lushoto once a week to purchase vegetables. He then brings them back to Dar es Salaam and sells them wholesale to vendors in the market. His monthly profit is about US$ 300.

This will be Ismail's first loan from Tujijenge and he is very excited to get started! He intends to use this loan to purchase a large amount of tomatoes to sell in the markets around Dar es Salaam. Ismail will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans. Others in the group are engaged in a wide variety of businesses, including tailoring, café ownership, tending a grocery store, and utensils seller.

In the photo, Ismail is in the center with the white shirt.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes to sell in the market

loans.name: Mrs. Duch Sokheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which is located in Boeng Krum Leu Village in Kandal Province consists of twelve people. Mrs. Duch S. is the village bank president. She was born in 1966 and she now lives in the village mentioned. She is a pig breeder who is raising twelve pigs.

Since her pigs are now growing bigger and bigger, Mrs. Duch S. faces a problem because she does not have enough money for pig feed to support them. Thus, Mrs. Duch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig feed for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Keth Nai, is a policeman who can make KHR 12, 5000 (US$ 32) to support his family. Mrs. Duch S. has five children, one of whom is 20 years old and he is a policeman who can make the same salaR. as his father. The remaining four are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Mrs. Loeng Shinoen's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine women form the Village Bank in BoE. Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. LoE. S. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Kao Sareth, is a labourer who digs the small river and moves soil to fill another place for a salary. Aside from this business, he is a fisherman.

With these two businesses, Mr. Kao Sareth can make around US$ 4.50 to support his household. In his fishing business, Mr. Kao Sareth can catch few fish because he does not have enough fishing equipment so his wife, Mrs. LoE. S., decided to ask for a loan to buy fish nets in order to improve her husband's business. Mrs. LoE. S. has three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are still too young to work or study because they are one and four.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fish nets in order to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokea S. is 37 years old and has been farming rice for about eighteen years. She is married to Mr. Sokun Shav, 39, and they live in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province. They have three children, all of whom are living in the family home and are in school. She can earn 8,000 Riel (US $2.00) per day.

To prepare for the coming season, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 Riel (US $50.00) to purchase fertilizer to use for the rice crop. Sokea hopes the loan will increase her income and help to pay her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Thi Oanh's Group

texts.vi:
chị C. thị Oanh năm nay 48 tuổi Ms 06020014, chị là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó, nhiệt tình và năng động. Chị làm chi hội trưởng phụ nữ tại thôn nên chị có điều kiện tiếp cận với các dịch vụ vốn vay, nhờ có chị mà các chị em phụ nữ khác có điều kiện tiếp cận với các loại vốn đặc biệt là tài chính vi mô Bình Minh. Chị tuyên truyền những ưu điểm của vốn, đồng thời tuyên truyền, giúp đỡ, hướng dẫn chị em làm kinh tế để cung nhau thoát nghèo. Chị và nhóm đã vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và trả vốn rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 4.704.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chồng và con đi làm công nhân, nên gia đình chị có thu nhập ổn định từ 150.000 VND đến 180.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Lê thị Hà Ms 06020015 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để thu mua phế liệu
  • chị Nguyễn thị Phương Ms 06020017 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • anh Nguyễn ngọc Cường MS 06020018 vay mức 4.256.000 VND mua than để sản xuất gạch ngói
  • chị Nguyễn thị Yến Ms 06020019 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để kinh doanh quần áo
  • chị P. thị Thơm Ms 06020020 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi vịt đẻ
  • chị Hoàng thị Hường Ms 06020021 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị N. thị Xuân Ms 06020022 vay mức 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi gà, lợn
texts.en:
Mrs C. thị Oanh is 48 years old. She is a hard working woman, active & enthusiast. She is the leader of the women group in her village so it gives her opportunity to come to know about SEDA. Thanks to her, other women from her village have been able to get loans form SEDA as well. She spread words around about the benefits of programs like SEDA. She guides and supports other members to overcome poverty. She and her group has paid back a loan successfully. This time she is seeking 4.704.000 VND to invest in her pig raising business. Her husband and son have a job so their family income is stable, 150.000 VND -180.000 VND a day. Other members of the group are:
  • Mrs Lê thị Hà Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She collects/sells waste material
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Phương, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raises pigs
  • Mr Nguyễn ngọc Cường, he is seeking 4.256.000 VND. He is a brick maker
  • Mrs Nguyễn thị Yến Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She sells clothes
  • Mrs P. thị Thơm Ms, she is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raise ducks
  • Mrs Hoàng thị Hường Ms, she is seeking 3.360.000 VND. She raises pigs
  • Mrs N. thị Xuân Ms, she is seeking 2.016.000 VND. She raises pigs and chickens

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Mrs. Map H. is a 37-year-old farmer and lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Siem Reap Province, with her husband, Mr. Chen Chon, who is 38 years old. They have three children who are in school. They both earn a total of about 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day growing rice and would like to increase their crop.

Because this is now the farming season in Cambodia, they need capital to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop. Map would like to request a loan to help her increase their rice yield and support their family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop

loans.name: Ahinful

texts.en: S. Ahinful is single and has no children. She has received schooling through junior high. S. sells tin tomatoes, tin fish, Milo and other items at Abura, which she has done since 2006. S. uses her income to pay for utility bills. S. will use the loan to purchase milo, milk and other groceries. With the new profits from her expanded business, S. plans to reinvest and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase milo, milk and other groceries for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single parent and has 5 children. She has received schooling through Senior High. Elizabeth sells fresh tomatoes and also fries plantains for sale at Abura, which she has done for over 20 years.

Elizabeth uses her income to take care of her family's financial needs. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase 5 more crates of fresh tomatoes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: purchase 5 more crates of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. has been selling shoes and bags at Abura for over 6 years. Agnes has received a senior high school education.  She is married to a teacher and has 5 children. She is responsible for providing most of the needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy dozens of shoes and bags for resale. She hopes to use the new profits for reinvestment into the business.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith A. is a widow and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Senior High. Judith sells rice and beans at Abura, which she has done since 1999. Judith uses her income to take care of her family's financial needs. Judith will use the loan to purchase bags of rice and beans. With the new profits from her expanded business, Judith plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and beans.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through informal education. Esi sells maize and also sells Kenkey (fermented corn dough) which she prepares with corn. It is one of the most frequently eaten foods in Ghana, and she has been making it for over 10 years. Her husband is a cleaner.

Esi uses her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees and utility bills. Esi will use this loan to purchase bags of maize. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina I. sells thread, linen, etc. She is a seamstress by profession since 2000, working at Abura. Amina has received vocational schooling.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is responsible for helping her husband meet the financial needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy fabric, linen and other sewing materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, linen, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Diop

texts.fr: Mme DIOP, prepare et vend de la nourriture chaque jour ; avec cette activite, elle parvient a subvenir a ses besoins. Avec, la demande qui ne cesse de croitre, elle sollicite un pret pour satisfaire a sa clientele.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diop prepares and sells food every day. Through this activity she manages to provide for her needs. With demand increasing continually, she is requesting a loan in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Catering

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce K. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Senior High. Joyce sells baby dresses and cooking utensils at Abura, which she has done for over 5 years. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Joyce uses her income to help take care of the family's financial needs. Joyce will use the loan to purchase baby dresses and cooking utensils for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to reinvest to expand the business further.

loans.use: purchase baby dresses and cooking utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Sagna

texts.fr: Grace au consommable informatique qu'elle vend, M. SAGNA, parvient a faire face a ses besoins. Maintenant elle demande un pret pour augmenter son parcking informatique.
texts.en:
M. Sagna manages to meet her needs through the sale of computer supplies. She is now requesting a loan to increase her computer stock.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer stock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose B. is 46 years old. She is wife and mother of four kids. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains source of livelihood.  She has been selling yams, pepper and dried fish for twenty years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yam, pepper and fish from the farmers and fish mongers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk of yams, pepper and dried fish to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her in school. Rose is a member of a community group called Ruth Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy bulk of yams, dried fish and pepper.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria K., 53 year old trader is married with six children. Among these children three have completed college. Victoria supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and mortar. Selling of used clothing is lucrative in Ghana many people patronize it, especially the economically active poor. Mortar is used to pound fufu, which one of favorite diet among most Ghanaians.  She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and mortar to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and mortar.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Sarah sells onions at Abura, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is an ex-policeman. Sarah uses her income to pay for family expenses.

Sarah will use the loan to purchase 6 more bags of onions for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to add to her capital to increase sales.

loans.use: purchase 6 more bags of onions for sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia K. is married and has four kids. She lives with her family at Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 40 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and sells ladies and children wears like blouse and skirts, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past ten years. She is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers

loans.name: Tatu's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 39 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 20. She has been a charcoal and juice seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tatu is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and juice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with coconut sales, soap and spices sales, tailoring, and charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and juice for her business

loans.name: Sud Alimimium Group

texts.fr: Sud Alimimium est une societe, compose de jeunes, et dirige par Cheikh Tidiane. Ils ont un atelier, qui leur permet de repondre a la demande de la clientele tout en formant des jeunes. Grace a ces activites les deux associes gagne leur pain quotidien. A present, ils sollicite un pret pour renforcer leur atelier.
texts.en:
Sud Alimimium is a company made up of young people and headed by Cheikh Tidiane. They have a workshop which allows them to respond to customer demand at the same time as training young people. Through this business, the two partners earn their daily bread. They are now requesting a loan to improve their workshop.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capacity

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is 25 year old single lady. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now runs a clothing shop and sells ladies and children wears like blouse and skirts, batik tie and dye, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past five years. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 54 year old man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He is agro chemical seller and sells various kinds of chemicals like herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farm lands. With the loan, Nicholas wants to purchase more supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines serves the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his kids’ education. He would be very appreciative for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of herbicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Asha's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Asha is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 7, 5, and 2 years old. She has been a coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 65 from her sales.

Asha is now requesting a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, bites sales, and fish sales.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. née en 1966 à Mbacké est mariée avec 09 enfants plus 03 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 2 ans. Fatou fait un commerce de fruits locaux comme les pastèques, les mangues et autres. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assister sa famille.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou D. was born in 1966 in Mbacké, and is married with 9 children and 3 others in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 2 years. Fatou has a business selling local fruit such as watermelons, mangoes, and such. Her income allows her to support her family. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell local fruit

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en:
Ziada is 25 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is 5 years old and one is only 5 months old. She has been a clothes, shoes, and diesel seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Ziada has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Ziada now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes, shoes and diesel fuel for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more clothes, shoes and diesel fuel

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is 35 years old. She is a single parent of two kids. Her kids are in school. Beatrice is resourceful and enterprising. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has a strategic business location, giving her favorable business sales. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and increase income level. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to facilitate her food production. She says thanks for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr: Assa D., née en 1958, mariée avec 02enfants plus 02 autres à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 3ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits cosmétiques et des portables. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins.<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Assa D., born in 1958 and married with 2 children and 2 others in her care, has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 3 years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling cosmetic products and cell phones. The income drawn from her business allows her to meet her needs. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell cosmetic products and cell phones

loans.name: Agyei

texts.en: Agyei B. is a 35 year old local restaurant operator. He is married and has three kids, two of whom attend school. He prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and is eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Agyei says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and that he needs the support of a loan to enable him to meet his production expenditures. With the loan, he will purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare his meals. He would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 3 years old. She has been a clothes seller since in 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Bahati is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Astou Garage

texts.fr: Astou Garage D., mariée avec 03enfants plus 02 autres à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Thièkène depuis 3ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce  de fruits (mangues) pour accroître ses revenus. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits de la période..<b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance<b/>.
texts.en:
Astou Garage D. is married with 3 children and 2 others in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Thièkène for 3 years. She would like to strengthen her business selling fruit (mangoes) in order to increase her income. Her business consists of buying and re-selling seasonal fruit. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fruit

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret D. is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of her kids have completed university. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Margaret belongs to the community group called Faith Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Rizki is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is 20 years old and one is only 3 months old. She has been a phone voucher seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 40 from her sales.

Riziki is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. is 26 years old. She is married and has two kids. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. in her neighborhood. With the loan, she wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Alice belongs to the community group called Great provider Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. is a 24 year old single lady. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now runs a clothing stand and sells clothing materials and slippers over the last one year. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and slippers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married but has no child. He is 34 year old trader. He runs a mother care shop and sells assorted kids care materials like diapers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc. for four years now. He does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, he wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. He believes the loan will enable him to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. He would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of dippers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupé, que en su mayoría se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo ya está en su 7 ciclo del programa comité de mujeres y sus inicios y su conformación se debió a la gran colaboración que brindo la señora Teresa Martínez, quien inicialmente fue la coordinadora del grupo y en su domicilio se realizó las primeras reuniones del comité.

Todas son vecinas del barrio, y una de las virtudes de este comité el buen cumplimiento de las normas y reglamento del programa de comité de mujeres emprendoras, y esta demostrado por su buen cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas, además poseen un ahorro gracias a las actividades que realizan cada fin de semana como ser feria de comidas, rifas, torneos deportivos, entre otras actividades.

Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 833.000 y lo invierten para la producción de sus productos descriptos más arriba. Todas tienen actividades que desarrollan para aumentar el ingreso de sus hogares, además de ser amas de casa. Entra esas actividades tenemos vendedoras de chipas que es la actividad más popular de este comité ya que 11 de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de esta comida típica muy consumida en nuestro país. Dos de ellas poseen despensas y las dos últimas se dedican a la venta de ropas.

El comité tiene como objetivo este mes de Agosto la de juntar a todos los niños de la cuadra y el día del niño ofrecerle una chocolatada, incluidos algunos juegos infantiles.
texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 15 female workers from the town of San Francisco in the city of Caacupe. They are mainly dedicated to the making of Chipas, a local dish of the country. The group is actually in the their seventh cycle of the this program, with its beginning and organization mainly attributed to the work of Mrs. Teresa M., who initially was the coordinator of the group, and in her home organized the very first group meetings. All are neighbors in this area, and one of the virtues of the committee is to carry on tradition by organizing committee programs. This is demonstrated by their routinely successful repayment rate of their loans. On top of that, they have been able to save thanks to the activities that they hold every weekend offering food, raffles, games, and more. All of the members receive a portion of 833,000 guarani (aprox $200usd), and they invest it into the activities previously mentioned. They all have specific activities that they develop in order to increase their profits, in addition to being homemakers. Among the things that they partake in doing is to be Chipas vendors, which is the most popular activity since 11 of the member partake in the sale of this very popular national dish. Two of them have small stores, and the last two sell clothing. The committee’s objective in the month of August is to gather all of the children from the neighborhood together for Children’s Day and have a fair for them with games and entertainment.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials to make Chipas like, starch, cheese, and vegetable oil.  Others will buy cloths like shorts, shirts, and socks to sell.

loans.name: João Cris&oac

texts.pt:
João Crisóstomo A. tem 53 anos, nasceu e cresceu em Inhambane, é casado e Pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 24 a 7 anos respectivamente .O mais velho esta a trabalhar na  visinha Africa do sul, o segundo está fazer 1°ano de faculdade e os outros mais novos estão a frequentar o ensino Geral. João mudou –se para Namaacha uma vila  fronteiriça  com a Swazilandia a pos a conclusão do seu curso de agronomia ( nivel medio).

Em 1977 João começou a trabalhar na Escola Agraria de Namaacha como professor e no ano seguinte contraio matrimonio com a sua Esposa. Nesta Escola trabalhou apenas durante 4anos e foi transferido para Direcção Distrital da Educacão de Namaacha, onde trabalha até então como funcionario permanente, ocupando a função de Tecnico de Produção e Alimemtação Escolar e aufere um salário liquido de 4.500,00mtn mas não consegue poupar nada no final do mês devido ao custo elevado de vida. João vive actulmente com a sua familia numa casa cedida pelos serviços e está a construir a sua propria casa no mesmo distrito. Para alem da sua familia João responsabiliza-se pelo sobrinho orfão de pais que vive em Inhambane, manda lhe uma sexta basica mensalmente no valor de 500.00mtn.

João para iniciar a sua obra contraiu primeiramente um emprestimo no Banco Internacional de moçambique ( BIM) no valor de 16,000.00mtn e pagou num periodo de 2anos. Em 2007 conheceu a hluvuku atraves dos colegas e solicitou um emprestimo no valor de 8,000.00mtn e foi usado para compra de material de construção para sua obra, este é segundo emprestimo com hluvuku e o primeiro com kiva no valor de 9.000,00mtn e será usado para mesmo fim.
Pretende futuramente contrair mas emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa e construir muro de vedação.
texts.en:
João Crisóstomo A. is 53 years old. He was born and raised in Inhambane. He is married and the father of 6 children with ages between 7 and 24. The oldest is working in neighboring South Africa. His second is in his 1st year of college, and the younger ones are in general education. João moved to Namaacha, a town bordering with Swaziland and concluded his course of agronomy (middle level). In 1977 João began working in the Agrarian School of Namaacha as a professor, and in the following year he was married to his wife. He worked in that school for only 4 years and was transferred to the District Direction of Education of Namaacha where he worked as a permanent official occupying the function of Technician of Production and School Food. He earned a salary of 4,500MT but was unable to save any money due to the elevated cost of living. João currently lives with his family in a house given up to the services and is building his own home in the same district. Besides his family, João is responsible for his orphaned nephew that lives in Inhambane. He sends him 500MT on a monthly basis. To begin his work João first received a loan from the International Bank of Mozambique (BIM) for 16,000MT and paid it off after 2 years. In 2007 he came to know Hluvuku through some coleagues and solicited a loan for 8,000MT which he used to purchase construction materials. This is the second loan with Hluvuku and the first through Kiva for 9,000MT which will be used to the same end. In the future he intends to ask for another loan so he can furnish his home and construct a wall.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús (Heart Of Jesus) Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardín, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 486.000 cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a la que la presidenta actual la señora Salvadora M. pudo contactar con el oficial de comités de la Fundación Paraguya, Freddy Bordón quienes le informo de los requisitos para formar un comités y rápidamente lograron reunir a las 15 señoras interesadas en formar parte del comités.

La señora Salvadora, comenta que el grupo de mujeres están llevando acabo un proyecto que esta teniendo buenos resultados y es la siguiente, llevar a exponer sus productos al costado de la ruta 2 a la altura del Km 52, especialmente los fines de semanas que es cuando la ciudad recibe a los fieles de la Virgen de Caacupé, los primeros resultados fueron muy auspiciosos, ya que registraron buen movimiento de ventas.

Con los prestamos que recibieron de la Fundación Paraguaya pudieron comprar, gran cantidad de semillas, plantas, abonos, macetas, etc. pues de las 15 integrantes 9 de ellas poseen viveros de plantas; el resto de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de bebidas, venta varias de forma ambulante y otras poseen despensas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 15 hard-working women from the Cabañas de Caacupé area. Most of the women grow and sell garden plants. They are long-time residents of the neighborhood and all help one another in order to sell their products.

The group is currently in its 8th loan cycle with Fundación Paraguay's Mujeres Emprendedoras group loan program. Each group member will receive an average of 486,000 guaranís apiece (US $121.80).

The group was founded thanks to the efforts of the current president, Salvadora M., who contacted Fundación Paraguaya's head of group loans, Freddy Bordón, who told her what the requirements were for forming groups. Soon, they were able to get 15 women interested in forming a group together to meet.

Mrs. Salvadora says that the group of women are carrying out a project that is having very positive results: they are selling their products at Km 52 of Route 2. Sales are especially good on weekends, when religious pilgrims visit the city to honor the Virgin of Caacupé. The group's early results have been very promising, since they have made a good number of sales.

With the loans they received from Fudación Paraguaya, the group members mostly bought great quantities of seeds, plants, fertilizers and pots (9 of the 15 women own plant nurseries; the others sell drinks, work as street vendors or own neighborhood stores).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, seeds, garden plants, pots

loans.name: Eusébio Gilbe

texts.pt:
Eusébio Gilberto M.  é natural de manjacaze província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique tem 59 anos idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos, com idades entre 34, 28, 26, 22, 20 e 18 anos respectivamente e todos são estudantes. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Eusébio Gilberto M. estudou até 11ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, a sua infância fez junto a sua família ate aos 18 anos e depois mudou se da província de Gaza para Lourenço marques para continuar comos estudos e por lá ficou até se casar e fez sua família vivendo lá ate hoje numa casa própria.

Eusébio é funcionário da saúde  a 21 anos na área de medicina. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola de ciências de saúde a 31 anos atrás. Tem um salário mensal de 5.400,00mt não consegue poupar nada.

Eusébio para ele este é o 4º empréstimo na hluvuku e também já se beneficiou dum outro no Novo banco no valor de 7.000,00mt qual usou para compra de produtos para revender ( comercio) o seu sonho é de recondicionar a sua casa para melhor albergar a sua família.
texts.en:
Eusébio Gilberto M. is a native of the Manjacaze province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and the father of 6 children with ages 34, 28, 26, 22, 20, and 18 respectively. All of them are students. He only supports his family. Eusébio Gilberto M. went to school until the 11th grade and did not continue because of poor financial conditions. He spent his childhood with his family until he was 18 when he moved from the province of Gaza to Lourenço marques to continue with his studies. From there he stayed until he married and had a family, and he lives there today in his own home. Eusébio has been a health official for 21 years in the area of medicine. He learned his work in a school of health sciences 31 years ago. He has a monthly salary of 5,400MT but is unable to save anything. This is his 4th loan through Hluvuku, although he also benefited from another loan from the New Bank for 7,000MT which he used to purchase products to resell (commerce). His dream is to refurbish his home so he can improve his family's lodging.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas empresarias informales y actualmente están en 5to. Ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, beneficiándose con un crédito promedio de 750.000 mil guaraníes para cada integrante.

La señora Wilma es la presidenta del comité y como tal es la que mas exige se cumpla a cabalidad las normas que regulan éste programa y entre ellas, destacamos la exigencia de acudir puntualmente a las reuniones semanales, y las que se ausentan deben informar con anticipación el motivo de su inasistencia, caso contario es apercibido por la comisión.

El comité tiene proyectado como otros comités de la zona la de realizar una chocolatada con sorteo de regalos para los niños en su día, que será el día Sábado 16-08-08, así también una característica de este comité es el buen trabajo que vienen realizando en su comunidad como la limpieza de las cuadras, pintata del cordón de la calle, lo cual demuestran que en esa zona hay un grupo de gente muy unido.

Las señoras de este comité poseen actividades diversas entre ellas hay vendedoras de comidas, vendedoras de chipa que es una comida típica muy consumida en nuestro país, despensas, venta de bebidas, otras elaboran y venden dulces y otras poseen comedores donde diariamente dan de comer a personas que trabajan o viven en la zona.
texts.en:
This committee is comprised of a 16 female workforce in the Cabanas company in the city of Caacupe. They all have small informal enterprises, and are in the fifth cycle of the female workforce program committee. This allows them to take advantage of an average credit line of 750,000 guarnies for each member. Wilma is the president of the committee, and as president she organizes the goals and regulates the program. Among the women we emphasize the necessity of attending the weekly reunions and require people to properly notify the group if they need to miss one. The committee has projected like other committees of the area to hold a “chocolatado” which is a very large gathering, and hold drawings for children’s gifts on the 16 of August 2008. Another characteristic of this committee is the great work they are presently doing in the community cleaning the streets, and painting the lines on the road. All of which demonstrates that in this community there is a group of very united people. Amongst all of the women of this committee there are many diverse activities that they take part in, such as food vendors, producers of “chipa” a very typical dish and is highly consumed in our country. There are also everyday product vendors, refreshment vendors, others make and sell candies, and others have food stands where they provide food everyday for the people who work in the area.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for the production of chipas.  For example starch, cheese, vegetable oil, and others will purchase cloths to sell, consumer goods, coal, refresments.

loans.name: Salomão Choquela

texts.pt:
Salomão Choquela X. nasceu em Manhiça, tem 38anos de idade. Ele é casado e pai de três (3) filhos: uma rapariga de 13anos, um rapaz de 11anos e um bebé de 3 meses, os dois mais velhos já vão a escola. Salomão e a sua família mudaram-se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Suazilândia, a procura de emprego.

Salomão estudou até 4ª classe, não continuou com os estudos devido a má condição financeira. Após a paragem com os estudos refugiou se para a vizinha Africa do Sul no tempo da Guerra, onde trabalhou alguns anos como pedreiro e pintor. No fim da Guerra regressou e estalou-se em Namaacha, trabalhou num projecto de criação de frangos, assim ele conseguiu construiu a sua casa e um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no seu quintal para aumentar a renda familiar. Anos depois o negocio do Patrão faliu e Salomão sustenta a sua família na base do negócio, vende produtos de primeira necessidade, seu melhor produto é o açúcar, compra um quilo por 18mtn e vende por 22mtn. Conta com ajuda da sua esposa e trabalham das 6:30h ás 18h tem um rendimento mensal de 6,000.00mtn, mas não consegue poupar nada, pois para além da sua família Salomão ajuda sua mãe que vive noutro Distrito mandando-lhe 500.00mtn mensalmente. 

Este é primeiro empréstimo de Salomão com Hluvuku e com Kiva no valor de 7,000.00mtn e será usado para aumentar o seu stock. Assim ele acredita que vai conseguir satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes, uma vez que esta um pouco distante do mercado. Futuramente pretende pedir mais empréstimos para fazer muro de vedação da sua residência e construir capoeira para criação  de frangos.
texts.en:
Salomão Choquela X. was born in Manhiça and is 38 years old. He is married and the father of three children: a girl of 13, a boy of 11, and a baby of 3 months. The two eldest already go to school. Salomão and his family moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland, to look for employment. Salomão studied until fourth grade. He didn't continue his studies due to the poor financial situation. After stopping his studies, he fled to neighboring South Africa during the war, where he worked several years as a stonemason and painter. At the end of the war, he returned and settled in Namaacha, working on a poultry-raising project. He also constructed his home and a small commercial establishment in his yard to increase his family's income. Years later his boss's business failed, and Salomão now supports his family with his business, selling staple items. His best product is sugar, which he buys at 18 meticais per kilo and sells for 22. He counts on the help of his wife, and they work from 6:30 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening, earning a monthly income of 6000 meticais. However, he doesn't manage to save anything, as besides his family, also Salomão helps his mother, who lives in another district, sending her 500 meticais monthly. This is Salomão's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, in the amount of 7000 meticais, and will be used to increase the amount of stock. In this manner, he believes that he will manage to satisfy the needs of his customers, considering that they are located a bit distant from the market. In the future, he plans to request more loans--to construct a wall around his home, and to construct a coop for raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of stock in his shop

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Mr. Anibal is 44 years old. He's married and has three children - all of school age. They live together in the district of Espartillar, in the city of Carapeguá.

Don Anibal works repairing rubber (tires) and doing blacksmithing in his own home since more than five years ago. He has established a good clientele due to his hard work and dedication to his work.

His desire is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and improve services to his customers. With this loan he will purchase tools.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Aníbal tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, con tres hijos en edad escolar, viven en la compañía Espartillar de la ciudad de Carapeguá.

Don Aníbal se dedica al servicio de gomería y herrería en su propia casa hace más de cinco años, ya posee una clientela formada en la zona, en donde fue progresando de a poco gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación

Su deseo es ir creciendo como microempresario, mejorando los servicios a sus clientes. Con el crédito comprará herramientas.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith's tools.  (para compra de equipos y herramientas de herrería)

loans.name: Inacio Sambulelo

texts.pt:
Inacio Sambulelo N. tem 48anos, nasceu em Cabo Delgado estudou até 5ªclasse e compriu com serviço militar obrigatório,é separado e pai de 6 filhos de idades compreendidas entre 27anos á 11anos.Os três mais velhos já estão empregados e sustenta somente os três ultimos que ainda estão a estudar.
Inacio depois de cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, foi transferido para Maputo, onde esteve atrabalhar com PRM (Policia da Republica Moçambicana) no ano segunte juntou-se com asua esposa. Em 1987 é franferido para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Suazilândia, Inacio uma vez que já tava em conflito com a esposa, separou se dela deixando a com a casa e os filhos e veio viver em Namaacha sozinho numa casa oferecido pelo Estado.Trabalha como Oficial de permanênçia, é funcionario permanente a 29anos, trabalha 24h por dia durante 3dias da semana, oufere mensalmente um salario no valor de 5,853.00mtn e tem uma pensão militar de 4,558.00mtn.Sustenta os seus três filhos mandando lhes uma mesada no valor de 1,000.00 para cada filho e em cada três meses manda 3,000.00mtn para sua mãe em Cabo Delgabo e não consegue poupar nada no final do mês porque está a contruir a sua casa na mesma vila.

Este é terceiro emprestimo de Inacio, segundo com Huvuku e primeiro com Kiva, o primeiro teve com BIM ( Banco Intrnacional de Muçambique), para iniciar a sua obra no valor de 40,000.00mtn e pagou em três anos. Em 2007 conheceu a hluvuku a través dum amigo e pediu o primeiro empretimo de 12,000.00mtn que usou para comprar material de construçào para continuar com a obra, conseguiu pagar antes do prazo. Pede este segundo para concluir a sua obra, assim que concluir de pagar este emprestimo pretende pedir mais para mobilar a sua  casa.
texts.en:
Inacio Sambulelo N. is 48 years old and from Cabo Delgado. He went to school until the fifth grade and fulfilled his compulsory military service. He is divorced and the father of six children between the ages of 27 and 11 years. The three eldest are already employed and supporting the three younger, who are still in school.
