After completing his compulsory military service, Inacio was transfered to Maputo, where he worked in the PRM (Police of the Republic of Mozambique), and in the following year married his wife. In 1987 he was transfered to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland. As he was already in conflict with his wife at that time, Inacio divorced her, leaving her with the house and children, and came to live alone in Namaacha in a house provided by the State. He got a permanent position as a residence officer at 29 years old. He works 24 hours a day, three days a week, earning a monthly salary of 5853 meticais, and has a military pension of 4558 meticais. He supports his three children, sending them a monthly allowance of 1000 apiece, and every three months he sends 3000 meticais to his mother in Cabo Delgado. He doesn't manage to save anything by the end of the month because he is building his house there in the village. This is Inacio's third loan, his second through Hluvuku, and his first with Kiva. His first loan was with the BIM (International Bank of Mozambique), to launch his construction work. It was for 40000 meticais, and he repaid it in three years. In 2007, he became acquainted with Hluvuku through a friend and requested a first loan in the amount of 12000 meticais, which he used to buy construction material to continue the construction project. He was able to repay that loan ahead of time. He requests this second loan to finish the construction. Once he repays this loan, he plans to request another, for furnishing his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 35 years of age, unmarried and without children. He lives in the F. Island region, in the city of Carapeguá. He works as a traveling salesman of many types of goods since about 20 years ago, and also works on a ranch with his family.

Carlos is a gentleman, who is hard-working and enterprising, and who has increasingly progressed as a businessman. Today he already owns to two motorcycles and some cattle, which might serve as collateral and which he'll save to use in a future transaction. Due to his past loans, he's been able to succeed, thanks to his good administration and sacrifice.

With this loan, he plans to purchase sports shoes and blankets / quilts for re-sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, vive en la compañía F. Isla de la ciudad de Carapeguá. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercaderías hace ya veinte años y también trabaja en la chacra con su familia.

Es un señor muy trabajador y emprendedor, que cada vez más va progresando como comerciante, hoy día ya tiene dos motocicletas y ganados vacunos, que le sirven como una garantía y reserva para cualquier eventualidad. A través de sucesivos créditos ha podido salir adelante gracias a su buena administración y sacrificio.

Con el crédito comprará calazados deportivos y colchas para la venta.

loans.use: To purchase sports shoes and blankets or quilts for re-sale.  (compra de calzados deportivos y colchas)

loans.name: Assumane Chical

texts.pt:
Assumane Chical C. tem 40anos nasceu em Nampula, estudou até 8ªclasse, é casado e pai de três filhos: um menino de 13anos, um menino de 3anos e uma menina de 1ano, só o mais velho já vai a escola.

Assumane mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Suazilândia em 1977 a procura do emprego, trabalhou alguns anos como guarda numa residência e conseguiu abrir uma banca no mercado central de Namaacha. Assim Assumane decide abandonar o emprego e dedicar se ao negócio,hoje ocupa três bancas, vende produtos de primeira necessidade, conta com ajuda dos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele e dá lhes mensalmente um subsidio de 500,00mtn . Trabalham das 7h as 22h  tem como melhores produtos (lâmpadas,  fios electricos e colas), tem um rendimento mensal de 6.000,00mtn,  não consegue poupar mas já tem sua casa propria e construiu um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mesmo terreno que vai funcionar como mercearia e vai trabalhar a sua esposa. Para alem da sua familia Assumane sustenta sua mãe que vive em Nampula enviando lhe em cada seis mêses um valor de 1,000.00mtn.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Assumane com Hluvuku e com Kiva no valor de 11,000.00mtn que será usado na compra de produtos para suas bancas, está confiante que vai reemblosar o valor antes do prazo. Pretende pedir mais emprestimo para comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar nas compras, pois gasta muito dinheiro pelo transporte.
texts.en:
Assumane Chical C. is 40 years old, was born in Nampula, studied until the eighth grade, and is married with three children: a 13-year-old boy, a three-year-old boy, and a one-year-old girl. Only the oldest attends school. In 1977, Assumane moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland, to look for work. He worked for a few years as a guard in a residence and was able to open a booth in the central market of Namaacha. Thus, Assumane decided to leave his job and dedicate himself to his business. Today he has three booths and sells basic products with the help of his two nephews who live with him. He gives his nephews a monthly allowance of 500 MT. They work from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. selling the best products (including lamps, electric wire, and adhesives). They earn 6,000 MT per month. He has not been able to save, but he already owns his own home, and has built on his land a small commercial establishment that will function as a grocery store, tended by his wife. Besides his family, Assumane supports his mother, who lives in Nampula, sending her 1,000 MT every six months. This is Assumane’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The loan is for 11,000 MT and will be used to purchase products for his booths. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan before the due date. He intends to request another loan to buy a vehicle to help with his purchases, because he spends a lot of money on transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou D. est une femme divorcée, mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour faire un commerce de fruits locaux saisonniers et plus particulièrement de mangues et de pastèques actuellement puisque c’est la saison. Elle veut satisfaire ses propres besoins quotidiens et assurer de meilleures conditions de vie sa famille. <b>Elle pourra rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Codou D. is a divorced woman with 3 children. She is asking for this loan to run a business selling local seasonal fruits, specifically mangoes and watermelons currently, since they are in season. She would like to meet her own daily needs and ensure better living conditions for her family. She will be able to reimburse this loan at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell fruit (mangoes and watermelons specifically)

loans.name: Castorina

texts.es:
Mrs. Castorina C. is married to Mr. Ramon Cuellar. Together they have two children. Her job since she was young is to knit blankets, embroider lace, and to design and make tablecloths.

Due to her creativity and sacrifice, she began to grow her business and her work is now known throughout various regions of her country where she has sold her goods and grown her clientele. Doing this has enabled her to better meet her family's needs and improve their lives.

With this loan she plans to purchase more thread.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Castorina Cáceres está casada con el Sr. Ramón Cuellar, juntos tienen dos hijos, su actividad desde joven fue la de tejer colchas, encaje ju, confección de manteles.

A través de su creatividad y sacrificio fue creciendo y en la actualidad de la distribución la producción se encarga el conyugue que recorre por varias zonas del país adquiriendo clientes y aumentando la venta ,mejorando así el nivel de vida de su familia.

Con el crédito comprará hilos

loans.use: To purchase thread.  (Compra de hilos)

loans.name: João André

texts.pt:
João André N. nasceu e cresceu em namaacha uma vila que faz fronteira com  Swazilândia, tem 34anos solteiro e pai de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 9 anos aos 3 meses, os dois primeiros filhos encontram se a estudar.
 Joao fez a 11ªclase e sai de casa dos seus pais  quando começa a trabalhar no centro de formacao de professores primarios como servente, mas não permaneceu por longo tempo devido ao mau relacionamento com os colegas. Seis meses depois joão começa a trabalhar como segurança na empresa de Telecomunição de Maçambique(TDM),é funcionario permanente a dois anos, trabalha em turnos de 24h, três vezes por semana e tem um ordenado mensal de 2,900.00mtn. Para aumentar a renda familiar Joao faz negócio de fabrico de blocos a 2anos e tem tido bons resultado. Compra por mês 30 sacos de cimento a 250,00mt cada e tem fabricado 40 a 50 blocos em cada saco dependendo do tamanho, os mais pequenos tem vendido a 11.00mt e os mais grandes a 13.00mt tem tido um rendimento mensal de 5.700.00mt. Com o negócio João conseguiu construir asua casa própria, comprou duas viaturas de caixa aberta que lhe ajudam a transportar o seu produto e ainda consegue poupar 1,500.00mtn por mês. Para alem da sua familia João sustenta seus pais que vivem em Inhambane enviando lhes 500.00mtn no fim do mês. 

Este é o segundo emprestimo de joao na hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro emprestimo de 10.000.00mtn ele usou para comprar material para o fabrico de blocos conseguiu pagar antes do prazo determinado . E pede este segundo de 15.000.00mt  para reforcar o seu negocio, assim que terminar de pagar este emprestimo, pretende pedir um terceiro para compra um camioneta para caregar areia.
texts.en:
João André N. was born and raised in Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland. He is 34 years old, single, and father of four children whose ages range from three months to nine years. The oldest two are in school. João himself completed the 11th grade. For two years, he has been working in security for Telecomunição de Maçambique (TDM) as a full-time employee. He works 24-hour shifts three times a week and earns 2,900 MT per month. To augment the family income, João has had a cement block fabrication business for the last two years. The business has shown good results. Each month he buys 30 sacks of cement at 250 MT each and manufactures between 40 and 50 blocks for each sack, depending on block size. He sells the smallest for 11 MT and the largest for 13 MT. The business earns 5,700 MT per month. With his business, João was able to build his own house, has purchased two vehicles to help transport his product, and is still able to save 1,500 MT per month. Besides his family, João supports his parents who live in Inhambane, sending them 500 MT at the end of each month. This is João’s second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first was for 10,000 MT, which he used to purchase material for block manufacturing. He was able to repay the loan before the due date. He is requesting this second loan of 15,000 MT to strengthen his business. After repaying this loan, he intends to request a third to purchase a truck for hauling sand.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow his business

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya G. est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt faire un commerce de diverses denrées alimentaires locales. Elle compte sur cette activité afin de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Rokhaya G. is married and has 7 children. She would like to use this loan to run a business selling various local foodstuffs. She is counting on this business to contribute to the improvement of her children's living conditions and to provide them with a good education. She will reimburse this loan in a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various local foodstuffs

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Mr. Eliseo Centurion is a native of the city of Carapeguá and lives in the Beni Loma region. He is 36 years of age and has been married for over 11 years with Mrs. Pelagia Chaparro. They have three children, two of which are in school and one is an adult.

Since he was nine years old, he worked selling quilts with his mother, which they both produced. After much sacrifice and to gain his independence, he decided to work on his own and began selling local artisan products from his region using his motorcycle as transportation. He sells these local products in the cities of Caapucú, Missions, and Florida. Thanks to his hard work he has succeeded in building a modest home for the comfort of his family.

With this loan he will buy quilts / blankets, Paraguayan hammocks and bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Eliseo C. es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguá y vive en una de la compañía Beni Loma, tiene 36 años de edad y está casado hace más de 11 años con la Sra. Pelagia Chaparro y tienen Tres hijos dos en edad escolar y el otro ya mayor de edad.

Desde los nueve años de edad empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producían con su madre, después de mucho sacrificio logró independizarse y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a vender por las ciudades de Caapucú, Florida y Misiones trasladándose en su motocicleta. Gracias a este trabajo logró edificar una modesta casa para comodidad de su familia.

Con el Crédito comprará colchas, hamacas paraguayas y sábanas

loans.use: To purchase Paraguayan hammocks, sheets and quilts. (compra de hamacas paraguayas, sábanas, colchas)

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Báez tiene 39 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Lila de Báez, juntos tienen dos hijos, viven en Carepegua en casa propia en el Barrio San Vicente, su actividad es la fabricación de calzados que vende a los vendedores ambulantes de la zona.

Su esposa es docente, y aparte los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de calzados fabricados por el su esposo.

Es un señor muy trabajador desde muy joven aprendió este oficio que es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia.

Con el crédito comprará materia prima cueros ,plantillas
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Báez is 39 years old, married to Mrs. Lila de Báez, together they have two children, they live in Carepegua in their own house in the San Vicente neighborhood. His work is making shoes that he sells to the traveling vendors in their area. His wife is a teacher, and on the weekends she sells the shoes made by her husband. He is a hard-working man and learned this trade as a youth, and this trade provides the income to support his family. With this loan he will buy raw materials such as leather and insoles.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material such as leather and insoles

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: Sabine D. est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle souhaite renforcer son commerce de divers condiments alimentaires locaux au marché puisqu’elle y a déjà un étal. Elle mène cette activité dans le but de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Sabine D. is married and the mother of 5 children. She wishes to strengthen her business by selling various local seasonings given she already has a stall at the market. She has been practicing this activity in order to contribute to the improvement of her children ' s quality of life and to insure their proper schooling. She will reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various seasonings at the market.

loans.name: Henmerenciano

texts.es:
El señor Henmerenciano S. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en concubinato con María López y tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad vive en el barrio San Vicente de Carepegua, hace 22 años que trabaja como carpintero.

Desde muy joven se inicio en esta actividad se inició como secretario en una carpintería grande, de ahí adquirió esta habilidad que hoy día constituye su fuente principal de ingreso. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y así montó su pequeña carpintería y empezó a hacer clientes hoy día es una de los mejores carpinteros de la zona.

Con el crédito el cliente comprará maderas en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Henmerenciano S. is 41 years old, lives with María López and they have a 2 year old son. He lives in the Sah Vicente neighborhood of Carepegua and has been working as a carpenter for 22 years. He began this profession when he was young, starting as a secretary in a large carpentry shop. From there he acquired the ability that today provides his primary source of income. Little by little he was saving his money and in this way started his small carpentry business and began to gain clients. Today he is one of the best carpenters in the area. With this loan he will buy large quantities of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo M. es un Sr. de 39 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Acahay está casado hace más de 12 años con Sra. Felicia de 36 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos , uno en edad escolar y el otro esta cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de análisis de sistema en una de la universidades de la zona.

El Sr. Hugo es comerciante se dedica en la venta de electrodoméstico hace mas de 15 años su trabajo lo realiza en forma ambulante recorriendo por toda las ciudades en busca de clientes. Gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta actividad pudo construir su casa propia en el centro mismo de la ciudad en un terreno que heredó de su padre. Por la buena ubicación de su casa habilitó una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora que es administrado por su esposa.

Con el crédito comprará: cuadernos, hojas, biblioratos y útiles de oficina en general.
texts.en:
Hugo M. is a man of 39 years. He is a native of the city of Acahay, and has been married for more than 12 years to Ms. Felicia, who is 36 years old. They have two children, one still in school and another in the fourth year of a course of systems analysis in one of the local universities. Mr. Hugo is a commercial man, and has been dedicated to the sale of domestic electronics for the past 15 years. His sales are accomplished in recurring open air markets in all the cities. Thanks to his efforts and this activity, he was able to construct his own home in the center of the city on land he inherited from his father. Because of the good location of his house, he invested in a small book and copy shop that is run by his wife. With this loan, he would buy folders, sheets of paper, files, and general office supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy folders, pencils, pens, different sizes of paper, erasers, hole punches, etc.

loans.name: Haydee  Luz

texts.es:
Here is Haydee's fist Kiva loan

Haydee is a member of the communal bank "Bonanza".

Haydee is 42 years old and lives with her life partner and 2 children. She makes beautiful weaved products such as tapestries, rugs, and cushions. Her work is characterized by its originality and by the quality of her work. Her workshop is in her home. She has various looms but right now she works with 2 looms; she has two operators who run them. She also contracts work out to two other weavers. She sells all of her products in Ecuador, where she travels every 2 months, more or less, depending on the demand for her products. In Ecuador she buys bedspreads, sheets and coffee, all of which she then sells in Ayacucho to her friends and relations. Haydee also sells ceviche ( a cold seafood dish) during the day on Sundays, from a special place she has fitted out in her home.

Haydee needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of bedspreads and sheets.

Haydee dreams of supporting her children so that they go on to become professionals, opening a hardware store and having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Primer préstamo

Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Haydee es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Haydee hace bellos tejidos en telar como tapices, alfombras, cojines, sus trabajos se caracterizan por ser originales y de buen acabado, el taller esta en su casa, tiene varios telares pero actualmente trabajan dos telares para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de dos operarios, y también contrata a otros tejedores, todos sus productos lo vende en el país de Ecuador a donde viaja cada 2 meses o dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos y de Ecuador compra colchas, sabanas, café, productos que vende en Ayacucho a sus amigos, familiares. Además Haydee vende cebiche los días domingos, sus ventas lo realiza en su casa para lo cual adapto un ambiente.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de colchas, sabanas.

Los sueños de Haydee son apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, implementar una ferretería y tener un negocio estable.

loans.use: Haydee needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles (375 USD) which she will invest in the purchase of bedspreads and sheets.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Pascual Páez tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, vive en el barrio San  José de Carepegua es  propietario de una curtiduría, vive en casa propia siempre  se ha caracterizado tener muchas ganas de progresar  y salir adelante.

Es un señor muy trabajador y emprendedor, que cada vez más va progresando como comerciante, y en su  microempresa da  oportunidad de  trabajo a  muchas  personas  humildes de la  zona 

Con  el  crédito comprará  cueros.
texts.en:
Pascual P. is 35 years old and is single without children. He lives in the area of San Jose de Carepegua and is the owner of his own hide tannery. He has his own home and has always been characterized as having a lot of motivation and being able to get ahead. He is an intelligent and very smart man who continually is improving as a business woman. His micro business gives many humble people from the area opportunities to work. With this credit she will purchase hides.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hides

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
See Irma's first Kiva loan.

Irma is a member of the communal bank Bienestar (Wellbeing). She lives with her life partner and 4 children. The eldest child is 18 and preparing for the university; the other children attend the local grade school. Irma lives in the housing development Señor del Huerto where she has a store stocked with groceries, meat and fruit. Irma's work day starts at 4 in the morning when she goes out to do the shopping at the wholesale food market. Meanwhile, at 5 AM her daughters open the store. Irma keeps the store open until 9 PM, with the help of her daughters during their free time. Irma used to travel to the fairs, but gave it up because her son is still small. Irma and her partner also have a car with which they offer taxi service.

Irma needs a loan for 1200 Peruvian soles which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil and detergent.

Irma dreams of building a home from quality materials, providing a good education to her children, and stocking her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El primer préstamo de Irma

Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar. Irma es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos la mayor de 18 años que esta preparándose para la universidad y los demás estudian en el colegio, Irma vive en el asentamiento humano Señor del Huerto en donde tiene una tienda surtida de abarrotes, verduras, carnes, frutas, el día de Irma inicia a las 4 de la mañana para ir de compras al mercado de abastos, mientras sus hijas abren la tienda a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de sus hijas en sus ratos libres, Irma anteriormente viajaba a las ferias, actividad que dejo de realizar porque su hijo esta muy pequeño. Además Irma junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte urbano.

Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, detergente.

Irma sueña con construir su casa de material noble, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Irma needs a loan for 1200 Peruvian soles (425 USD)  which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil and detergent.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 29 años de edad, vive en concubinato con el señor Ruben, de 35 años, tienen tres hijos, dos en edad escolar y una va al colegio.

Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales, y también elabora en su propia casa las colchas para venderlas en otras ciudades. Su pareja trabaja en una fábrica de azúcar hace más de cinco años. Gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de ambos han podido progresar, pudiendo construir para su vivienda y hacer estudiar a sus hijos.

El crédito fue utilizado en la compra de una motocicleta para el señor Rubén, siendo un elemento de trabajo para trasladarlo hasta la fábrica, teniendo en cuenta que vive a cinco kilómetros de ella y en la zona no existen buses que lo trasladen hasta su trabajo. Además con este vehiculo saldrá también los fines de semana a vender los productos de Sonia por las ciudades aledañas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old. She lives with Ruben, and they have three children together who are all in school. She is works as a traveling sales woman. She sells artisan products and she also makes and sells quilts. Her partner has worked in a factory that processes sugar for more than 5 years. Thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of them both they have been able to get ahead, and were able to improve their home and send their children to school. This credit will be used to purchase a motorcycle for Ruben, which would be his transportation to work since they live 5 kilometer from the factory and there are no buses. Also, with this vehicle they would go out on the weekends to sell Sonia’s products in the villages.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna K. is a Tanzanian woman. She sells Tanzanian traditional clothing (vitenge and kanga) at Buguruni Mnyamani in Dar-es-Salaam. She purchases the goods from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale shopping center and sells to customers retail. She has been in the business for three years. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of US$ 350 to expand the business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
El señor Teofilo tiene 42 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Antonia Benítez hace mas de 14 años, tienen juntos dos hijos uno de 10 años y el otro con 20 años y esta cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Ciencias Administrativas en una de la universidades de la zona.

El Sr. Teofilo es oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González de Santacruz, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven con su papá en la producción de productos hortícolas, que comercializaban en el mercado de la zona. En la actualidad el Señor Teofilo trabaja por cuenta propia ya que trabajó 10 años como chofer en un frigorífico de Carepegua y al retirarse recibió su liquidación y con ese dinero se compró un camión de carga con el cual realiza su venta casa por casa de productos hortícolas .

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tomate, cebolla, zanahoria y otros.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 42 years old and is married 14 years to Antonia Benitez. They have 2 children one who is 10 years old and the other 20 years old, who is in his second year of studying administrative sciences at the local university. Teofilo is a native of the city of Roque Gonzalez de Santacruz. He began working at a very young age with his father selling produce in the area markets. Now he is his own boss, since he was able to work as a driver for a refrigerator company and with the money he received after retiring he bought a cargo truck, which he uses to transport agricultural products to market. He is soliciting this loan in order to pruchase tomatoes, onions, carrots, and other produce.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pruchase tomatoes, onions, carrots, and other produce.

loans.name: Radhia

texts.en: Radhia K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. Her residential and business area is at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam. She is a pharmacist. Her business is two years old. The business income meets her family's daily needs and covers school fees for the children. Her business plan is to run a wholesale pharmacy. She is requesting a loan of US$ 525 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Corazon Solidario (Solidary Heart) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Quiindy, en el barrio Santa María distante a 20km de la Oficina de Carepegua, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa, buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Estas personas crecieron gracias a este programa. Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas que son: despensas, venta de ropas, venta de comidas, costureras, librerías y ventas ambulantes de mercaderías varias como joyas, ropa interior, y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

La mayoría de las integrantes del comité invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería en caso de las que tienen casillas, también ropas para vender en el caso de las vendedoras ambulantes y otras mercaderías para la despensas y almacén como azúcar ,yerba ,harina , fideo , galleta y otros.
texts.en:
In the Santa María neighborhood of the city of Quiindy, 20km from the Office of Carepegua, a group of women with limited resources found out about the Enterprising Women group loan program offered by Fundación Paraguay. Looking for a bit of support to increase their familiy incomes and improve their quality of life, these women decided to get together to hear more about the program.

These people have grown, thanks to this program. They need this loan to invest in their various microenterprises, which include dry goods stores, clothing sales, food sales, tailors, book stores and ambulatory sales of various merchandise like jewelery and underwear. This loan will allow the women to achieve sustainable growth, so that they can grow both as a group and individually.

Most of the group members will spend the loan to buy merchandise (in the case of those who have little shops), to buy clothing (for those who work as street vendors), or to buy food items for their dry goods and grocery stores (like sugar, yerba mate, flour, pasta, and cookies).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell (food, clothing, jewelery, books, etc.)

loans.name: Niño Nativo Group

texts.es:
The community of Acoria is a neighborhood in the district of Acoria, which belongs to the department of Huancavelica (the poorest in Perú). It is located at 2,880 meters above sea level. Its main activities are agriculture, raising livestock, and traD.. One arrives to the district by taking the Huancayo-Huancavelica railway.

Mauricia H. Garci is married and has 8 children, the youngest of which is 5-years-old. Two of her children are in school. She has a business where she sells food, which she started a year ago with a loan that she received from Finca Perú. Previously, she sold vegetable stew. Mauricia needs a loan of 500 soles, which she will use to purchase soft drinks and supplies for her business. Her goal is to grow her business, and her dream is to offer higher education to her children. Currently her oldest son is studying to be a chef in Huancayo. He is working to pay for his studies.

Teofila Cárdenas H. is married with 3 children, who are 15, 18, and 23. Two of her children go to school. She has a little store where she sells candy and groceries, which she started 2 years ago. She used to raise young animals, but this didn't go well for her, so she decided to start her store. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will use to purchase more products for her store. FINCA helped her and now she has access to credit. Her goal is to carry her business into other districts and to see her children become professionals.

María E. is married and has one son, who is 9 and goes to school. She has a grocery store, which she started 2 years ago to help her husband with the family finances. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles, with which she is going to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to grow and become a wholesaler. Her dream is to have a house in Huancayo where there is more commercial movement and better schools for her son. With FINCA, she is learning to save.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La comunidad D. Acoria es un barrio del distrito D. Acoria perteneciente al departamento D. Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud D. 2,880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio. Al distrito se llega por vía férrea Huancayo – Huancavelica.

Mauricia H. Garci, casada, tiene 8 hijos, el menor D. 5 años, dos D. sus hijos van a la escuela, tiene un negocio D. venta D. comida el cual lo inició hace un año con el primer préstamo que recibió D. FINCA PERU, anteriormente vendía menestras. Mauricia necesita un préstamo D. 500 soles, con el préstamo va comprar gaseosas y alimentos para su negocio. Su desafío es crecer en el negocio, su sueño es brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos y actualmente su hijo mayor estudia para chef en Huancayo por lo que trabaja para pagar sus estudios.

Teofila Cárdenas H., casada con 3 hijos, D. 15, 18 y 23 años, dos hijos van a la escuela, tiene una tiendita que venD. golosinas y abarrotes, el cual tiene dos años D. creación, anteriormente criaba animales menores pero no le fue bien por lo que decidió crear su tienda, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, con el préstamo va comprar mas productos para su tienda. FINCA le ayudo pues ahora ya tiene acceso al crédito. Su desafío es salir con su negocio a otros distritos y ver profesionales a sus hijos .

Maria E., conviviente con 1hijo D. 9 años que va a la escuela, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, que cuenta con 2 años D. creación, lo creo para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, con el que va comprar mas mercadería. Su desafío es crecer y ser mayorista, su sueño es contar con una casa en Huancayo donD. hay mas movimiento comercial y mejores escuelas para su hijo. Con FINCA esta aprendiendo a ahorrar.

loans.use: The communal bank Niño Nativo is requesting a loan of 6,900 soles for its 14 members, who are requesting loans of 200, 400, or 1,000 soles to supply their businesses.

loans.name: Señor De Acoria Group

texts.es:
The community of Acoria is a neighborhood in the Acoria district of the region of Huancavelica, the poorest region in Peru, located at an altitude of 2880 meters above sea level. The principal activities of the local people are agriculture, livestock production and commerce. The district is accessible through the Huancayo - Huancavelica railroad line.

Olga Corso is a single mother with 3 children, aged 3, 10 and 17; two of her children are in school. Her business is food sales; she has been in the business for 10 years. Initially she wanted to study but she did not have the support of her family. Then, with the birth of her children she had to go to work selling candy. Olga is requesting a loan for 400 soles (Peruvian currency) with which she will buy candy and pastries for her food stand. FINCA is helping her by providing her with this loan. She would like to apply for a larger loan in the future and understands that FINCA must first measure her capacity to repay. She dreams of supporting her childrens' studies.

Esterela C. Q. is a widow with 6 children, aged 5, 9, 13, 15, and 18. Four of her children are in school and the eldest is preparing to apply to the university. Estela's business is the sales of prepared seafood dishes; she has been in this business for more than 5 years. She started the business when her husband died since she saw the necessity of working to support her children. Estela is requesting a loan of 300 soles with which she wants to buy fish and pay the monthly expenses of her eldest son's studies. Her dream is that her eldest son will complete his studies and becomes a professional.

Ninfa Fernández F. lives with her life partner and her 2 children, aged 7 and 10. One of her children is in school. She sells Avon beauty products for women. She started the business a year and 8 months ago, when her sister in Huancavelica, a teacher by training who also sells Avon, suggested that she take up sales. Ninfa is requesting a loan of 600 Peruvian soles; the loan will provide her with capital to buy Avon products to sell. Her challenge is the running of her own business and her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La comunidad de Acoria es un barrio del distrito de Acoria perteneciente al departamento de Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud de 2880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio. Al distrito se llega por vía férrea Huancayo – Huancavelica.

Olga Corso, madre soltera con 3 hijos, de 3, 10 y 17 años, dos hijos van a la escuela, su negocio es la venta de comida, la cual tiene 10 años de creación, inicialmente quería estudiar pero no contó con el apoyo de su familia y con el nacimiento de sus hijos tuvo que trabajar vendiendo golosinas en su tienda. Olga solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para comprar golosinas, pastelitos para la venta de comida. FINCA le ayudo con el crédito, aun quiere un monto mayor en el futuro, sabe que debe medir su capacidad de pago. Su sueño es apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.

Estela C. Q., viuda con 6 hijos de 5, 9, 13, 15, 18 años, 4 van a la escuela y el mayor se prepara para postular a la universidad, su negocio es la venta de comida en base a pescado, que cuenta con mas de 5 años de creación, creo el negocio cuando falleció su esposo pues se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para mantener a sus hijos. Estela solicita un préstamo de 300 soles con el que quiere comprar pescado y pagar la mensualidad del estudio de su hijo mayor. Su sueño es que sus hijo mayor estudie y se vuelva un profesional.

Ninfa Fernández F., conviviente con 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años, uno va al colegio, vende productos de belleza para mujeres (Avon), el cual inicio hace un año y 8 meses, inicio en las ventas invitada por su hermana en Huancavelica, de profesión docente pero no ejerce su carrera. Ninfa solicita un préstamo de 600 soles así tendrá capital para comprar productos. Su desafío es administrar un negocio y su sueño es tener una casa propia.

loans.use: The communal bank Señor de Acoria is requesting a loan of 5100 Peruvian soles (1750 USD) for its members, who want to carry out their business plans and stock their businesses.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio owns a milk cow and sells his product to PIL Andina S.A., a company that makes milk products. The company pays him every two weeks and Virgilio uses the money to maintain and educate his family. Virgilio is married and his wife helps sell potatoes and potato flour. The family lives in the Chijipina Chico community in the Omasuyo province, department of La Paz (three hours from city of El Alto). This loan will be invested in the purchase of a milk cow of medium quality, so they will be able to increase their milk production. This is the second time that IMPRO has granted them a loan, and their good repayment history has allowed them to approve this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Virgilio es productor de leche de vaca, comercializa su producto a PIL Andina S.A. una empresa que manufactura productos lácteos y paga quincenalmente a productores como Virgilio quien cubre la manutención y la educación de su familia. Virgilio es casado, su esposa ayuda con la comercialización de papa y chuño. La familia vive en la Comunidad Chijipina Chico Provincia Omasuyo del Departamento de La Paz (a tres horas de la Ciudad de El Alto). El crédito sera invertido en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, así podrá incrementar su producción de leche. Es la segunda vez que Impro le otorga un crédito, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar la solicitud.

loans.use: Purchase milk cow

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria sells cow's milk to PIL Andina, S.A., a company that distributes dairy products. The company pays her every two weeks for this service. Gregoria also has a grocery store. Both activities are her principal sources of income. With them, she covers the costs of raising her three children.

Gregoria lives in the Chijipina Chico community, in the Omasuyo province, in the department of La Paz (three hours from the city of El Alto).

This credit will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality because Gregoria hopes to increase her production of milk.

This is her second credit with Impro, and she receives it without difficulty because of her good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gregoria es productora de leche de vaca, vende su producto a PIL Andina S.A. empresa que distribuye productos lácteos. Por este servicio la empresa le paga quincenalmente, Gregoria también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ambas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso, con ellas cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos.

Gregoria vive en la Comunidad Chijipina Chico, Provincia Omasuyo del Departamento de La Paz (a tres horas de la Ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito será usado para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad ya que desea incrementar su producción de leche.

Es su segundo crédito con Impro y puede acceder sin dificultad al préstamo por su buen comportamiento de pago.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Red Cross Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are staff of the Sierra Leone Red Cross Makeni. Makeni is the Northern Province headquarters town, about 185 miles from Freetown. They give vaccines to the people of Makeni against several diseases. They vaccinate against measles for the under-fives, against polio, and against tetanus. They also help in the child delivery process, and in many community development projects.

Notwithstanding all that, this is a volunteer job. They offer all of these services to the people of Makeni without receiving salaries for their services. To make ends meet, however, all of them but two also work at in small-scale businesses (the two who don't plan to use their loans to pay school fees for their children).

Thus they came to SMT for the first time to seek loans to enable them to expand their businesses. Their names are: Annie T., Kaifala M., Matha R. K., Mohamed L. B., Mabel H. D., Zainab T. K., Amie C. Kabia, Richmond T., Fatmata K. and Mohammed B. T..

Annie K. T. is the leader of this group. Annie was born in Fadugu, a village very close to Kabala, Koinadugu District, Northern Sierra Leone. Annie is 46, and her husband works for a local NGO. They have 4 children. Annie now resides with her family in Makeni where she works for the Red Cross and at the same time is in business. Annie will use part of her loan to improve her son's "video-centre" (a cinema, using 4×6 size televisions) and with the balance she will buy an "Okada" (motor-bike used as a taxi).

loans.use: Buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Romicristi Isabel

texts.es:
Romicristi is 32 years old and belongs to the “Las Candelarias II” communal bank in Huaraz. After succeeding in owning her own laundry business called “Maricris,” where she exclusively serves 50 clients who are miners, she is now planning on tackling a new business, selling frozen yogurt popsicles. The business will be called “Fabri,” the name of her only son, and she will supply the local and regional markets. She will prepare the products herself, buying milk from the region and the rest of the supplies from Huaraz as well. With this loan of 1,200 soles ($425), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy four little cars with coolers to hold her popsicles. She already has vendors for her new product. She is planning on improving her image and opening her own store, and having a strengthened business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Romicristi tiene 32 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las candelarias II” de Huaraz. Después de haber logrado tener su propio negocio de lavandería, llamado “Maricris” donde atiende a 50 clientes fijos mineros en exclusiva, ella piensa ahora incursionar a un nuevo negocio, la venta de yogurt a manera de chupetes congelados, con el nombre de “Fabri” el nombre de su único hijo y abastecer al mercado local y regional, este producto lo prepara personalmente, comprando leche de la región y los demás implementos también de Huaraz. Con el préstamo de S/ 1 200 soles, que pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará cuatro carritos con “couler” para colocar sus chupetes, porque ya tiene vendedores para su nuevo producto. Ella piensa mejorar su imagen y tener un local propio y tener una empresa fortalecida.

loans.use: Purchase cars to sell frozen yogurt popsicles

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, like many Bolivian women, was abandoned by her husband. Now she alone supports her 4 small children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 4. Therefore she works making small artisan pieces in macramé, sewing blankets, and embroidering by hand (her main source of income). She lives in the Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) zone of El Alto city.

With the loan she will acquire a semi-industrial sewing mahine that will improve the quality of work that she creates.

This is her first loan with Impro, our evaluation was favorable and therefore she can access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Antonia como mucha mujeres bolivianas, fue abandonada por su esposo. Ahora ella sola debe mantener a sus 4 hijos pequeños de 12, 10, 8 y 4 años de edad. Por eso trabaja con pequeñas artesanías en macramé, tejidos de mantas y bordados a mano (su principal fuente de ingreso). Vive en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

Con el monto del crédito adquirirá una maquina semi-industrial que le facilitara para mejorar la calidad del trabajo que realiza.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la favorece y por eso puede acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: Buy semi-industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Dafne

texts.es:
Dafne dreams of owning her own restaurant and studying for a career in business administration. She is 20 years old, single, and belongs to the community bank, “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. Currently she is working in a “cebichería”, a restaurant that serves the popular Peruvian dish of marinated raw fish known as cebiche. In addition to being in charge of the business, she also sells cosmetic products. She tells us that with the sale of these cosmetics, she is able to make 100 soles per week and is saving that amount in order to be able to study, since her parents do not have the necessary resources to pay for her schooling. With the loan of 500 soles which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy hand cream, perfumes, earrings and make-up to have on hand when customers ask for them.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Dafne, con 20 años de edad pertenece Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, sueña con tener su propio restaurante y estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas, ya que es soltera. Por el momento ella trabaja en una cebichería de la ciudad de Huaraz, como encargada del local, pero también vende productos cosméticos. Ella nos dice que con la venta de estos productos cosméticos, obtiene una ganancia semanal de 100 soles, la cual esta ahorrando para poder estudiar ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para sus estudios. Con el préstamo de S/ 500 soles y que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprara cremas para manos, perfumes, aretes y artículos para maquillaje que lo mantendrá en reserva para cuando sus clientes lo soliciten.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gaby is 19 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. We find her in her mother’s business where she helps in the afternoons, she works to be able to save and cover the cost of her studies, when she enrolls to be a police officer or flight attendance in Lima. She is single.

She tells us she has grown her business. Before she sold candy from a cart outside a school, and with the loans she received she has been able to open her own business selling clothing from home to home. The difficulty she encounters in this work is daily going to collect from her customers because they are located in difference areas of Huaraz city.

With a loan for S/800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy jeans, sweaters, shirts, and blouses in Lima.

Gabriela would like to receive training on how to improve family relations seeing as how she only lives with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Gaby de 19 años de edad pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, la encontramos en el negocio de su madre donde ayuda por las tardes, ella trabaja para poder ahorrar y cubrir los costos de sus estudios, cuando ingrese a la policía o ser aeromoza, en Lima ya que es soltera.

Ella nos cuenta que ha crecido en su negocio, que antes vendía golosinas en una carreta, afueras de un colegio, y con los préstamos que recibe ha podido abrir su propio negocio de venta de ropas a domicilio, la dificultad que ella encuentra en este trabajo es el de ir a cobrar diariamente a sus clientes que se localizan por diversas zonas de la ciudad de Huaraz

Con el préstamo de S/ 800 soles, la cual pagará en 6 cuotas, ella comprará jeans, chompas, polos camisas y blusas de la ciudad de Lima.

A Gabriela, le gustaría recibir capacitaciones de cómo mejorar sus relaciones familiares a pesar de solo vivir con su madre.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Charles A.b.

texts.en:
This is Charles A.B. F.. He is a businessman in Makeni City. He has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes for the past 8 years now. Charles is 34 years old, married with 2 children.

Charles is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00. This will be his first loan from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, Charles will buy more clothes, shoes and jewelry to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy clothes, etc. to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Piedad Justa

texts.es:
Piedad is a member of the communal bank "Glorioso".

Piedad is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She has a store in her home where, with the help of her children, she sells meat, chicken, groceries and vegetables. She also has Internet booths in the back room of the store and an employee who tends to the Internet portion of the business. In addition to all of that, in the evenings Piedad sells a popular fast food known as salchipollos in the entrance of her home.

Piedad needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

Piedad dreams of providing a good education to her children and expanding her businesses by adding more Internet booths and a poultry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Piedad es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Piedad es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Piedad tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende carne, pollo, abarrotes, verduras, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, también tiene cabinas de Internet para lo cual habilito un ambiente en la trastienda y quien administra el negocio es una empleada. Además Piedad por las noches vende salchipollos es la puerta de su casa.

Piedad necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.

Los sueños de Piedad son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, ampliar sus negocios, implementar mas cabinas de Internet y una polleria.

loans.use: Piedad needs a loan for 1050 Peruvian soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Cecilio Santos

texts.es:
Cecilio, his wife, and their two small children live in his inlaws' house. He works in an egg distributing company. At night he works as a driver. His wife does macrame work and makes costumes. These activities help them survive. The family lives in the Villa Ingenio (Río Seco) zone in the city of El Alto.

This credit will go towards acquiring construction materials (cement, brick, and sand) to make a room for their children (the inlaws will help with the labor).

This is the second time that Cecilio is turning to us for a loan. His good payment record makes it easy to approve the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cecilio su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos viven en la casa de su suegros, él trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de huevos y en las noches trabaja como transportista asalariado, su esposa colabora realizando trabajos en macramé y costuras. Dichas actividades les ayudan a sobrevivir. La familia vive en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito sera destinado para adquirir material de construcción (cemento ladrillo y arena) para hacer un cuarto para sus hijos (los suegros ayudaran con la mano de obra).

Esta es la segunda vez que Cecilio acude a nosotros, su buen comportamiento de pago facilita aprobar el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa is a member of the Glorioso communal bank.

Jesusa is married, is 40-years-old, and has 3 children. She sells various clothes for children, women, and men. She sells them to her friends, family members, and her husband's friends. She sells on credit. She acquires her products in the city of Lima, where she travels monthly. She and her husband also offer filming services for different events. Their business is called "Filmaciones Mama Beni" and she also sells wedding dresses in her house.

Jesusa needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of coats and shoes.

Jesusa dreams about having a large store to manage by herself, a car, and having her children study to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Jesusa es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Jesusa vende ropa variada para niños, damas, caballeros, sus productos los ofrece a sus amigos, familiares y amigos de su esposo, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente. Además junto a su esposo brindan servicios de filmación para diferentes eventos, su negocio se llama “Filmaciones Mama Beni” y también alquila vestidos de novia en su casa.

Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abrigos y zapatos.

Jesusa sueña con tener una tienda grande que solo administre, un carro y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.

loans.use: Jesusa needs a loan of 1,500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of coats and shoes

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime and his wife make slipcovers for vehicle seats that are sold wholesale. His small shop has one employee and it is his primary source of income (covering the support of his two small children ages 3 and 1). The family lives in his parent’s house located in the Bautista Saavedra (Rió Seco) zone of El Alto.

The couple is seeking a loan to buy raw matierals, thereby increasing their production and they will be able to satisfy the demand that they have.

This is their first loan with Impro, the evaluation has qualified them favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Jaime y su esposa confeccionan protectores (fundas) para asientos de movilidades, estos son comercializados al por mayor, su pequeño taller tiene un empleado y es su principal fuente ingreso (cubre la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad). La familia vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

La pareja solicita crédito para comprar materia prima, así incrementará su producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda que tiene.

Es su primer crédito con Impro, el trabajo de evaluación realizado los calificó favorablemente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make slipcovers

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia belongs to the Communal Bank Glorioso.

Victoria is married, 42 years old, and has 3 children. Zenobia has a store in her house located in the Rioja area of San Juan Bautista, where she sells groceries, fruit, beverages, gas. She runs this business with her husband and children every day of the week. Zenobia travels monthly to Lima to buy various candies and new products that she can sell in her store. Zenobia is planning on implementing a clothing store.

Zenobia needs a loan of 1050 soles to invest in buying snacks, chocolates, and a variety of juices.

Zenobia dreams that her children will grow up to be professionals, of improving her business and having a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Zenobia es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Zenobia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el jr. Rioja en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, bebidas, gas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, Zenobia viaja mensualmente a la ciudad de Lima para comprar golosinas variadas y productos novedosos que pueda vender en su tienda. Zenobia tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de ropa.

Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, chocolates, jugos variados.

Zenobia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de ropa.

loans.use: Zenobia needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy snacks, chocolates and a variety of juices.

loans.name: Victoria Venancia

texts.es:
Victoria belongs to the Communal Bank Sarita.

Victoria is married, 57 years old, and has 10 children of whom only 1 son (age 22) lives with her. Victoria travels to different markets in the region, an activity she does 3 times a week. Victoria sells food, which she cooks from midnight until daybreak and then she travels to the markets located 2 or 3 hours from her city, Ayacucho. At times she also buys grains and sells them in the markets in Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in buying meat, potatoes, corn and rice.

Victoria dreams of improving her home, changing the roof on her house, buying a car for her son and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.

Victoria es casada, tiene 57 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 hijo D. 22 años vive con ella, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región, actividad que realiza 3 veces por semana, Victoria venD. comida, para lo cual cocina desD. la medianoche hasta la madrugada y luego viaja a estas ferias que se encuentran a 2 o 3 horas D. la ciudad D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. En algunas oportunidades compra cereales y lo venD. a los comerciantes D. los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra D. carne, papa, maíz, arroz.

Los sueños D. Victoria son mejorar su casa, cambiar el techo D. su casa, comprar un carro para su hijo y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be used to buy meat, potatoes, corn and rice

loans.name: Fishing Association Group

texts.en: This group is called Fishing Association. They are all business people in Magburka town market. This is their 3rd time of getting a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped them and their businesses a great deal. Yet, they still need more loans to help their businesses grow further. They are thus requesting a loan of Le  2,400,000.00. These entrepreneurs are: Yusuf G., Isatu C., and Osman C.. Yusuf is the leader of the group. He is married with 5 children. Yusuf sells used clothes and has been in this business for the past 8 years.

loans.use: Buy more bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Maria, Victoria Y Elsa Group

texts.es:
Maria, Victoria and Elsa are partners in the communcal bank Sarita.

Maria is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells chinca and crockery in the different fairs in the region. She works every day of the week, and buys her products in the city of Lima.

On the other hand, Victoria is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She travels to the different fairs in the region, where she buys grains that she later processes and sells to the merchants of the local markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Elsa is 26 years old and lives with her 2 children and her life partner. She sells salchipapas, a popular fast food, in the entrance of her house at night and plans to start a new business selling clothing.

Maria, Victoria and Elsa need loans of 800 Peruvian soles each which will be invested in the purchase of cooking pots, plates, coffee cups, wheat, corn, pants and coordinated outfits for children. Maria, Victoria and Elsa dream of improving their homes, seeing their children become professionals and expanding their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria, Victoria y Elsa son socias del Banco Comunal Sarita.

Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria vende locería en las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Victoria es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego los procesa y vende a comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Elsa es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Elsa vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa y tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa.

Maria, Victoria y Elsa necesitan prestamos de 800 soles cada una dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos, tazas, trigo, maíz, pantalones y conjuntos de niños. Los sueños de Maria, Victoria y Elsa son mejorar su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Maria, Victoria and Elsa need loans of 800 soles (Peruvian currency) each, which they will invest in the purchase of  inventory for each of their businesses: cooking pots, plates, cups, wheat, corn, pants and coordinated outfits for children.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia works knitting traditional shawls for women and her husband works as a brick layer in Beni state. With both jobs the couple is able to support their family. Their house is located in the Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) zone of El Alto city. But Lidia rents, therefore she is asking for a loan to buy land and then they can build a home of their own.

This is their first loan with Impro, our evaluation gave encouraging results and therefore we approved their loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Lidia trabaja tejiendo mantas D. cholitas, su esposo trabaja como albañil en el departamento D. Beni. Con ambas ocupaciones la pareja cubre la manutención D. su familia. El domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Pero Lidia es una inquilina, por eso solicita préstamo para comprar un terreno y posteriormente construir su vivienda añorada.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, nuestra evaluación dio resultados alentadores y por eso aprobamos su solicitud D. préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase land to build a home

loans.name: Laura Y Tereza Group

texts.es:
Laura and Tereza are members of the Communal Bank Sarita.

Laura is married, 23 years old, and has 1 son. Laura and her husband are artisans, they make Ayacuchan retablos, which are wooden boxes decorated with images and customs of the area. This is an activity they learned from their parents. From time to time they have an assistant who helps them, depending on the orders they have. They sell their products in the Artesanal market.

Tereza is married, 19 years old, and has 1 son. Tereza and her husband sell beer that they distribute to the stores and also according to any orders that they receive. Tereza, with the loan that she will receive, will be starting a new business selling clothing.

Lara and Tereza need loans of 600 and 800 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of wood, paint, plaster, shirts, and pants.

Laura and Tereza have dreams of having a larger workshop, a gallery, and providing a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Laura y Tereza son socias del Banco Comunal Sarita.

Laura es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Laura junto a su esposo son artesanos, elaboran retablos ayacuchanos, que son cajones de madera en la que se plasman las costumbres de la zona, actividad que aprendieron de sus padres, en algunas oportunidades tienen un personal que les ayuda, dependiendo de los pedidos que tengan, sus ventas lo realizan en el mercado Artesanal.

Mientras que Tereza es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 1 hijo, Tereza junto a su esposo venden cervezas que reparten a las tiendas y también pedidos que puedan tener, Tereza con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa.

Laura y Tereza necesitan prestamos de 600 soles, 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera, pinturas, yeso, polos pantalones.

Los sueños de Laura y Tereza son tener un taller más grande, una galería y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Laura and Tereza wil purchase wood, paint, plaster, shirts and pants

loans.name: Mara Susan

texts.es:
Mara is 27 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz. She hopes to have a boutique and be able to manage it herself while continuing to work in Business Administration, the career she is studying.

Mara tells us that she is single and lives with her parents, her income is sufficient to cover her basic necessities and be able to pay for her studies herself.

She brings clothing from Lima and sells them according to her customer’s orders. With this she earns about 125 soles per week, and in the three years she has had this business is has grown. She began with only 5 orders.

with a loan for S/800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will close out her cosmetic product accounts and buy clothing according to her customer’s orders.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Mara tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”de Huaraz, espera tener una boutique y poder administrarla directamente e ir trabajando en Administración de empresas que es la carrera que ella esta estudiando.

Mara, aunque no es amarga, ya que eso significa su nombre, nos dice, que es soltera y vive con sus padres, le es suficiente lo que gana para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y poder ayudarse en sus estudios.

Ella trae ropas de Lima y las vende a pedidos a sus clientes ya fijos, con lo cual obtiene una ganancia de 125 soles semanales, en los tres años que tiene en este negocio ha crecido. Ella inicio con sólo 5 pedidos.

Con el préstamo de S/ 800 soles, que lo pagará en 6 cuotas, ella cancelará las cuentas de sus productos cosméticos y comprará ropas de pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy items of clothing

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora owns a shop that makes small machines to create rubber stamps which are sold in Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Beni states. Her husband is in charge of selling these products. They have 3 children ages 15, 12 and 4. They live in the Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) are of El Alto city.

The loan will be used to buy raw materials which will allow for increased production of her small machines to satisfy demand.

This is her first loan with Impro. Our evaluation qualifies her favorably and therefore her application was immediately approved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teodora posee un taller donde fabrica pequeñas maquinas para elaborar sellos de goma, las cuales son comercializadas en los departamentos de Santa Cruz, Cochabamba y Beni, el esposo es el encargado de vender estos productos tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 4 años de edad. Viven en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para comprar materia prima, lo que permitirá incrementar la producción de sus pequeñas maquinas y satisfacer la gran demanda.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, nuestra evaluación la calificó favorablemente, por eso, su solicitud fue aprobada inmediatamente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty M. est mariée, mère d’un enfant avec 03 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle souhaite faire un petit commerce de divers condiments alimentaires locaux au marché et souvent aussi de vente de mangues puisque c’est la saison. Elle veut assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants et une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois et en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Maty M. is married and the mother of 1 child with three others for whom she is responsible. She would like to sell, at the market, various local seasonings and mangoes since they are in season. She wants to ensure a better quality of life for her children and a good education. She will reimburse the loan in one single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of various seasonings at the market

loans.name: Kalane Ka Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is called Kalane Ka Kuru. They are business people at the Magburaka town. This is the 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact in the lives of these people and their families. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further enhance their businesses.

These entrepreneurs are: Kadiatu K., Aminata K., Warrah Kabia and Adama F.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00. Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group. She is single with one child. Kadiatu sells market food and has been in this business for the past 10 years.

loans.use: Buy more produce to add to their businesses

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr: Mélanie B. est une femme mariée, mère de 08 enfants avec 02 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour faire un commerce de fruits locaux saisonniers et plus particulièrement de mangues dont c’est la saison. Elle veut subevenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et assurer de meilleures conditions de vie a ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser son pret au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Mélanie B. is married and the mother of 08 children with 02 others for whom she is responsible. She is requesting this loan to sell local seasonal fruits, and especially mangoes which are in season. She wants to provide for her family's needs and ensure better living conditions for her children. She will reimburse her loan after six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of seasonal fruits, especially mangoes.

loans.name: Norma Karina

texts.es:
Karina’s first loan

Karina is a member of the Communal Bank Glorioso. Karina is single and 23 years old. Karina still lives with her parents and studies accounting in a private university. She is the manager of the family’s cars that provide urban transport in the city of Ayucucho. She also works as a receptionist in her Aunt’s hotel in her free time. Karina sells cosmetics by catalog, products she offers to friends and family, her sales are primarily made on credit.

Karina needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of colognes, creams, and cosmetics.

Karina dreams of being a successful professional and of implementing an Internet and phone café.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El primer préstamo de Karina

Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso. Karina es soltera y tiene 23 años, Karina vive todavía con sus padres y estudia contabilidad en una universidad privada y se encarga de la administración de los carros de la familia que realizan transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho, también en sus ratos libres trabaja como recepcionista en el hotel de su tía. Además Karina vende cosméticos por catálogos, productos que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son en gran parte al crédito.

Karina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de colonias, cremas y cosméticos.

Los sueños de Karina son ser una buena profesional, exitosa, implementar una Internet y locutorio.

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase colognes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sanda Association Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sanda Association. This is their 3rd time getting a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have significantly helped them in their businesses and livelihoods. They have repaid those loans successfully and are now requesting a new loan of Le 4,000,000.00. to further enhance their businesses.

Members of this group include: Abu B., Adamsay S., Sheika S., Abu K. and Harison J. K.. The leader of this group, Abu S. is an 'Okada' driver (motor-bikes used for public transportation). With a new loan, Abu will sell the old one to add to the loan money and purchase a new motor-bike. He is 35, married with 4 children. Abu has been in this business for the past 8 years now.

loans.use: Buy a new moter-bike

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma's first loan

Sulma is a member of the Kallpanchik Communal Bank, which means Our Strength in quechua. Sulma has a live-in partner, is 23 years old, and has a 1 year old son. Sulma sells vegetables in a rented space in Nazarenas market, located in the Jesús Nazareno district. Sulma begins her day very early because she goes to the supply market to do her shopping, an activity she does every day from 7 in the morning until noon, then she goes to her home to cook and clean. p> Sulma needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of a variety of vegetables.

Miriam dreams of having her own home, have a large store in a stable location, and that her son receives an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Primer préstamo de Sulma

Sulma es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Sulma es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo pequeño, Sulma vende verduras en un puesto alquilado en el mercado las nazarenas que se ubica en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, Sulma inicia su día muy de madrugada porque va al mercado de abastos a hacer sus compras, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía para luego ir a su casa a cocinar y limpiar.

Sulma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras variadas. Los sueños de Sulma son tener casa propia, una tienda grande en un local estable y que su hijo estudie.

loans.use: Sulma needs a loan for 1050 soles which will be invested in purchasing a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Sandy Analí

texts.es:
Sandy is 28 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Candelarias II” of Huaraz. She has few economic resources and wants to become a businesswoman and have her own hair salon as she is a single mother of two small children, which is her greatest challenge. She tells us that after much effort she was able to obtain a position in a prestigious hair salon in Huaraz city located on Simón Bolívar Avenue. Because of her lack of knowledge about cosmetology it has been difficult to begin this job, she didn’t realize how hard it would be, and she has been learning.

With a loan of S/500 soles which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy hair care products such as hair treatments and color, which she will use and sell in the salon where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Sandy tiene 28 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II” de Huaraz, cuenta con pocos recursos económicos y quisiera capacitarse en negocios y tener su propia peluquería ya que es madre soltera de dos hijos menores la cual es su mayor dificultad. Ella nos cuenta que después de mucho esfuerzo logró obtener un trabajo en una peluquería de prestigio en la ciudad de Huaraz que se encuentra en la Av. Simón Bolívar; por falta de conocimiento sobre cosmetología le fue difícil empezar un oficio así, desconocido para ella, la cual ha ido aprendiendo.

Con el préstamo de S/ 500 soles que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprara productos para el tratamiento capilar, como ampollas y tintes para el cabello, que lo expenderá y venderá en la peluquería donde trabaja.

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam's First loan

Miriam is a member of the Kallpanchik Communal Bank, which means Our Strength in quechua. Miriam has a live-in partner, is 24 years old, and has a 1 year old son. Miriam sells vegetables and tubers in a rented space in Nazarenas market, located in the Jesús Nazareno district. She acquires her products from the supply market in Ayacucho city, where she goes everyday in the early morning hours. Miram opens her stand from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. In addition, Mriram and her husband own a motortaxi that her husband drives, providing transportation in Ayucucho city.

Miriam needs a loan for 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato, celery, tomato, and pumpkin.

Miriam dreams of having her own home, providing the best education for her son, stabilizing herself economically and getting married.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El primer préstamo de Miriam
