Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Miriam es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo pequeño, Miriam vende verduras, tubérculos en un puesto alquilado del mercado Nazarenas, ubicado en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abasto de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde va todos los días por las madrugadas, Miriam abre su puesto a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Además Miriam y su esposo tienen una mototaxi que conduce su esposo haciendo transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, apio, tomate, zapallo.

Los sueños de Miriam son tener casa propia, brindar la mejor educación a su hijo, estabilizarse económicamente y casarse.

loans.use: Miriam needs a loan of 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato, celery, tomato, and pumpkin.

loans.name: Amelia Margoth

texts.es:
Amelia is 27 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank Señor de Martha II”. She has as a goal to open a clothing and cosmetic boutique. With her sad face she tells us that she is married and with two children, and her most difficult moment was when she delivered her two children by caesarian section and the recovery was difficult for her.

Today she sells clothing and cosmetics in her mother’s house, located to the north of the Quillcay river, and she distributes her merchandise to her established clients.

With a loan of s/.600.00 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy shirts, jackets and items for children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Amelia tiene 27 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Martha II”. Ella tiene como objetivo instalar una boutique con ropas a la moda y cosméticos; con su mirada triste ella nos dice que es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Nos cuenta que su momento más difícil fue cuando tuvo cesárea en sus dos partos y que le ha sido difícil recuperarse.

En la actualidad vende ropa y cosméticos en la casa de su madre ubicada en el malecón norte del río Quillcay s/n, distribuye su mercadería entre sus clientes fijos. Estos productos los trae desde lima desde hace cinco años.

Con el préstamo de s/. 600.00 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará polos, chompas e implementos para niños.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and items for children

location.town: Malecón Norte del Rio Quillcay, Ancash

loans.name: Ta-Ram Group

texts.en:
The Ta-Ram group is asking for its third loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have been a great blessing to members of this group, most of whom are "Okada" (motorcycle taxi) drivers. They used previous loans to purchase their first motorcycle and they have repaid those loans very successfully. They will use the new loan to buy another motorcycle. 

The members of the group are Sorie S., Isatu S., Abu C., and Ibrahim C.. Sorie, the group leader,  is 27 years old. He was born in Magburaka and is married with two children.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is 27 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Niño Manuelito” in Huaraz. She hopes to have a secure place to sell her products and be able to support her children, as her husband is a brick layer and he has sporadic work. She also hopes to construct a house on land they have acquired with great effort.

She raises small animals like guinea pigs, turkeys and chickens, which she then sells in the markets on Mondays and Thursdays in Huaraz. She also sells her chickens’ eggs, averaging 30 eggs a week.

With the loan for S/1500.00 soles, which will be repaid in 8 payments, she will buy guinea pigs, chickens, and also will install the foundation for her new home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Elsa tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito” de Huaraz, ella espera tener un puesto seguro para vender sus productos y no descuidar a sus dos hijos, ya que su esposo es albañil y tiene trabajos esporádicamente, también espera poder construir su casa en un terreno que lo han adquirido con esfuerzo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pavos y gallinas, las cuales después los vende en las ferias de lunes y jueves en la ciudad de Huaraz, también vende los huevos que ponen sus gallinas, en un promedio de 30 huevos semanales.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1 500.00 soles, que lo pagará en 8 cuotas, ella comprará cuyes ,gallinas y también pondrá las bases para su nueva casa

loans.use: Buy small animales (guinea pigs, chickens)

loans.name: Yanet Esmeralda

texts.es:
Janeth is 33 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor de De Martha II.” She finds it difficult to think about the future, she prefers not to propose anything because she believes one could die at any moment; she lives together with her husband and 2 children. In spite of having studied elementary education she couldn’t work in that field, for difficult moments that have happened in her life which she preferred not to mention. For 12 years she has sold vegetables, primarily tomatoes, in the Quillcay stop on the Hualcán avenue in Huaraz city. She mentions that it is difficult to get up at 1 AM to buy vegetables from the wholsalers.

With a loan for s/.500.00 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy tomatoes at wholesale to later sell in her makeshift stand.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Janeth tiene 33 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de De Martha II”, le es difícil creer en el futuro, prefiere no proponer nada porque cree que puede morir en cualquier momento, (menciona); ella vive junto a su conviviente y a sus dos hijos menores a pesar de haber estudiado docencia en primaria no lo pudo ejercer, por difíciles momentos que ella fue pasando en su vida que prefiere no mencionar. Desde hace doce años ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, principalmente tomates en la parada Quillcay en el jirón Hualcán de la ciudad de Huaraz, ella menciona que lo mas difícil es levantarse a la una de la mañana para comprar verduras a los mayoristas.

Con el préstamo de s/. 500.00 soles que lo pagará en cuatro cuotas, ella comprará tomates al por mayor que después lo vendará en su puesto provisorio.

loans.use: Buy tomatoes at wholesale

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina is 60 years old and has been a widow for 10 years. She has 3 grown children, Rossana, a teacher, Marlene, a lawyer, and Jimmy, who is finishing his 3rd year of law school.

Previously they had a grocery store in their home but she couldn’t maintain it when she was widowed. Over the years and with the loans from the Fundación Paraguaya she started a business selling jewelry. She does have a steady job in the National Burn Center hospital located in Aregua city, one hour from the city where she lives. There she works as a cook and sells her jewelry to the nurses and doctors.

She would like to open a shop in her home as soon she will retire from the Center where she works. The loan will be used to buy jewelry such as necklaces, earrings, bracelets and rings, all maD. of silver.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Clementina tiene 60 años y quedo viuda hace diez años, cuenta con tres hijos mayores Rossana Docente, Marlene Abogada y Jimmy cursando actualmente el 3º año D. la carrera D. Derecho.

Anteriormente poseían una despensa en su domicilio que no pudo mas mantener cuando quedo viuda. Con los años y con los préstamos D. la Fundación Paraguaya se dedicó a la venta D. joyas. Ella posee un trabajo fijo en el Centro Nacional del Quemado que queda en la ciudad D. Aregua que dista a una hora D. la ciudad donD. ella vive. Ahí ella trabaja como cocinera y venD. sus joyas a las enfermeras y doctoras del lugar.

Le gustaría mas adelante abrir una mercería en su domicilio ya que dentro D. poco se jubilará del centro en donD. trabaja. El crédito será para la compra D. Joyas tales como cadenas, aros, pulseras, anillos todos D. plata.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry

loans.name: Delfín

texts.es:
Delfín is 48 years old and married to Graciela de Obregón, they do not have children. He has had a general store located in a well known neighborhood of Luque for more than 10 years.

Delfín emigrated from Misiones state to her current location. He supplies his neighbors meat, rice, milk, charcoal, baked goods, and other supplies that he buys in the city’s center.

He has successfully been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for 8 years. The loan that he seeks will be used to buy meat, rice, milk, charcoal, baked goods and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Delfín tiene 48 años esta casado con la señora Graciela de Obregón, no tienen hijos. Tiene una despensa ubicada en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Luque hace mas de 10 años.

El señor Delfín emigró del departamento de Misiones. El mismo surte a sus vecinos de carne, arroz, leche, carbón, panificados y otros víveres los cuales compra del centro de la ciudad.

Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde hace 8 años en forma excelente. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de carne, arroz, leche, carbón, panificados y otros víveres

loans.use: Buy meat, beverages, milk products, rice, vegetables.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida is a businesswoman, married to Juan Valdez, they have 2 school-aged children. They have had a general store located in their home in Luque city for 2 years. There they serve their neighbors and other customers with basic needs items such as: meat, sugar, milk products, rice, noodles, vegetables, and more.

In addition Juan sells gas, which he delivers to the snack bars, restaurants, and private businesses in the truck that they own, thereby helping with the income that supports their home.

The loan that she seeks will be used to buy general merchandise for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elida es comerciante, esta casada con el señor Juan Valdez, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar, poseen una despensa ubicada en su domicilio en la ciudad de Luque hace 2 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y ocasionales de mercaderías de primera necesidad tales como: carne, azúcar, lácteos, arroz, fideo, verduras y otros.

Además el señor Juan se dedica a la venta de gas, los cuales reparte a los copetines, comedores y particulares en la camioneta que poseen, ayudando con ese ingreso al sustento de su hogar.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías.

loans.use: Buy meat, beverages, milk products, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda Pérez was born in Luque city. She has lived with Aristides Duarte for more than 16 years. They have a son named Rodrigo with whom she works selling cow’s milk within the Yka neighborhood of Luque city.

She began this activity through the group Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) and then acquired the individual financing for her great business plan.

Today her business has grown a lot and the client list who daily receives their product has grown. Many wish to have delivery to their home which is why Facunda wants to acquire a small truck. The loan will be used to help her acquire a vehicle to be able to deliver to more places and more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Facunda Pérez nació en la ciudad de Luque, vive con Aristides Duarte desde hace más de dieciséis años. Tiene un hijo llamado Rodrigo con quien trabaja en la venta de leche de vaca dentro del asentamiento de Yka á de la ciudad de Luque.

Se inició en dicha actividad a través de un grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras para luego acceder al financiamiento individual por su gran desempeño.

Hoy día su negocio ha crecido bastante y la lista de clientes que día a día adquiere su producto ha aumentado. Muchos desean que se haga un reparto del mismo a domicilio por lo que Facunda desea adquirir una camioneta. El crédito la ayudará a adquirir el vehiculo y con el podrá llegar a mas lugares y clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to sell and deliver milk

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina B. is married and has three grown children, the oldest of whom works in Spain.

Jovina has been selling vegetables in the city market for approximately 30 years.

The Foundation’s loans have always been for the purchase of merchandise. Previously she sold in the street, now Jovina has a locale from where she serves her clients selling lettuce, tomatos, garlic, etc.

In the future Jovina wants to continue to expand her business as her earnings from her sales are what support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jovina B. está casada y tiene tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, el mayor de sus hijos se encuentra trabajando en España.

Doña Jovina desde hace aproximadamente 30 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado de la ciudad.

Los créditos que la Fundación le ha otorgado siempre fueron para la compra de mercadería. Anteriormente sus ventas los hacia en la calle, ahora Jovina ya posee un local en donde recurren sus clientes para las compras de sus lechugas, tomates, ajos, etc.

Mas adelante Doña Jovina quiere seguir ampliando su negocio ya que la ganancia que sale del mismo es para el sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Buy lettuce, parsley, garlic, tomato, onion, season fruits, etc.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian N. is 57 years old, has 3 grown children, 2 of whom are working in Spain.

Since he was a small boy Julian has worked as a baggage handler at the airport. Today and after several years of continuing to work as a baggage handler, as his family was one of humble means, he didn’t have the opportunity to receive an education. In addition to this job he works selling gold and silver jewelry.

The loan he seeks is to buy jewelry to resell and also begin construction on a room to sell his jewelry. The next loan will be to finish his own room to sell jewelry, and that room will be located in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Julian N. tiene 57 años con tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, dos de los mismos se encuentran trabajando en España

Desde muy pequeño Don Julian trabajó como maletero del aeropuerto. Hoy día y luego de varios años el sigue trabajando en el Aeropuerto como maletero, como era de una familia muy humilda el no tubo oportunidades de estudio. Además de esto el se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata.

El crédito que el solicita será para la compra de joya para así después comercializarlas y también para empezar a construir un salón de ventas.

El próximo crédito que solicitaría seria para la culminación de su propio salón de ventas de joyas que se encuentra en su domicilio.

loans.use: Buy gold and silver jewelry

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena V. was born in San Juan Nepomuceno city, she lives with José Asunción García and they have two children, Alexis and Jacqueline.

She sells food items in bulk and general merchandise, while José is a construction laborer. She began her business through the Businesswomen’s Committee until she was able to open her own business thanks to the foundation’s loans.

She is thankful to the Paraguaya Foundation for making her growth possible, with the education she has received from the committees she could manage her business better and today she now has a good income from her sales.

She is seeking a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise that will allow her to have a variety of products in stock at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora. Magdalena V. nació en la ciudad de San Juan Nepomuceno, vive con José Asunción García con quien tuvo dos hijos Alexis y Jacqueline todos menores.

Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos comestibles, a granel y mercerías varias, mientras que José es constructor de obras. Se inicio en el comercio a través del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras hasta que pudo abrir su propio negocio gracias a los créditos de la fundación.

Ella agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por hacer posible su crecimiento, pues con las capacitaciones que recibió con los comités ella pudo administrarse mejor y hoy día ya posee un buen ingreso de ventas.

El crédito que ella en esta ocasión solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías que le permitirá poseer una mayor variedad de productos en su stock.

loans.use: Buy in bulk food items such as corn, green beans, peanuts, vegetables, fruit, canned goods, and general merchandise.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena J. is 52 years old and married to 61 year old Pablo, and they have 5 sons and 1 daughter, of whom one is working and the rest are students.

Previously they owned a small clothing tailor shop that didn’t go very well, then they opened a general store in their neighborhood and later a location to sell fish in their home and another near the river where they also rent canoes to fish.

They would like their son to return to Paraguay one day as he traveled to Spain over 5 years ago to look for new opportunities and for the rest of their children to finish their university studies.

The loan that they currently seek will be used to buy soda pop, rice, noodles, oil, mild, eggs, and canned goods for their general store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. María Elena J. tiene 52 años y está casada con el Sr. Pablo de 61 años, con quien tuvo seis hijos cinco varones y una nena, de los cuales uno esta en exterior trabajando y los demás estudiando.

Anteriormente poseían un taller pequeño de confecciones que no le resulto muy bien, después abrieron una despensa en su barrio y más tarde un local de venta de pescado en su domicilio y otro cerca del río en donde alquilan también canoas para la pesca.

Le gustaría que su hijo vuelva al Paraguay algún día, él viajó hace más de 5 años a España para buscar nuevos horizontes y que los demás hijos terminen la universidad.

El crédito que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de gaseosas, arroz, fideo, aceite, leche, huevo enlatados para su despensa.

loans.use: Buy soda pop, milk, rice, noodles, cookies, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. María posee 36 años, esta casada con el señor. Emilio Ibarrola que es comerciante, tienen un hijo de 15 años que estudia ingles y esta en un colegio privado en la ciudad de Luque cursando el 1º año de la educación media.

Su negocio esta ubicado cerca de un colegio que le brinda muchos clientes, se iniciaron primeramente con un comedor luego con los ahorros que poseían de la venta de empanadas y la gran demanda de clientes lograron abrir para su despensa hace mas de diez años. La señora María es profesora de gastronomía y tiene como otra actividad surtir al colegio de almuerzos para los alumnos que estudian doble turno. Quieren terminar algún día los salones comerciales que construyeron y no terminaron por falta de recursos, para poder así tener un mayor ingreso de la renta que les generaría.

Esperan que el día de mañana su hijo estudie en la universidad y se reciba de Ing. Electrónico ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá para la ampliación de su stock de mercaderías comprando mas galletas, azúcar, gaseosas, arroz, fideos, leche.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and is married to Emilio Ibarrola, who is a merchant. They have a 15 year old boy that studies English in a private school, and is in his first year middle school. Maria’s business is located close to a school, which provides many clients. She began with a food stand then later after savings from the sale of empanadas she was able to open her convenient store over 10 years ago. Maria is a professor of gastronomy and is trying to give cooking lessons to those students that study both in the morning and evening in order to get ahead. She and her family want to finish construction on their commercial property, which has been halted due to a lack of resources. This would increase there income and profitability. They hope that there son will some day be able to go to university and get an electrical engineering degree since they never had the opportunity to attend. The credit they are soliciting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and inventory, such as bread, sugar, sodas, rice, pastas, and milk.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise and inventory, such as bread, sugar, sodas, rice, pastas, and milk

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga A. was born in Asunción and she is married to Hilarion Vilchi for more than 10 years. They have 4 children: three daughters ages 10, 24 and 30 and one son who is 26 years old.

For more than 7 years she has made all kinds of clothing, a profession that has helped her meet the expenses of her son Victor who is finishing his studies in medicine in Cuba as well as support her family’s expenses with the help of her husband.

She has worked with the Foundation since 2003 to buy her industrial sewing machines. Today she is asking for another loan to acquire great quantities of fabric, buttons, zippers and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Olga A. nació en la ciudad de Asunción, esta casada con el Sr. Hilarion Vilchi desde hace mas de diez años, tiene cuatro hijos, tres nenas de 10, 24 y 30 años respectivamente y un varón de 26 años.

Se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropas desde hace mas de siete años, profesión que la ayudó a solventar los gastos de su hijo Victor quien terminó la carrera de medicina en Cuba y también a mantener los gastos de su familia con la ayuda de su esposo.

Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003 logrando aumentar su activo fijo con la compra de máquinas industriales. Hoy día ella desea otro crédito para poder adquirir telas en grandes cantidades, botones, cierres y accesorios.

loans.use: buy large quantities of fabric, buttons, zippers and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cuy, fabrics, laces, and yarn.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el presente comité fue la Señora Etelvina P. quien se acercó a la oficina y se informó sobre el programa, luego invitó y organizó a sus vecinas para formar un comité.

La señora Etelvina P. quien se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora Leonarda C., es modista pero se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles

. La señora Mirtha A., es artesana e invertirá el dinero en la compra de karanday que son los materiales para su trabajo.

La señora Nazaria A., es artesana e invertirá el dinero en la compra de karanday que son los elementos de trabajo.

La señora Ramona L., es vendedora de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercaderias( prendas en general).

La señora Victoria P., se dedica a la venta de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra mercaderías ( prendas en general)

La señora Virginia B. se dedica a la venta de remedio e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías al por mayor

. La señora Gladys C., se dedica a la venta de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería (prendas para adultos)

La señora Maria R., se dedica a la venta de ropas e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas para niños y adultos.

La señora Julia R. se dedica a venta de ropas y artículos de mercería e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas en general, espejos, peines, pinza para cabello, etc.

La señorita Maria I., es vendedora de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora Alicia M., es costurera e invertirá el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo (telas, hilos, agujas etc.)

La señora Ysidora, es vendedora de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas en general.

La señora Sonia A., se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora María S.. se dedica en la venta de comestible, e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles

. La señora Eulogia M., se dedica a la venta de de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora María M. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero a la compra insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Etelvina P., who stopped by the loan office and was informed about the program and then invited and organized her neighbors to form a group.

Ms. P. makes a living by selling refreshments and will invest the money in the purchase of these products.

Leonarda C. is a dressmaker but makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

Mirtha A. is an artisan and will invest in the purchase of twine, which she uses to make her crafts.

Nazaria Alamda also is an artisan and will purchase twine.

Ramona L. sales clothing and will invest in the purchase of general attire.

Victoria P. also sells clothes and will purchase general attire as well.

Virginia B. sells over the counter medicines and will invest in the purchase of these items at wholesale.

Gladys Caballeo makes a living selling clothes and will purchase adult attire.

Maria R. sells clothing and will use the money to purchase clothing for children and adults.

Julia R. sells clothing and haberdashery and will invest in the purchase of general clothing, mirrors, combs, hairpins, etc.

Maria I. sells refreshments and will use the loan to buy these products.

Alicia M. is a seamstress and will invest in the purchase of fabrics, threads, needles, etc.

Ysidora R. sells clothing and will use the loan to purchase general attire.

Sonia A. makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

María S. also sells meals and will invest in ingredients.

Eulogia M. sells refreshments and will use the loan to purchase these products.

María M. makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

María S. also sells meals and will invest in ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products related to their businesses

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
Nemecio is retired and his wife is a housewife, they have four grown independent children but they do not provide financial support to their parents.

The couple lives in the Tacagua area of La Paz and own their own home. They are seeking a loan to make improvements on their home, and change the sewer as the village is demanding this maintenance.

This is the second time Nemecio places his trust in us and the second time that he requires the support of Kiva. His history gives him an excellent qualification to access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Nemecio es jubilado y su esposa es ama de casa, la pareja tiene cuatro hijos completamente independientes pero que no disponen de recursos para ayudarla.

La pareja vive en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene casa propia. Solicitan crédito para realizar refacciones en su vivienda y cambiar el alcantarillado ya que la alcaldía esta exigiendo dicho mantenimiento.

Es la segunda vez que Nemecio deposita su confianza en nosotros y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva. Su historial le da una calificación excelente por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Remodel their home

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se formó gracias una de las integrantes se entero del programa del comité y decidió formar uno nuevo con sus vecinas y amigas. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes, y se encuentran en el sétimo ciclo del programa, en el transcurso de cada ciclo el comité demostró una muy buena organización, pudiendo superar cada problema que fue surgiendo.

-Lucila R. de F. Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Aurelia S. de Fleitas Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Emilia R. Grance Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Nidia A. Leiva Invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes para tortas, entre otros.

- Clotilde G. de Ramírez Invertirá en la compra de una vaca.

- Joana Espínola de Ramírez Invertirá en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, carbón, panificados, frutas y verduras.

- Zulma Alejandra M. Invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, toallitas, etc.

- María Raquel Gómez Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- Carolina Gómez Invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes para tortas, entre otros.

- María Karina F. R. Invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, panificados, servilletas, etc.

- María Natividad G. Invertirá en la compra de arcilla blanca, pintura, etc.

- Natividad O. de G. Invertirá en la compra de arcilla blanca, pintura, etc.

- Luz María Cáceres M. Invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, toallitas, etc.

- María Cristina R. Invertirá en la compra de semillas, abono, verduras en general.

- Marian Eugenia B. Invertirá en la reparación de congelador.

- Susana Elise T. de Espínola Invertirá en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, carbón, panificados, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Guapa was formed because one of the members found out about the committee program and decided to start a new one with her neighbors and friends. Right now the committee has 16 members, and they are in the seventh cycle of the program. During each of the cycles the committee demonstrated very good organization, being able to overcome each problem that came up.

-Lucila R. de F. will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Aurelia S. de Fleitas will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Emilia R. Grance will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

-Nidia A. Leiva will invest in buying flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, among other things.

- Clotilde G. de Ramírez will invest in buying a cow.

- Joana Espínola de Ramírez will invest buying rice, pasta, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables.

- Zulma Alejandra M. will invest in buying cloth, thread, napkins, etc.

- María Raquel Gómez will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

- Carolina Gómez will invest in buying flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, among other things.

- María Karina F. R. will invest in buying meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, etc.

- María Natividad G. will invest in buying white clay, paint, etc.

- Natividad O. de G. will invest in buying white clay, paint, etc.

- Luz María Cáceres M. will invest in buying cloth, thread, napkins, etc.

- María Cristina R. will invest in buying seed, fertilizer, and vegetables in general.

- Marian Eugenia B. will invest in repairing a freezer.

- Susana Elise T. de Espínola will invest buying rice, pasta, sugar, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables.


Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, vegetables, oil, bread products, napkins, flour, sugar, yeast, cake baking tins, rice, pasta, milk, charcoal, bread products, fruits, and vegetables, cloth, thread, napkins, a cow, and repairing a freezer among other things.

loans.name: Hermo

texts.es:
Hermo has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi Monday through Sunday. He mainly works in the Villa Fátima area since there is a lot of demand for his services by the local merchants (his vehicle is a van with a top rack).

The client is divorced and has three children, one of the attends college. His house is located in the Alto Miraflores area in the city of La Paz. Hermo's rent is very expensive.

The loan will be used to provide maintenance to his vehicle and to buy parts. This is his first credit with Impro but his willingness to work hard allow him to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Hermo tiene un vehiculo que usa como taxi de lunes a domingo. Su recorrido abarca mas que todo por la zona de Villa Fátima ya que existe mucho flujo de comerciantes que solicitan sus servicios (su vehículo es una vagoneta con parrilla).

El cliente es divorciado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno esta en la universidad. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, Hermo paga un elevado alquiler El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y la compra de repuestos. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su buena predisposición para el trabajo, le permiten acceder al crédit

loans.use: Maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Victoria Celia

texts.es:
Victoria buys and sells clothing, jewelry and perfumes per her clients’ orders. She offers jewelry and perfume by catalog. She sells her products in markets, offices, and neighborhoods. She is a widow and has two children, one still dependent on her because he attends school and she is the only source of support for her family.

Her home is located in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy merchandise which will permit her to have a greater variety of products to offer her clients.

This is the fifth time that she is seeking a loan from Impro, the second time through Kiva, and her credit history qualifies her as a client 1, or, in other words, a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Victoria se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa, joyas y perfumes a pedido. Ofrece las joyas y perfumes por catalogo, sus productos son vendidos en mercados, oficinas y vecindarios. Es viuda y tiene dos hijos, uno depenD. D. ella porque asiste al colegio y es la única que genera ingresos para la subsistencia D. su familia.

Su docimilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Alto San pedro D. la ciudad D. La Paz. El crédito será destinado para la compra D. mercadería, lo cual le permitirá tener mayor disponibilidad D. productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva, su historial lo califica como cliente 1, es decir, como un cliente responsable.

loans.use: capital to buy merchandise to sell to clients

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
This committee formed thanks to the efforts of Carmen I. who belonged to the Peace and Tranquility committee together with Porfiria Martínez, Diana González and Patricia M. who decided to form another committee inviting their friends to be part of the program.

Porfiria Martínez sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Carmen I. sells lingerie and silver items and will invest the money in buying these items.

Limpia N. sells cleaning products and will invest in the materials to make these products.

Justa Ruiz sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Agustina Gómez sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Francisca C. has a general store and will invest the money in buying general merchandise, beverages, canned goods, etc.

Agueda Gómez sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Patricia M. sells clothing and will invest the money in buying clothing items.

Blanca Rodríguez sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Dora A. sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Marilina M. is a hair stylist and will invest the money in buying items for her work.

Emilia L. is a hair stylist and will invest the money in buying items for her work.

Carolina González has a small store and will invest the money in buying merchandise for her store.

Modesta Benítez is an artisan and will invest the money in buying supplies for her work.

Lidia Vázquez sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Sergia Fernández sells food and will invest the money in buying ingredients to make food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Este comité se formo gracias a la señora Carmen I.. Que pertenecía al comité Paz y Tranquilidad junto con otras personas que son Porfiria Martínez, Diana González y Patricia M. que decidieron formar otro comité invitando a sus amigas a ser parte del programa.

La señora Porfiria Martínez quien se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercaderas para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora Carmen I. se dedica a la venta de lencería y platería e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora Limpia N. se dedica a la venta de producto de limpieza e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de esos productos.

La señora Justa Ruiz se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora Agustina Gómez, se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora FranciscaC., tiene una despensa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercaderías bebidas, enlatados, etc.

La señora Agueda Gómez, se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora Patricia M., se dedica a la venta de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas en general.

loans.use: The money will be utilized to buy: beverages, baked goods, eggs, flour, oil, ingredients to make food, cosmetics, clothing, cleaning supplies ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The Mujeres Unidas ("Women United") committee was formed when the leaders of the neighborhood commission invited them to form it. The committee now has 16 members and it was one of the first committees set up in the city of Luque. It's now in the ninth cycle of the program.

- Bertilda Centurion will invest in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pull-overs.

- Mary Liz G. de Tullo will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Estela Mary C. will invest inthe purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Digna Carolina Bogarin will invest in the purchase of herbal medicines.

- Ana Maria L. will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Azucena de Maria A. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Justina B. de Baez will invest in the purchase of flour, rice, pasta, sugar, bakery goods, among other things.

- Luz Bella A. de Bogado will invest in the purchase of perfumes.

- Maria Librada C. will invest in the purchase of meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Carmen M. Ojeda will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Maria Concepcion G. will invest in the purchase of herbal medicines, meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Angela Beatriz V. de Chavez will invest in the purchase of meat, plates for empanadas, vegetables, cooking oil, napkins, among other things.

- Zunilda Z. G. will invest in the purchase of apples, oranges, tangerines, pears, peaches.

- Fidelina G. will invest in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pull-overs.

- Maria Lozanta G. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

- Maria Graciela G. will invest in the purchase of charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El comité Mujeres Unidas se formó mediante que los dirigentes de la comisión del barrio realizaron la invitación a las vecinas para formar el comité. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes, fue uno de los primeros comités formados en la ciudad de Luque y ahora se encuentran en el noveno ciclo del programa.

- Bertilda C. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, camperas.

- Mary Liz González de Tullo invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Estela Mary C. invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Digna Carolina B. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales.

- Ana María L. invertirá en la compra de harina, arroz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Azucena de María Arévalos invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- Justina B. de Báez invertirá en la compra de harina, arróz, fideos, azúcar, panificados, entre otros.

- Luz Bella A. de Bogado invertirá en la compra de perfumes.

- María Librada C. invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Carmen M. Ojeda invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- María Concepción González invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales, carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Ángela Beatriz V. de Chávez invertirá en la compra de carne, discos para empanadas, verduras, aceite, servilletas, entre otros.

- Zunilda Z. G. invertirá en la compra de manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas, peras, durazno.

- Fidelina González invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, camperas.

- María Lozanta G. invertirá en la compra de carbón.

- María Graciela G. invertirá en la compra de carbón.

loans.use: Miscellaneous businesses: Buy products for resale and/or buy supplies for making products for sale.

loans.name: Arsacia

texts.en:
Arsacia is 56 years old and has been married for 41 years. She and her husband have 12 children, the youngest of whom is 19 years old and studying at the University. Arsacia already has 10 grandchildren, but expects many more as five of her daughters have not yet married or started a family.

Arsacia and her husband grew up in the country and lived for the first twenty years of their marriage on a farm, where they grew vegetables and sold milk and eggs. Twenty years ago they moved to the city, and Arsacia opened a small grocery/variety store. Today her store is very successful, mostly because of the good prices she offers. All 12 of Arsacia's children work as well, and one of her sons owns a barber shop next door to her shop. Arsacia is asking for a small loan in order to re-stock merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to re-stock merchandise in her store

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino M. tiene 43 años y esta casado con la señora Rosa Patiño de M. que tiene 41 años. Tienen 2 hijos, un varón de 16 años que esta cursando sus estudios secundarios y una niña de 10 años que esta cursando sus estudios primarios.

El señor Faustino comenta que se inicio en el trabajo de la costura como ayudante en el año 1981 cuando solo tenia 16 años en una sastrería de la capital. Decidió trabajar en forma independiente y habilitar su propio taller en el año 1992 y dice contar con una buena cantidad de clientes que trabajan en diferentes Empresas y Entidades Publicas.

El mismo desea invertir en la compra de telas por fardos, de diferentes tipos para la confección de trajes y camisas para obtener mayores descuentos por los mismos y aumentar sus ganancias por las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en:
Mr. Faustino M. is 43 years old, married to 41 year old Mrs. Rosa Patiño de M.. They have 2 children, a 16 year old son in high school and a 10 year old daughter in primary school. Faustino says that he began his work as a tailor’s assistant in 1981 when he was only 16 years old in a tailor shop in the capital. He decided to work independently and open his own shop in 1992 and he says he has a good quantity of customers that work in different businesses and public entities. He would like to invest in buy different types of fabric by the bundle in order to get larger discounts to use the fabric make suits and shirts and thereby increase his earnings on the items that he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of fabric

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
The Juntas Podemos ("Together We Can") committee was formed in the Virgen de Caacupe neighborhood in the city of Ypane. There are 18 members, the majority of whom engage in their own separate businesses.

The committee has a solid organization and has strongly supported its members' business activities. Its members have demonstrated their unity by establishing rules and regulations. This committee has participated in training offered by the program.

It's been noted that all have grown impressively, the members, that is, showing responsibility for their obligations.

They have established various kinds of businesses: Among them are women who sell fruits and vegetables or own kiosks and shops. Others sell clothing, jewelry, sheets, towels, ice cream, soft drinks, food and bedspreads. The loan that they're applying for will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Comité “Juntas Podemos” se formo en el Asentamiento Virgen de Caacupe de la Ciudad de Ypané, este comité cuenta con 18 integrantes la mayoría de ellas cuentan con actividades individuales.

El comité se encuentra sólido en cuanto a su organización y es muy constante en lo que respecta a actividades realizadas en la comunidad comité. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos. Este comité ha participado de las capacitaciones brindados por el programa.

En todas se ha notado un gran crecimiento, en cuanto a lo personal se refiere, siendo responsables con sus obligaciones.

Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades entre ellas hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras, otras poseen kioscos y despensas, otras venden ropas, joyas, sábanas, toallas, helados, gaseosas, comidas y colchas. El crédito que solicitan será invertido en la compra de mercaderías para las actividades nombradas.

loans.use: Miscellaneous businesses: Buy products for resale or supplies for making products for sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor is a producer of cow's milk. He has a commercial relationship with PIL Andina S.A. which a distributor of dairy products. They pay him every two weeks. Victor also works inseminating cows. This business is his main source of income and it supports his three small children.

He lives in the Comunidad Tipampa, Provincia Omasuyo, Departament de La Paz (three hours away from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase a medium quality dairy cow so he can increase his production.

This is his second loan with Impro, his previous paying record qualify him for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Victor es productor de leche de vaca, tiene relación comercial con PIL Andina S.A. empresa que distribuye productos lácteos y le paga quincenalmente. El cliente también trabaja como inseminador de vacas. La actividad lechera es su principal fuente de ingreso y cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos pequeños.. Vive en la Comunidad Tipampa Provincia Omasuyo del Departamento de La Paz (a tres horas de la Ciudad de El Alto). El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, así se incrementará su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marquencitas Group

texts.en:
My journey to see the group called "Marquencitas" was not the usual route one would take to go to work every day! I had to take a boat from Panajachel´s docks to San Juan de la Laguna. 

The members of the Marquencitas trust bank, natives of San Marcos la Laguna, hopped also into a public "lancha" (boat) and went to the town of San Juan. These women have to travel to San Juan because there is no commercial bank in San Marcos la Laguna.

Upon my arrival, I was picked up by the loan officer and… all the women! 

The entire group was there to welcome me and, as though we were in a procession, we strolled through the streets of the pretty town of San Juan, and they took me to the repayment meeting site.

Most of the women work in embroidery and some sew traditional skirts and blouses. Two of them have a convenience store and two others raise animals. Odilia, the president of the group, has a convenience store and, while selling in her store, she does also bead work on the side. There is a feeling in the group that the repayment meetings are a moment of fun and it helps these women to have a bit of fun in their lives.

The women tell me they like San Marcos because it is clean, because all the garbage is collected by the municipality's truck. It makes them happy that the village is treated so well. Florinda tells me it must be because of the influence of the foreigners who have their businesses in San Marcos. 

However, the arrival of foreigners isn't making all the women of the group happy. San Marcos is the Mecca of this region where western spiritual business boomed after the seventies. There are many places where massages, meditation, and other spirituality are practiced. This is good for the local economy but, unfortunately, most of the money is made by the foreigners and the native inhabitants of San Marcos make very little money themselves.  

During the rainy season, the women make only enough money to cover their repayments. This way they just make it until summer time arrives. They all expect business will improve and they will be able to make some money in different ways as soon as the rainy season ends.

I cant help but think how unbalanced their situation must feel; not being able to make the money that they need to keep their daily lives going when, next to them, others make money in ways they don't control. However, it is also incredible how these women, challenged by poverty and economic inequality, keep fighting for better lives for their families.

loans.use: To invest their current business by buying materials needed for embroidery

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young man who works in public transportation in the Trufi 88 of the Eduardo Avaroa Union. This is his only source of income and it also covers his sister's living expenses as she lives with him. They live in a rented house which is located in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to make some urgent repairs to his vehicle, which is the tool of his trade.

This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation that was completed qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Edwin es un joven transportista, trabaja prestando servicio publico en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, es su única fuente de ingreso, cubre la manutención de su hermana que vive con él. Los hermanos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la Zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (movilidad) puesto que necesita con urgencia unas reparaciones. Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica favorablemente y por eso puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité Nuevo Amanecer se unieron entre vecinas del barrio centro de la ciudad de Villa Elisa para de tal forma participar del programa. Así llegaron a formar un comité de mujeres y llegaron a acceder al correspondiente para la financiación de sus actividades económicas. En el comité se encuentran muchas personas y una variada gama de actividades económicas que desarrollan cada una de sus integrantes. El crédito recibido de la Fundación Paraguaya es muy útil para financiar cada una de los micro emprendimientos de las integrantes del comité, que se están desarrollando con este programa. Todas las Sras son madres y trabajadoras, lo que las une de una manera especial y fortalece el compromiso solidario del préstamo.

El crédito que solicitan será para la compra de varios artículos, la mayoría de ellos, materia prima o artículos de mercancía para las actividades de las integrantes del comité. Por ejemplo, la Sra. María Beatriz C. invertirá su préstamo en la compra de telas, botones, hilos y todos los materiales que necesita para la confección de ropas. Este tipo de artículos son adquiridos por todas las integrantes que se dedican a la confección de ropa. Otras que se dedican a la fabricación de dulces, tortas, etc. adquirirán azúcar, harina, vainilla, huevos, leche, entre otros. Las señora dedicadas al comercio, o sea las que tienen despensa, casilla, venta de cosméticos etc. utilizarán su crédito para la compra de artículos para la venta, tales como discos, azúcar, cosméticos, ropas o introduciendo nuevos productos para la venta, como ropas a la moda, nuevos productos de limpieza, etc.
texts.en:
The members of the New Dawn Committee are women from the central neighborhood of Villa Elisa. They formed the group to help finance their economic activities. There are many people in the committee who carry out a variety of activities to make a living. The loan they receive from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguay is very useful in financing each member's small businesses, which they have developed thanks to this program. All the women are mothers and hard workers, and what brings them together and strengthens their bond is a common commitment to the loan.

The loan will be used to purchase various items, the majority being raw materials or supplies for the members' various business activities. For example, María Beatriz C. plans to invest her loan in the purchase of fabrics, buttons, threads and all the other materials needed to make clothing. These types items will be acquired by all the members who work as seamstresses. Others who make a living selling desserts and candies will invest in the purchase of sugar, flour, vanilla, eggs, milk, among other items. The women dedicated to commerce or have a convenience store, or sell cosmetics will use their loan to purchase items to sell, such as discs, sugar, beauty products, clothing or new products to start selling (new clothing styles, new cleaning products, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Reina Blanca

texts.es:
Reina is a young and enterprising woman. She sells the products that her father produces (traditional bread from the Laja region). She is also a craft woman and makes wool textiles (sweaters and blankets) with an old sawing machine (her only work tool). She lives at her father's house, located in the carretera de la Laja (tramo entre El Alto y Desaguadero), Los Andes Province, an hour and a half from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase raw material (wool and thread) to produce more and satisfy the demand for her products in the market.

This is her first loan with Impro. The results of her evaluation allows us to trust her.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Reina es una mujer joven y emprendedora, comercializa los productos que produce su padre (pan de LAJA) también es artesana, confecciona tejidos en lana (chompas y mantas) con una máquina de tejer antigua (su única herramienta de trabajo). Vive en la casa de su padre ubicada en la carretera (tramo entre El Alto y Desaguaguadero) de Laja, Provincia Los Andes a una hora y media de la Ciudad de La Paz) El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materia prima (lana e hilo) para poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es su primer crédito con Impro, el resultado de nuestra evaluación nos permite confiar en ella

loans.use: To Purchase raw material

loans.name: Ccatarisun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Ccatarisun Llaqta is located in the District of Acoria in the Huancavelica region, Peru's poorest region, at an altituD. of 2880 meters above sea level. The prinicipal economic activities of the people in the region are agriculture, livestock raising and commerce.

Filomena C. R., a single mother of a 3 year old boy, is requesting a loan of 400 soles (Peruvian currency). Her business is vegetable sales. Starting as a child she worked selling vegetables in order to support her younger sisters. Her goal is to sell vegetables in every fair. To meet this goal she needs capital, but previously no one would loan to her because she did not meet the approval requirements. When she was ill for a time, her business suffered and she had to borrow money from her neighbor at 10% interest. Finally she saw that a FINCA representative was giving out loans accompanied by business training. Says Filomena, "From that moment FINCA trusted me, lending me the capital to grow my business. I bought embroidery thread and now I am embroidering the petticoats local women wear under the skirts of our traditional dress; it is going very well." One of Filomena's obstacles has been a year-long bout of gastritis, which severly impacted her business, but she had the support of her family and FINCA. With the loan, she is going to buy cloth with which to make aprons, since she has a small sewing machine. Through local bartering, she trades the aprons that she makes for corn and barley. She dreams of one day opening a clothing store with her own savings, and sellling wholesale. Some day she would also like to get to know the capital city of Lima, arriving there as a business woman.

Patricia R. R. is married with 8 children ranging in age from 12 to 22. All of her children are in school; the eldest attends the national university. She is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian soles. Her business is the sale of lambs; Patricia raises sheep. Before she was born her father passed away. As a result, the people of the village marginalized her. A friend took her to Lima where she got married and started a business with her husband. Unfortunately, the couple lost everything in a robbery and had to return to her village with nothing. That's when Patricia began to raise her sheep. "When FINCA arrived in the village the community did not support me in my application for a loan because they did not believe I would be able to repay it, but I stood my ground. In the end, FINCA loaned me the money and gave me the business training. I was able to reopen my business selling meat and free range eggs. Now that I qualify for a larger loan I would like to begin selling my meat in Lima. Thanks to FINCA and their training courses, I feel valued, and the people no longer marginalize me since I now have a stable business." The loan will be invested in rams, more eggs, and cheese. Her dream is to have a butcher stand in the city of Huancavelica, and to support her son in the university, in the hope that he will later be able to support his younger siblings, so that they, too, may go on to be professionals.

Maria C. R., single mother of a 4 year old son, is taking out a loan of 800 Peruvian soles. She sells potatoes, and has now started a business making embroidered petticoats. "In the beginning I did not want to walk into the training meetings; I didn't say a word in them. Now I am very talkative." Maria is the local president of the Glass of Milk program, a national social program providing basic and much-needed nutrition to the poor. Her leadership of that program demonstrates that she knows how to value herself as a woman. Now, she says, people say that she is an entrepreneur, thanks to God, because FINCA trusted her. Maria overcame a difficult obstacle in life: the father of her son left her, leaving her with only the support of an aunt. With the loan from FINCA she will buy an embroidery frame and perhaps hire an assistant. She dreams of owning her own embroidery business, which she will call "El Resplandor" ( perhaps "The Glow" or "The Gleam" in English).

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Bancomunal Ccatarisun Llaqta perteneciente al Distrito D. Acoria y al departamento D. Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud D. 2880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.

Filomena C. R., madre soltera D. un niño D. 3 años, solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles, su negocio es la venta D. verduras, desD. niña trabajaba con verduras, para mantener a sus hermanitas, su meta es vender verduras en cada feria es por eso que necesita Capital, pero antes nadie le prestaba, no cumplía los requisitos, llego a enfermarse entonces su negocio bajo y tuvo que prestarse D. su vecina al 10% D. interés hasta que observó que una promotora D. FINCA trabaja dando crédito con capacitaciones, Filomena dice: “...desD. ese momento FINCA confío en mi, prestándome para crecer en mi negocio, compre hilos D. bordar, telas y ahora estoy bordando fustanes y me va bien...”. Una dificultad que tuvo fue enfermarse D. gastritis fracasando 1 año en el negocio, pero tuvo el apoyo D. su familia y D. FINCA. Con el prestamos va a comprar mas telas para confeccionar mandiles por que tiene su maquinita D. coser, los mandiles que hace los cambia en trueque con maíz y cebada. Su sueño es tener una tienda D. ropa y vender al por mayor, con sus ahorro tener una tienda y algún día quiere conocer Lima e ir como empresaria.

Patricia R. R., casada, con 8 hijos cuyas edades están entre12 y 22 años, van a la escuela y el mayor esta en la universidad Nacional, solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles, su negocio es la venta D. corderos (pastora). Antes que naciera falleció su papá por lo que la gente D. su pueblo la marginaba, una amiga la llevo a Lima donD. se casó y puso un negocio con su esposo pero les robaron todo y tuvo que regresar a su pueblo sin nada, comenzó a pastorear sus ovejitas, cuando llego FINCA las D. mi comunidad no me apoyaron para recibir mi préstamo por que creían que no podía pagar, pero me puse fuerte y FINCA me prestó y capacitó, puD. retomar mi negocio vendiendo carne, huevo D. corral. Ahora que me aumentaron D. préstamo quiere llevar carne a Lima. Gracias a FINCA y sus capacitaciones me siento mas valorada y la gente no la margina pues ya tiene un negocio seguro. El dinero del préstamo lo va invertir en carneros, mas huevos y queso. Su sueño es tener un puesto D. carnicería en la ciudad D. Huancavelica, apoyar a su hijo en la universidad para que él apoye después a sus hermanitos para que también sean profesionales.

Maria C. R., madre soltera con 1 hijo D. 4 años, saco un préstamo D. 800 soles, venD. papas, se inició trabajando confeccionando fustanes en bordado simple y aplicaciones. Nadie quería prestarle pero llegó FINCA y le prestó para comprar mas lana y tela. Al inicio no quería entrar a mis reuniones pues era callada pero ahora ya soy habladora. Es presidenta del programa D. vaso D. leche, señala que sabe valorarse como mujer y ahora dicen que es empresaria gracias a Dios por que FINCA confió en ella. El problema que supero es que el padre D. su hijo la dejó y solo contó con el apoyo D. una tía. Con el préstamo D. FINCA va comprar bastidor D. bordar y tal vez contrate un peón. Su sueño es tener su pequeña empresa D. bordado “el resplandor”

loans.use: The communal bank Ccatarisun Llaqta is requesting a loan of 8100 Peruvian soles. The group is made of 16 women who live in the Quimina community. They want to use the loan to carry out their plans for their businesses.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo has a small bakery business he runs with his children. He makes traditional bread of the Laja region (a province of The Andes) which has no fat and no yeast. His daughter sells the product to travelers between the city of El Alto and Desaguadero. Carmelo owns his house.

The loan will be used to purchase flour, so he can have a stock that will last him a while. Especially because at the present time there is a shortage of flour en Bolivia.

This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed approves his request.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo tiene un pequeño horno que atiende junto a sus hijos. Elabora pan tradicional de Laja (provincia Los Andes), el cual no tiene manteca ni levadura. El producto es comercializado por su hija a todos los viajeros entre la Ciudad de El Alto y Desaguadero. Carmelo tiene vivienda propia. El crédito será usado para comprar materia prima (harina) para poder tener un stock que le dure por un determinado tiempo ya que hay escasez en Bolivia. Es su primer crédito con Impro, el trabajo de evaluación realizado nos permite aprobar su solicitud

loans.use: Purchase of raw material ( flour).

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos T. de 43 años de edad es casado con la señora Maria Barboza de 41 años de edad con seis hijos de las cuales dos de ellos ya son mayores y trabajan y 4 van al colegio publico de dicho barrio que esta ubicada a 5 minutos de la ciudad viven en casa propia con todas las comodidades necesaria.

El Señor Carlos Tronbetta de profesión herrero hace mas de 12 años trabajo mucho tiempo como empleado de una empresa muy conocida en Encarnación, pero como no quería depender mas de su salario decidió abrir para su propio taller, y actualmente es propietario de una herrería que funciona hace mas de 2 años y esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular y cada día que pasa le gente le conoce mas por su calidad de trabajo que realiza y tiene mucho pedidos. Y su señora Maria Barboza es pasera hace mucho años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y el estudio de los hijos.

El señor ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de hierro por que tiene pedido de un portón y rejas para la casa de un cliente y tiene que fabricar y el margen de ganancia que le va a dejar es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos T. is 43 years old and married to 41 year old Mrs.Maria Barboza. They have 6 children, 2 of whom are now grown and working and 4 go to the public high school in their neighborhood located 5 minutes from the city. They live in their own home with all the necessary comforts. Mr. Carlos T. has worked as a blacksmith for more than 12 years as an employee of a well-known business in Encarnación, but as he didn’t want to depend any longer on his salary he decided to open his own shop, and today he is owner of a forge that has been in business for more than 2 years, and the business is located in his home. Every day that passes he becomes better known for his quality of work that he does and he has many orders. His wife, Maria Barboza, has worked as a pasera (transporting goods across the border to buy and sell) for many years and helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children. Carols has asked for a loan to buy iron because he has an order for a gate and bars for a customer’s house and he has to make the items, the profit margin will be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.es:
El señor Crescencio tiene 40 años, casado, tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en alquiler, provienen de la ciudad de Nueva Alborada. Su esposa vive y trabaja en España hace ya un par de años, la dura situación económica por la que pasaba la familia obligo a que ella vaya en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales. Ahora ella y envía giros de dinero de manera mensual. Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.

Crescensio se dedica al rubro de la construcción, el es albañil. El crédito fue destinado para la compra de materiales que el cliente necesita para terminar un trabajo particular que le proveerá de un buen dinero.

Crescencio está ahorrando para que pronto su señora pueda volver al país y volver a ser una familia unida.
texts.en:
Mr. Crescencio is 40 years old and married with two young children. He lives in a rented home in the city of Nueva Alborada. His wife has been living and working in Spain for the past two years; she was forced to go look for better work opportunities because of the tough economic situation facing their family. In Spain, she can save and send money each month. Both of the couple's two children are in school.

Crescensio works in construction as a contractor. He will use his loan to buy some materials he needs to finish a particular job, which will pay him well.

Crescencio is saving money so that his wife can return to the country and they can live as a united family once again.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials: cords, wood, electrical equipment

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina P. tiene 32 años de edad es soltera y tiene tres hijos menores, en la cual dos de ellos en la edad escolar y que estudian en el colegio publico , su pareja se encuentra trabajando fuera de la ciudad pero le envía en forma mensual para sus gastos del hogar, vive en la casa de los padres en un Barrio muy cercano de la ciudad y tiene apoyos de ellos.

La señora Cristina P. es propietaria de una Despensa que ya funciona hace mas de 6 años y vende las siguientes mercaderías: Bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, cañas, whiskys, licores, jugos, cigarrillos, panificados, Carnes, pollos, verduras, Frutas, galletitas, golosinas, gas, Artículos de limpiezas, Artículos de mercerías, etc. Que es atendida por ella misma y por su Hermana que le ayuda en los cuidados de sus hijos y a veces en la atención del negocio.

La señora ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para su Despensa que le ofrecieron y que son productos Argentino como ser Bebidas (vinos y gaseosas) por que tiene mejor aceptación a los clientes por el precio y la calidad del producto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina P. is 32 years old and single with three children, two of whom are school-age and attend a public elementary school. Her partner currently works outside the city, but he wires her money each month for her household expenditures. Mrs. P. lives in a neighborhood very close to the city in her parents' home. Her parents support her. Cristina P. has run a neighborhood store for more than 6 years, where she sells a variety of merchandise, including drinks (soda, beer, whisky, liqueur, juice), bread, meat, chicken, vegetables, fruits, cookies and crackers, sweets, canisters of gas, cleaning supplies, sewing supplies, etc. Mrs. P. usually takes care of the store herself, and her sister helps her by looking after the children or occasionally running the store. Mrs. P. has requested this loan to buy more merchandise for her store. She has been offered some Argentine drinks (wine and soda) which she would like to begin to sell, since they are preferred by her customers thanks to the price and quality of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Argentine wine and soda

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Señora Hermelinda S. is 56 years old, and has been married for a number of years to Aniceto Orrego. They live in their own house situated in the district of Natalio.

Señora Hermelinda owns a booth where she sells produce and other comestibles in la Feria on Avenida Japón in the city of Encarnación. She has dedicated herself to her this work for more than 10 years, and because of her labor she has been able to pull herself forward and educate her children all these years. Her husband is also a merchant, and grace of both of their efforts they have been able to be self sufficient and cover all their household expenses.

Señora Hermelinda has asked for a loan to fund the purchase of supplies for her booth, things such as: flour, corn meal, beef, pork, bread crumbs, chicken, and produce.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hermelinda S. tiene 56 años, esta casada hace varios años con el señor Aniceto Orrego y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el distrito de Natalio.

La señora Hermelinda posee un puesto de ventas de hortalizas y comestibles en la Feria situada en la Avenida Japón de la ciudad de Encarnación, y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años. Mediante esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante y educar a sus hijos durante todos estos años. Su esposo también es comerciante y gracias a eso ambos pueden ayudarse para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar.

La clienta ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de mas insumos para su puesto, tales como: harinas, harina de maíz, carnes, cerdos, galletas molidas, pollos, verduras en general y otros.

loans.use:
Purchase of food ingredients such as flour, corn meal, beef, pork, chicken and produce.

Compra de ingredientes para realizar comidas: harinas, harina de maiz, carnes, cerdos, pollos, verduras en general.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina A., 55, is single. She has lived in a rented house in the San Pedro Vivienda neighborhood for several years. She has a daughter who is a teacher and they live together, sharing the household expenses.

Marcelina has been the owner of a microbusiness for 12 years. She owns 2 canteens, each in a different city school. She has good stocks of merchandise in both canteens, things such as food, drinks, cookies, etc.

Marcelina has applied for a loan so that she can buy more supplies for her canteens: flour, bakery goods, drinks, cookies and other things.

Translated by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Marcelina A. es soltera, tiene 55 años, vive en una casa que alquila en el Barrio San Pedro Vivienda hace varios años. Ella tiene una hija que es docente y vive con ella en la misma casa, y entre ambas se ayudan para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

La señora Marcelina es propietaria de su microempresa desde hace 12 años, ella posee 2 cantinas, cada una situada en un colegio diferente de la ciudad. En ambas cuenta con una buena cantidad de mercaderías, como comestibles, bebidas, golosinas, etc.

La señora ha solicitado el crédito para la compra de más insumos para sus Cantinas como ser: harinas, panificados, bebidas en general, golosinas y otros.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto is married. He owns his house which has all the comforts necessary to make a home. He has 7 children. They live in the Itapua Poty area. Roberto is the owner of a shop that repairs light vehicles such as motorcycles. He's operated the business for 18 years which has allowed him to build a good customer base and income.

Roberto is applying for a loan to buy used spare parts so that he can resell them, something that will provide an extra income for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Roberto L. es casado posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar el mismo tiene 7 hijos Son de la zona de ITAPUA POTY el mismo es propietario de un taller mecánico de vehículos livianos como de motocicletas. Cuenta con 18 años de antigüedad en rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.

A solicitado de un crédito para comprar repuestos usados para luego poder revenderlos, lo que sería un ingreso extra en su taller.

loans.use: Buy used parts for resale.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
Severiano, 58, is married to Severiana and has two grown children who are now independent. They have owned the house they live in for many years. They have had an ice cream shop for more than 20 years, having come from the city of Itacurubi in the Cordillera (mountains) to the city of Encarnacion more than 20 years ago. His wife helps him with the business. The loan for which he's applied is for buying different flavors of ice cream. They provide ice cream for parties and meetings in addition to their retail sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Severiano tiene 58 años es casado con la señora Severiana, tiene dos hijos mayores ya independientes. Viven en casa propia desde hace muchos años. Tienen una heladería hace mas de 20 años, provienen de la ciudad de Itacurubi de la Cordillera y están en la Ciudad de Encarnación hace mas de 20 años. Su esposa la ayuda con el negocio. El crédito que solicitan será para la compra de helados de distintos sabores pues ellos proveen de estos a fiestas y reuniones además de la venta al por menor.

loans.use: Buy ice cream for resale.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina, 45, is married to Migdonio Medina with whom she has 3 school-aged children. She works as a cleaner for two families, one of whom she's worked for 3 years, cleaning in the morning, and the other for 4 years, cleaning in the afternoon. Migdonio started a business raising and selling pigs, a business he's been operating for 8 years. Agustina used to help him with the business but then had to find other income. Thanks to the efforts of both, they were able to finish building their house and keep their children in school. With this loan, she wants to buy more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Agustina tiene 45 años, esta casada con el Sr. Migdonio Medina con quien tiene 3 hijos adolescentes estudiantes. La Sra. Agustina es empleada domestica de dos casas particulares, uno de ellos trabaja a la mañana hace 3 años y el otro a la tarde hace 4 años. El Sr. Migdonio es el responsable del negocio de la compra cría y venta de chancho, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 8 años, anteriormente también la Sra. l ayudaba en el negocio pero luego tuvo que buscar otros ingresos extras, gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda y seguir manteniendo el estudio de sus hijos. Con el actual crédito solicitado desea comprar mayor cantidad de porcinos.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia, 20, is a student and lives with her parents. She makes a living buying and selling all kinds of clothing for children and adults. She rents a shop, selling her merchandise in the neighborhood where she lives and collecting from her customers in weekly installments. Cinthia needs this loan to buy athletic shoes because there's a lot of demand. In the future, she hopes to build her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Cinthia tiene 20 años, es estudiante y vive con sus padres. Cinthia se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de ropas ya sea para personas adultas y niños. Ella alquila un local , vende sus mercaderias en la zona donde vive y le cobra en cuotas semanales. Cinthia nesecita este credito para la compra de calzados deportivo ya que tiene muchos pedidos. En el futuro desea construir su propio local .

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dister

texts.es:
Dister is 24 and single. He's earned a living selling clothes for the past 5 years, a business he learned from his father who also makes his living this way and from whom he learned a lot. He usually buys clothes from Bolivia at the Fouth Municipal Market where merchants sell to both retailers and wholesalers from Capiata, San Lorenzo and Ita. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to finish building his house. For the future, he's thought of having a large shop where he would be able to show his merchandise and better sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
