El Sr. Dister tiene 24 años y es soltero. El Sr. se dedica a la venta de ropas hace 5 años, esta profecion aprendio de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo del cual el aprendio mucho, sus ropas normalmente suele comprar de Bolivia y del Mercado Municipal Nº4, tales mercaderias vende a clientes mayoristas y minoristas de Capiata, San Lorenzo y Ita. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudo terminar de construir su vivienda. En el futuro tiene pensado habrir un local grande para poder mostrar sus mercaderias y mayor venta de sus productos.

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector A. J. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Hector is single and lives with his mother. He wants to pursue a house through Infonavit so he doesn’t pay rent as the rents are very high. He wants to take advantage of this loan as it will be his own. Although the price has been lowered but he still needs money to close the deal with the realtor. He is asking for $875.

Hector works in a factory. His mother, Maria De los Remedios Soriano, helps him with the family expenses. She sells used clothing, which is very sought after in this city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Héctor es soltero y vive con su mama el quiere sacar una casa de infonavit para no estar pagando renta ya que las tarifas son muy altas. El quiere aprovechar este crédito de esta dependencia para que sea propia, a el se la estarán rebajando de su nomina pero aun así a el le falta dinero para completar la casa que le ofrece una inmobiliaria. El solicita $875 dólares

Héctor trabaja en una maquiladora, su mama la Señora Maria De los Remedios Soriano le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada la cual en esta ciudad es muy solicitada.

loans.use: supplemental loan for home purchase

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel is a young man who has started a family depsite not yet being married. He lives with Dulce Lucero Lopez Silva who is his partner. They live in a small room in his parents' house and this is why they want their own home where their future kids can grow up and where they can have their own space.

They house that they chose for their new life is too expensive for them and they would like a loan of $375. He works as a machine operator in the region and it is with his income that they will be able to repay the loan.

Portion translation from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Manuel S. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Juan Manuel es un joven que empieza una familia aun que el no esta casado vive con Dulce Lucero López Silva quien es su pareja. Ellos viven en la casa de sus padres en un cuarto muy pequeño, es por eso que desean tener su propio hogar en el cual crezcan sus futuros hijos y tengan su propio espacio.

La casa que ellos escogieron para su nueva vida no les alcanza y solicitan $375 dólares pues el trabaja en una maquiladora de esta región y así con estos ingresos van a poder pagar el préstamo recibido.

loans.use: To buy an infonavit house/ADQUIRIR CASA DE INFONAVIT

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjali region, settled in the Absheron region. This 41-year-old woman has 3 children.

In the photo you can see her son. For 3 years, her son has sold building materials, transporting them with this truck. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for this truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for this truck

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is 26 years old. She is married with one child aged 4 years old. She has been a food seller since April 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Ashura is now requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 10, 7, and 3 years old. She has been a fruit and coconut seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Aziza is now seeking a loan to buy more fruit and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan was born in 1956. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in the Absheron region. He is married and has 4 children. 10 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 29 years old. She is divorced. She has been a clothes and firewood seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and firewood for her business

loans.name: Aumbe

texts.en:
Aumbe is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 months and 15 years old. She is a shoe and clothes seller. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 90 from her sales.

Aumbe now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en: Eyvaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in the Absheron region. He was born in 1970. He is married and has 2 children. This man has been in this business for 15 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for improving his business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 20 years old. She is single. She has been a chips and porridge seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 170 from her sales.

Hidaya is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 3 years old. She sells juice and is a hairdresser and she has been painting since 2002. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 260 from her sales.

Munawar is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza was born in 1957. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Agdam region in Azerbaijan, and she has settled in Baku city, Nasimi region. She is married and has 2 children.

Aziza has been working as a music hometutor for 20 years. She teaches her students to play the piano. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to repair her piano and to buy the necessary training aids so she can give the best lessons for her students.

loans.use: to repair her piano and to buy the necessary training aids for improving her business

loans.name: Zainab's Hukuna Matata Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 37 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 13 and 10 years old. She has been a bites seller since 1993. Every day, she works from 6am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Zainab has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zainab now hopes for a loan to further expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sichana, who also has a business dealing with bites sales

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Faida's Hatutaki Shari Group

texts.en:
Faida is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is 4 years old and one only 9 months. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Faida is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with firewood & charcoal sales, shoes, juice, and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mwajab

texts.en:
Mwajab is 45 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 19, 16, and 12 years old. She has been a clothes vendor, selling khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear) since 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 40 from her sales.

Mwajab is now requesting a loan to buy more khanga cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga) for re-sale

loans.name: Mwashamba's Usawa Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 35 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 5 and 3 years old. She is a charcoal and firewood seller since May 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Mwashamba is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, chips sales, phone voucher sales, juice and charcoal sales, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Bimkubwa

texts.en:
Bimkubwa is a widow with 4 children aged 17, 16, 14, and 11 years old. She has been a charcoal seller and has owned a small food vendor store since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Bimkubwa is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in Khirdalan town. She was born in 1979.

Aynura is the mother of one child. She has been in this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $625 to buy foodstuffs to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Leluu

texts.en:
Leluu is 45 years old. She is married with one child aged 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and coconut seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Leluu is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 21 years old. She is a widow with one child aged 2 years old. She has been a firewood and bites seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 4am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hidaya's Hatuna Tabu Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with 3 children aged 7, 4, and 3 years old. She has been a juice and bites seller since April 2008. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Hidaya is now requesting a loan to open a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sharifa and Raifat, who have businesses dealing with shop ownership and charcoal and juice sales.

loans.use: To open a new business

loans.name: Theddy

texts.en: Theddy P. M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur woman She is a married with five children. She has run a shop for five years now at the airport area in Dar-es Salaam. She sells a variety of items, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. Income from the business is used to feed the family and for paying school fees for her children. She requests a loan of $750 to help the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Salma's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Salma is 25 years old. She is married with one child aged 5 years old. She has been a seller of khanga, groundnuts, and bites since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

Salma is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mayasa and Tatu, who have businesses dealing with charcoal & firewood sales and coconut sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 50 years old. She is divorced with one child aged 18 years old. She has been a clothes and bites seller since 1995. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Sharifa is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 44 years old. She is divorced with 4 children aged 12, 7, 3, and 2 years old. She has been a khanga (traditional Tanzanian cloth) and porridge seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 60 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanahamis has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to open her business. Mwanahamis is now requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 38 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 19 and 9 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 350 from her sales.

Rehema is now seeking a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Hidaya's Hatukati Tamaa Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 43 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 19 and 16 years old. She has been a cassva and charcoal seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Hidaya is now requesting a loan to buy more cassava and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with potato sales, bites sales, chips and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan was born in 1965. She is the mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan, settled in Baku city. She has been in this business for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: 55.	Solomon M. runs a shop at Buguruni Mtambani in Dar-es-Salaam .He sales variety of items including serial crop products such as wheat flowers, Maize flowers, Rice and beans. Her purchases the items from the whole sales shop in Kariakoo shopping center .His business plan is to run a whole sales shop. He requests a loan of $ 550   to meet his business demand.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Atash

texts.en: Atash was born in 1965. He is married. He does not have a child. Atash is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Gubadli region in Azerbaijan, settled in Khirdalan Town. He has transported loads for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare part for his truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Amina's Hatukati Tamaa Group

texts.en:
Amina is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 18 and 3 years old. She has been a bites seller since 2004. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Amina is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, bites sales, potato sales, and juice sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 24, 22, and 18 years old. She has been a clothes (khanga & vitenge: traditional Tanzanian clothing) seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 60 from her sales.

Munira is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga & vitenge) for her business

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.en: Gazanfar was born in 1965. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is married and has 2 children. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: This young man was born in 1975. He is married and has 2 children. Ilyas lives in Khachmaz Town. He has been a taxi driver for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu, a 41-year-old widow with four children, has been a clothes seller since 2005.  Each day she works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales. Tatu is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Habiba's Mola Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Habiba is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 12, 10, and 2 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

In the past, Habiba has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to open her business. Habiba is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal & firewood sales, banana sales, coconut sales, bites, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: In the photo, you can see Djabrayil's sister. Djabrayil lives in Khachmaz region. He was born in 1960. This man is married and has 3 children.  Together with his sister, Djabrayil has been in the orchard business for 6 years. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings to improve their orchard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides. and seedlings

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en: Banovsha is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. She was born in 1956. She has been in the farming business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud was born in 1957. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is married and has 2 children. He has been in the farming business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda has been selling breakfasts for three years. Her customers are construction workers who work near her daughter's house. It was her daughter who encouraged Teodolinda to start this activity.

Teodolinda has also been working as a cleaning lady for six years. She also has a van which she rents out as public transportation.

The loans she has requested have been used to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare the breakfasts she sells. She has also used some of the loan money to maintain her van.

Teodolinda would like to have another car, and expand her business to sell not only breakfasts, but meals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Teodolinda se dedica al reparto de desayunos desde hace 3 años. Sus clientes son los obreros de construcción que trabajan cerca de la casa de su hija. Ella fue quien le animó a empezar esta actividad.

Teodolinda también trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 6 años. Asimismo, tiene una camioneta que la alquila como transporte público.

Los préstamos que ella ha recibido los ha utilizado en comprar los ingredientes que necesita para preparar los desayunos que vende. También, ha empleado parte de los préstamos en el mantenimiento de la camioneta.

A Teodolinda le gustaría tener otro carro y repartir no solo desayunos, sino también menús.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare the breakfasts she sells  (Para comprar los ingredientes que necesita en la preparación de los desayunos que vende.)

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
For the past six years, Gladis has had a general store in her home. For 16 years she sold cosmetic products and clothing on order, but since she had to start taking care of her grandchildren, she decided to start a general store in her house. She offers all kinds of basic commodities.

The loans she has requested have been used to stock her store with products and to buy a display cabinet.

Gladis would like to have a larger cabinet and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años, Gladis tiene una bodega en su casa. Durante 16 años ella vendió cosméticos y ropa por pedidos, pero como tuvo que empezar a cuidar a sus nietos, decidió instalar una bodega en su casa. Ella ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir su bodega con productos y para comprarse una vitrina exhibidora.

A Gladis le gustaría adquirir una vitrina más grande y un congelador.

loans.use: stock her store with products and to buy a display cabinet (Para surtir su bodega con productos y para comprarse una vitrina exhibidora.)

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
For the past 2 years, Nancy has a general store in her home. Before that, she used to sell groceries at the market, but because she had to watch her children, she decided to open her own business in her house. She offers all kinds of basic commodities.

The loans she has requested have been invested to stock her general store with products.

Nancy would like to expand her products stock.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 2 años, Nancy tiene una bodega en su casa. Antes, Ella vendía abarrotes en el mercado, pero por tener que cuidar a sus hijos, decidió abrir su negocio en su casa. Ella ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido en el stock de productos para su bodega. Nancy quisiera ampliar su stock de productos.

loans.use: To stock her general store with products (Para el stock de productos que necesita en su bodega.)

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
On weekends, Raquel sells food by her neighbors requests. The other days of the week she works in a restaurant tending to customers from 6 to 11PM. In the mornings she takes care of her baby at home.

Raquel also sells clothing and sews for others.

The loans she has received have been used to buy a sandwich cart where she prepares the food she sells during the weekends. She has also invested some of the money on clothing to sell.

Raquel would like to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los fines de semana, Raquel vende comida por pedido de sus vecinos. El resto de días de la semana trabaja en un restaurante atendiendo al público, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. Por la mañana, cuida a un bebé en su casa.

Raquel también vende ropa por pedidos y hace arreglos de costura.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprarse un carrito sanguchero donde prepara la comida que vende los fines de semana. También lo ha invertido en la ropa que vende por pedidos.

A Raquel le gustaría tener un restaurante propio.

loans.use: To buy a sandwich cart to prepare the food she sells on weekends

loans.name: Mayra Irene

texts.es: La Señorita Mayra Irene T. de 22 años del cantón Cojxac municipio y departamento de Totonicapán. Es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo ya que actualmente tiene a su cargo un pequeño negocio, que consiste en la venta de muebles, anteriormente se dedicaba a la enfermería con el dinero que ganaba pudo establecer el negocio de compra y venta de muebles, con el crédito que solicita en ASDIR, su meta es aumentar el capital de trabajo y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Miss. Mayra Irene T. is 22 years old, lives at the canton Cojxac of the municipality and department of Totonicapan. She is a person that is very dedicated to her work and is in charge of a small business, which is involved in the sale of furniture. Previously she worked in nursing and with the money that she earned she was able to start the business of buying and selling furniture. With the loan that she is requesting from ASDIR, her goal is to increase her working capital and therefore obtain more income.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria has worked selling shoes as a street vendor for more than 25 years. However, two months ago she left that activity because she is tired. Now she works with her daughter in the general store she has in her home.

Maria has also been renting out her house for the past two years.

Most of the loans she has received have been invested in her previous shoe selling business, but now she is requesting money to expand the inventory of her general store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María ha trabajado vendiendo zapatos de forma ambulatoria por más de 25 años. Sin Embargo, hace 2 meses ha dejado esta actividad, ya que está cansada. Ahora, solo se dedica a trabajar con su hija en la tienda que esta tiene en su casa.

María también alquila su casa desde hace 2 años.

La mayoría de préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en su anterior negocio de venta de zapatos, sin embargo, ahora está solicitando para surtir la tienda con más productos.

loans.use: stock her general store with more products

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Guadalupe M. C. is 42 years old and lives with her partner. Guadalupe has two children. One is 20 years old and has special needs, due to a cerebral lesion. Her other son is 18 years old and is in his first year of university. Guadalupe's partner works as a driver in the city of Leon. Guadalupe sells new clothing, including pants, shirts, and Masaya footwear. Guadalupe's business started as an alternative to unemployment and a way to help with household expenses. She buys supplies in Managua and sells in the markets of Leon. She also sells on credit to her neighbors. Guadalupe's greatest wish is to get ahead with her disabled son, and she'd like to do this by installing a store in her home so that she can spend more time with her family. With loans she's been able to raise capital, giving her the opportunity to familiarize herself with local markets.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Guadalupe M. C., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en union de hecho estable es decir acompañada, tiene dos hijos, uno de 20 años de edad el cual posee capacidades diferentes ya que tiene una lesion cerebral, y su otro hijo tiene 18 años de edad actualemnte cursa el primer año de la universidad, su compañero de vida trabaja como chofer de ruta urbana en leon, La actividad economica de la señora es la venta de ropa nueva como pantalosn, camisas y calzado masaya, la cual lleva acabo de forma ambulante, compra en managua y entrega a clientes de los mercados y al credito en su sector domiciliar, tiene seis años de tener dicho negocio, su mayor anhelo en la vida es poder salir adelante con su hijo enfermito, su sueño es poder instalar una tiena en su domicilio de esta manera estar mas cerca a su familia. Dicha actividad surge como una alternativa al desempleo y una manera de aportar con los gastos del hogar, con los creditos ha podido crecer en capital y se ha dado a conocer en los mercados como comerciante

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maura Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maura R. is 46 years old and lives with her partner. She has six children, though only one of them is still in secondary school and dependent on her. Maura's other children have been able to get ahead, thanks to her hard work. Maura and her partner work together, selling natural medicines and a variety of clothing. Both have been in this business for 25 years, having started it as an alternative to unemployment. Maura and her partner share the firm conviction that they can use the business to help their children get ahead professionally. One of their dreams is to purchase their own home, so that they can install a sewing workshop. At the moment, a lack of resources such as machinery, prevents them from establishing themselves in the sewing market. Nevertheless, with support from lenders and helping hands, Maura has had the opportunity to manage some working capital, which she's used to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maura R., tiene 46 años de edad, vive en union de hecho estable es decir acompañada, tiene seis hijos de los cuales uno depende de ella y actualmente cursa el quinto años de bachillerato en secundaria, ya que sus otros hijos gracias al esfurzo de su trabajo han logrado salir adelante, su compañero de vida trabaja en conjunto con ella en la comercializacion de medicina natural y ropa variada, teniendo ambos de ejercer dicha actividad 25 años, habiendo dado inicio como una alternativa a la falta de empleo, pero con la iniciativa y firme conviccion de poder sacar adelante profesionalmente a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños es poder adquirir una vivienda propia y no andar alquilando, asi mismo poder instalar un taller de costura actividad que tambien desempeña, pero por falta de recursos como de maquinaria no ha podido establecerse en el mercado, sin embargo con el apoyo de financieras y manos amigas a podido tener la oportunidad de tener un poco de capital de trabajo lo qu le ha beneficiado en su actividad economica.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
Farhad is a single man who lives with his own family and began working just after he graduated from school. He has a clothes shop in district 10 of Kabul where  he sells imported women's clothing.  Farhad has been involved in this business for more than 5 years and has a good number of Afghani and foreign clients.

Farhad has asked for a loan of loan of 50,000 Afghani ($US1,075) over 18 months so that he can increase his Afghani clothing inventory in time for the days of Eid, the 3-day holiday that Muslims around the world celebrate after the long fasting of Ramadan. Farhad's clients like to purchase new designs of clothing for Eid and they have requested that he be ready for them.

Farhad would like to thank all the world's lenders who would help to further his business with this loan.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of Afghani clothes

loans.name: Kuñamarangatu Group

texts.es:
This group of the San Pedro neighborhood arose when another committee formed in the same neighborhood. After attending the informational meetings, they decided to bet on the program and to begin with the loans and training to help grow their micro-businesses.

All the ladies carry out these activities because they need to increase the income of their homes, to be able to give a better life to their children. The majority are dedicated to the sale of different types of merchandise, among them clothes, lingerie, sheets and towels. Others have their own business in their residence such as a pantry, salon, aperitif and dressmakers shop.

The loan amount that they will each receive varies from 300,000 to 1,000,000 of Guaranis. All the ladies will use the loan to buy merchandise for their activities that they are carrying out at present.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro viviendas surgió por medio de otro comité formado en el mismo barrio. Luego de realizarse las reuniones de información ellas decidieron apostar por el programa e iniciarse con los créditos y las capacitaciones para ayudar al crecimiento de sus microempresas.

Todas las señoras realizan estas actividades pues necesitan un incrementar los ingresos de sus hogares, para poder lograr dar una mejor vida a sus hijos. La mayoría se dedica a la venta de distintos tipos de mercaderías, entre ellas ropas, lencerías, sabanas y toallas; otras tienen negocios propios en su domicilio como son las despensa, peluquería, copetín y modistas.

El monto que recibirá como crédito cada señora varía entre 300.000 a 1.000.000 de guaraníes cada una. Todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderías para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente.

loans.use: To buy ink for printers, fabrics, supplies for salons, foods such as eggs, oil, wine, laundry detergent, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, milk products, clothes, lingerie, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
This group of the "Pacu Cua" neighborhood arose when some members of other committees that have repaid their previous loans decided to form another group. This is a very private group, due to the fact that the neighborhood in which they live is near to the International Bridge that joins Paraguay with Argentina. Because of this all the ladies sell merchandise on the border, as much on the Paraguayan side as the Argentine.

The merchandise that they sell includes various oils, flours, sugar, laundry detergent, noodles, clothes, lingerie, sheets, towels, cigarettes and plastic articles, because they adapt to the requests of their clients and also to the advantages in prices that they find. The majority have a small point of sale, other do not and offer their merchandise to people that pass on the street.

They desire a loan that can be additional capital for them, that will permit them to increase their stock of merchandise, buying in large quantities. One of the advantages that they get when buying in large quantities are the lowest prices. This also helps so that they can offer good prices to their clients, so their clients prefer to buy from them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo del Barrio “Pacu Cua” surgió por medio de algunas integrantes de otros comités que han cancelado sus créditos anteriores y tenían interés en formar otro grupo. Este es un grupo muy particular, debido a que el Barrio en el que viven esta cerca del Puente Internacional que une a Paraguay con Argentina y por tal motivo todas las señoras venden mercaderías en la frontera, tanto lado paraguayo como argentino.

Las mercaderías que venden son muy variadas aceites, harinas, azúcar, jabón en polvo, fideos, ropas, lencerías, sábanas, tohallas, cigarrillos y artículos de plástico, porque ellas se adaptan a los pedidos de los clientes y también a las ventajas en precios que encuentren. La mayoría posee un pequeño puesto de venta, otras no y lo hacen paradas ofreciendo sus mercaderías a las personas que pasan.

Ellas desean un crédito que pueda ser un adicional de capital para ellas, que les permita incrementar su stock de mercaderías comprando en grandes cantidades. Una de las ventajas que obtienen al comprar en grandes cantidades son los precios más bajos, lo que también ayuda a que ellas puedan ofrecer buenos precios que haga que los clientes prefieran adquirir sus productos en venta.

loans.use: To buy oil, wine, laundry detergent, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, milk products,  clothes, lingerie, plastic articles, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
This group of the San Pedro neighborhood was formed thanks to the ladies in the neighborhood who had already formed another group. Seeing the progress and benefits that those ladies obtained, they decided to form a committee in order to be able to have the possibility of growing their businesses.

The ladies of this group, besides being a housewife, carry out various activities such as the sale of clothes, sheets, towels, and lingerie, dressmaking, running clothing workshops, making inexpensive clothes and running businesses in their homes such as pantries and salons.

Besides their businesses, also they carry out other activities that help to bring in extra money to their savings.

The total that each lady receives varies from 300,000 to 1,600,000 Guaranis (currency of Paraguay). All the ladies will use the loan to buy merchandise for the activities that they are carrying out.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió gracias a que en el barrio de estas señoras ya se había conformado otro grupo, y viendo el progreso y los beneficios que obtenían estas señoras, decidieron formar un comité para así poder acceder a la posibilidad de crecer con sus emprendimientos.

Las señoras de este grupo, además de ser amas de casa, realizan actividades como la venta de ropas, sábanas y toallas, lencerías, otras señoras que son modistas tienen taller de costura y confeccionan ropas bajo pedido y otras poseen negocios propios en su domicilio despensa y peluquería.

Además de las actividades de ellas, también realizan otras que ayudan a juntar un pequeño dinero extra para el ahorro de ellas.

El monto que recibe cada señora varía entre 300.000 a 1.600.000 de guaraníes (moneda de Paraguay); todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderías para las actividades que están realizando.

loans.use: To buy clothes, lingerie, sheets, towels, thread, fabric, supplies for making cleaning products, supplies for salons, comestibles such as flour, oil, noodles,  herbal cigarettes and other items.

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
Señor Sindulfo is 43 years old and married to Señora Celsa. They have lived in their own home for many years. Their family was one of the many that were relocated when the reservoir of the Yacyretá binational dam affected their location and they were provided a new home in another area of the city.

Sindulfo is dedicated to traveling sales of various merchandise, such as clothes, typical weavings of Paraguay, sheets, covers and blankets. He purchases the majority of his merchandise in a very popular business district of Encarnación that is called the "Zona Baja". In this place is found the majority of the commerce where one can buy all kinds of articles at a good price. Then Sindulfo travels through the neighborhoods and adjoining cities selling his merchandise, traveling through with his motorcycle.

He has been able to progress and to move his family ahead thanks to his efforts and sacrifice. The loans have always also been a great help. He wants to be able to acquire a new loan to buy blankets and winter coats, which are in great demand among his clients at this time.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Sindulfo tiene 43 años y está casado con la señora Celsa. Ellos viven en una casa propia desde hace muchos años. Su familia fue una de las tantas que fueron reubicadas por ser afectadas por el embalse de la represa binacional Yacyretá, quien les proveyó de un nuevo hogar en otra zona de la ciudad.

Sindulfo se dedica a la venta ambulante de mercaderías varias como ropas, tejidos típicos del Paraguay, sábanas, frazadas y mantas. Las compras de la mayoría de sus mercaderías los hace en una zona comercial muy popular de Encarnación a las que ellos llaman “Zona Baja”. En este lugar se encuentran la mayoría de los comercios y donde uno puede comprar todo tipo de artículos a buen precio. Luego Sindulfo recorre los barrios y ciudades aledañas vendiendo sus mercaderías recorriendo con su motocicleta.

El ha podido progresar y sacar a su familia adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Los créditos también han sido siempre de gran ayuda por lo que él desea poder adquirir uno nuevo para comprar frazadas y abrigos de inviernos pues son los de mayor pedido en esta época por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as coats and blankets for resale.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The committee named "The Hope" participates in the program called the "Committee of Enterprising Women" that consists of women that carry out lucrative work in order to improve their income and alleviate poverty. The ladies belonging to this committee are dedicated to diverse productive activities. They use their loan to buy more merchandise in some cases or supplies for making foods in the case of the ladies that are dedicated to food sales.

The activities that the ladies perform include selling silver jewels, selling clothes, running pantries and newsstands where they sell consumer staples for the home, selling foods, selling coal, recycling and selling natural remedies.

. The majority of the women long for a better future for their children. Therefore they double their endeavors to generate more income and to be able to offer their children the opportunity to study and to be able to apply for good employment.

The loan that they request will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for the making and sale of foods, the purchase of footwear for its subsequent sale, and the buying and selling of cosmetics, jewels, and coal, among others.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité “La Esperanza” participa del programa llamado “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” que agrupa a mujeres que realizan una labor lucrativa con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y aliviar la pobreza. Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, utilizan el préstamo para comprar más mercaderías en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboración de comidas en el caso de las señoras que se dedican a la venta de comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan las señoras están las que venden joyas de plata, también las que venden ropas, otras poseen despensas y kioscos en donde venden artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, otras venden comidas, una de ellas vende carbón, otra se dedica al reciclaje y por último una de ellas vende remedios naturales.

.La mayoría de las mujeres anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar mas ingresos y poder brindarles posibilidades de estudiar y poder optar por un buen empleo.

El crédito que solicitan es para invertirlo en la comra de ingredientes para la elaboración y venta de comidas, compra de calzaD. para su posterior venta, compra y venta de cosméticos, joyas, carbón, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs, vegetables, oil, salt, cheese, starch, clothes, delicacies, cosmetics, baked goods and carbonated water.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Señora Cristina R. is a very self sacrificing and hard-working woman. She is an old settler of a very poor and marginal area located in the poor area of greater Asunción.

She has a pantry and has been able to raise 6 children with this work. Four of her children have already formed their own homes. Two of them are still small and she continues maintaining them in everything, especially in their studies. She has her own house and she is alone without the aid of a husband.

In her pantry, she markets food and consumer staples for the home. In addition she sells some fast foods in order to obtain an extra income.

The loan will permit her to enlarge her stock of merchandise, varying the brands and types of products. In this way her clients will have more choices of things to purchase and she will avoid having them go to the supermarkets that are the greatest competition for the neighborhood pantries.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cristina R., es una mujer sacrificada y muy trabajadora, ella es pobladora antigua de una zona marginal y muy pobre ubicada en la zona baja de la gran Asunción.

Ella posee una despensa, que le permitió criar a 6 hijos con este trabajo, de las cuales 4 ya han formado también su hogar y 2 aún menores a quien ella sigue manteniendo en todos especialmente en sus estudios. Tiene casa propia y ella está sola sin la ayuda de un marido.

En su despensa, comercializa comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar, además vende algunas comidas rápidas para de este modo obtener un ingreso extra.

El crédito le permitirá aumentar su stock de mercaderías variando entre marcas y tipos de productos, pues de este modo, sus clientes tendrán más opciones de compra y evitará que acudan a los supermercados que son la gran competencia para las despensas de los barrios.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as meat, flour, oil, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, baked goods and carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
The women who belong to this committee are dedicated to various productive activities and use the loan to buy merchandise for sale such as clothes (T-shirts, socks, caps, jeans, shirts, blankets, sheets, gloves, baby clothes, etc.) or supplies for making comestibles.

In the case of the ladies that do recycling, they use the loan for buying and selling recyclable materials such as cardboard, aluminum, plastics and all kinds of metals in disuse.

In the hope that their children will not be subjected to the same limitations as themselves, they double their endeavors to generate more income and to be able to offer them opportunities to study and to apply for good employment.

They work responsibly and sacrifice every day, but they do not lose their happiness. They are a very friendly group. The loan that they request will be used to purchase various merchandise for resale and necessary ingredients for the making of their delicious home-made foods.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas y utilizan el préstamo para la compra venta de mercaderías tales como la venta de ropas (remeras, medias, gorros, jeans, camisas, mantas, sábanas, guantes, ropas para bebes, etc.) o insumos para la elaboración de comestibles .

En el caso de las señoras que realizan reciclaje utilizan el préstamo para la compra y venta de materiales reciclables como cartón, aluminio, plásticos y todo tipo de metales en desuso.

Anhelan que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones se esfuerzan el doble para generar mas ingresos y poder brindarles posibilidades de estudiar y optar por un buen empleo.

Ellas trabajan de forma responsable y sacrificada todos los días, pero no pierden la alegría, son un grupo muy amistoso. El crédito que solicitan será para la compra de mercaderías varias para la venta e ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus riquísimas comidas caseras.

loans.use: To buy cardboard, plastics, aluminum, iron, fruits such as oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelon, apples, cosmetics, beer, carbonated drinks, other refreshments, clothes, fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbu Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed thanks to Julia Benítez, who is a former counselor of city of Asunción. She invited her neighbors for an informative discussion. The afore-mentioned lady spoke to them about the Program, which she knew of from an information bulletin that she had received.

The women are very active in collaboration with the community. Some are part of a neighborhood commission of the neighborhood of Tacumbú and others work in the Divino Maestro chapel, which is found close to their homes.

We can speak of some of them, such as the case of Tomasa Zladívar, who is a single mother. In order to support her son and pay the expenses of the household where she lives, Tomasa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry and delicacies in a spot set against the door of a school where she has a small cart where she exhibits her merchandise to the students.

She rises very early in the morning, walks from her residence located in the Saxony neighborhood and arrives at the center with a bag full of things to sell. Things that are colorful, sweet and salty sell well. Now Tomasa can already withdraw a loan of 1,200,000 Guanaris. thanks to her good payment history she can agree to this total. She tells us that she will use it to grow her merchandise even more and to vary the products that she offers since spring is approaching.

The members carry out many extra activities such as raffles and food fairs, among others, to be able to pay some expenses of beautifying their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a Julia Benítez, quien es ex- Concejala de la ciudad de Asunción, ella invito a las señoras para una charla informativa., pues son vecinas suyas. La mencionada señora les hablo acerca del Programa, pues ella tenía conocimiento através de un boletín informativo que recibió.

Las señoras son muy activas dentro de la colaboración con la comunidad, algunas forman parte de la comisión vecinal de Barrio Tacumbú y otras colaboran en la capilla Divino Maestro que se encuentra muy cerca de sus casas.

Podemos hablar de alguna de ellas, como el caso de: Tomasa Zaldívar quien es madre soltera, y para mantener a su hijo y solventar todos los gatos de la casa donde viven, Tomasa se dedica a vender bijouterie y golosinas frente a la puerta de un colegio donde tiene un pequeño carrito donde exhibe sus mercaderías a los alumnos.

Ella se levanta bien temprano todas las mañanas, va caminando desde su domicilio ubicado en el Barrio Sajonia y llega al centro con un bolsón repleto de cosas para vender, cosas coloridas, dulces y saladas para de ese modo salir adelante. Hoy día Tomasa ya puede retirar un préstamo de 1.200.000 Gs. gracias a su buen comportamiento de pago puede acceder a este monto y cuenta que desea utilizarlo para aumentar aun más sus mercaderías y variar los productos, pues se acerca la primavera.

Las integrantes realizan actividades extras además como rifas, ferias de comidas entre otros, para poder pagar algunos gastos de embellecimiento del barrio de ellas.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Julia Benítez, who is a former counselor of city of Asunción. She invited her neighbors for an informative discussion. The afore-mentioned lady spoke to them about the Program, which she knew of from an information bulletin that she had received.

The women are very active in collaboration with the community. Some are part of a neighborhood commission of the neighborhood of Tacumbú and others work in the Divino Maestro chapel, which is found close to their homes.

We can speak of some of them, such as the case of Tomasa Zladívar, who is a single mother. In order to support her son and pay the expenses of the household where she lives, Tomasa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry and delicacies in a spot set against the door of a school where she has a small cart where she exhibits her merchandise to the students.

She rises very early in the morning, walks from her residence located in the Saxony neighborhood and arrives at the center with a bag full of things to sell. Things that are colorful, sweet and salty sell well. Now Tomasa can already withdraw a loan of 1,200,000 Guanaris. thanks to her good payment history she can agree to this total. She tells us that she will use it to grow her merchandise even more and to vary the products that she offers since spring is approaching.

The members carry out many extra activities such as raffles and food fairs, among others, to be able to pay some expenses of beautifying their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for sale such as meat, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables, sweets, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
This committee is comprised of 20 hard-working women of the city of Asunción. Because the opportunities to obtain capital to start a small enterprise are very few, they decided to participate in the program of the Foundation, which gathers women of scarce resources and provides them with a small loan to encourage their desire for progress.

Each one of them, besides being a housewife, owns a micro-business that helps to generate income for the family. Among them are some that are dedicated to the sale of foods as such as patties, croquettes, and tortillas, among others. Other ladies sell fruits such as oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelon, and apples; others sell cosmetics, beverages (beer, carbonated water, and other refreshments,) and there are also ones that are dedicated to dressmaking.

They strive to the maximum so that their children are not subject to the same economic and academic limitations as they have been. Today with a new loan, they will be able to acquire new merchandise and in large quantities that will also give them the benefit of buying at a discount.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité está conformado por 20 señoras trabajadoras de la ciudad de Asunción. Debido a que sus posibilidades de conseguir capital para empezar un pequeño emprendimiento se veía muy dificultoso, deciden un día participar del programa de la Fundación, que agrupa a mujeres de escasos recursos y les provee de un pequeño crédito para impulsar su deseo de progreso.

Cada una de ellas, además de ser amas de casa, poseen microempresas que ayudan a generar un ingreso para la familia. Entre ellas están las que se dedican a la venta de comidas como empanadas, croquetas, tortillas entre otros. Otras señoras venden frutas como naranjas, bananas, piña, melón, sandia, manzana; otras venden cosméticos, bebidas (cerveza, gaseosa, refrescos,) y también están las que se dedican a la costura.

Ellas se esfuerzan al máximo para que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones tanto económicas como académicas. Hoy con un nuevo crédito, ellas podrán acceder a adquirir mercaderías nuevas y en grandes cantidades que además le da el beneficio de comprar con descuentos en los precios.

loans.use: To buy oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelon, apples, cosmetics, beer, carbonated beverages,fabrics, etc. for resale or making products for sale.

loans.name: Cristal Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed thanks to Fany Teresa Ramírez who is a teacher of handicrafts and a member of the neighborhood commission of the Tacumbú neighborhood of Assumption with the other members of the Crystal Women Committee.

The lady Fanny is married and has three children, but the biggest has lived in rhe US for 4 years. She owns a boutique and bookstore in her own house. Fanny and other ladies are dedicated to handicrafts such as painting on fabrics figures of fruits, vegetables, and flowers, among others.

Others in the group make and sell tablecloths, napkins, sheets, towels and comforters, or are dressmakers and in that way they design their own craft articles.

Others are dedicated to the sale of fine lingerie for ladies, gentlemen and children of all the sizes and designs.

They request a loan that will permit them to increase their stock of merchandise and materials for work, among them paint for fabrics, needles to weave, fabrics, cloths, clothes and footwear for sale, likewise various cosmetics for sale in their salon.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a Fany Teresa Ramírez quien es Profesora de Manualidades, además es miembro de la comisión vecinal del Barrio Tacumbú de Asunción con las demás compañeras miembros del Comité de Mujeres Cristal.

La señora Fanny, esta casada tiene tres hijos, pero la mayor vive hace 4 años en los EEEUU. Ella posee una mercería y librería en su propia casa. Fanny y otras señoras se dedican a las Manualidades como: Pintura sobre telas como figuras de frutas, verduras, flores, entre otros sobre lienzos.

Otras confeccionan y venden manteles, servilletitas, sábanas, toallas y edredones, son modistas y de ese modo diseñan ellas mismas sus artículos artesanales.

Otras se dedican a la venta de lencería fina para damas, caballeros y niños de todos los tamaños y diseños.

Ellas solicitan un crédito que les permita incrementar su stock de mercaderías y materiales de trabajo. Entre ellos pinturas para telas, agujas para tejer, telas, lienzos, ropas y calzados para vender, al igual que cosméticos varios para peluquería.

loans.use: To buy fabric paints, needles for weaving, fabric, cloths, clothes, footwear and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario D. Ocampo is single and shares his home with his partner. He has grown up children, and works primarily recycling plastic, cardboard and glass. He started all this with only a small amount of capital which grew over the years along with his customers.

Mario D. is requesting a loan to buy various merchandise for recycling, such as: plastics, cardboard, glass and other materials, mainly from people who are also in this trade but who spend their time looking amongst the rubbish and city dump..

One of his dreams is to be able to develop his business soon, in terms of equipment. His aim is to build a platform where he can store all his merchandise better, protecting it from the harshness of time. .

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El señor Mario D. Ocampo, es soltero, vive con la pareja en su propia casa, ya tiene hijos mayores de edad, se dedica principalmente al reciclaje de plásticos, cartones y vidrios. Se inició con un pequeño capital que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela.

El señor Mario D., retira el préstamo para la compra de varias mercaderías para el reciclaje como ser: plásticos, cartón, vidrios y otros elementos, principalmente de personas que también se dedican a este rubro pero que se dedican a buscar entre la basura y en el vertedero municipal de la ciudad.

Uno de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento, su objetivo es construir un tinglado para poder acumular mejor sus mercaderías, resguardar de la inclemencia del tiempo y para guardar en forma más segura.

loans.use: To purchase various materials for recycling, such as plastic, cardboard, glass etc.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
As the chance of securing capital to start a small enterprise seemed slim, one day these ladies decided to take part in a women’s committee program at the Fundación Paraguaya, which unites women with limited resources and gives them a small amount of credit so that they are able to develop.

The women who belong to this committee take part in various activities, such as purchase and sale of merchandise from home or purchasing consumables to make dishes which is what the women who sell food do. Also, there are women who sort and sell disused materials such as cardboard, plastics and metals, and women who make and sell cleaning products.

As there are so many restrictions in place for their children, academically as well as economically, these women work twice as hard to generate more family income and give their children the opportunity to study and gain a good job one day.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Debido a que sus posibilidades de conseguir capital para empezar un pequeño emprendimiento se veía muy dificultoso, ellas decidieron un día participar del programa comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, que agrupa a mujeres de escasos recursos y les provee de un pequeño crédito para impulsar su deseo de progreso.

Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades, entre las que podemos citar la compra y venta de mercaderías en algunos casos o compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas que es el caso de las señoras que se dedican a la venta de comestibles. También hay señoras que realizan clasificación y venta de materiales en desuso como cartón, plásticos, y metales, y señoras que se dedican a la fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza.

Para que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones tanto económicas como académicas se esfuerzan el doble para generar mas ingresos a sus familias y poder brindarles posibilidades de estudiar y optar por un buen empleo.

loans.use: To buy oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelon and apple to sell on. To buy cosmetics, beer, drinks. To buy fabric to make sheets, tablecloths and clothes.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor O. is a selfless and hardworking man. He started selling small items in the street, but he was able to soon concentrate more on his work and was soon climbing and growing. Currently, he has a fixed stall on the corner of two major supermarkets were he sells food and drins. Furthermore he is providing work for others who sell his products across the area.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El señor Néstor O. es una persona sacrificada y trabajadora, se inicio con ventas de pequeñas cosas en la calle, pero le puso empeño a su trabajo y fue escalando y mejorando lo mismo. Actualmente, tiene un puesto fijo en la esquina de 2 supermercados importantes en donde vende comidas y gaseosas. Además le da trabajo a otros quienes venden sus productos y gaseosas de forma ambulante.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and ingredients such as meat, flour, salt, sugar, oil, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
The Tecojoja committee is now in their seventh loan cycle of the Enterprising Women Committee program and includes 15 members of which 3 are new.

This group is found in one of the poorest neighborhoods of the city of Assumption known as Pelopincho. The members are dedicated to several activities; notable among these, the sale of foods, beverages, and clothes, running a pantry, and recycling, among other things.

An example is that of Señora Viviana F., who is dedicated to recycling and tells us that in this cycle she will put her work tools in condition; that is, she will fix her cart to carry a greater quantity of recyclable materials.

The committee maintains good communications among its members that facilitates internal relations and respect among its members.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité Tecojoja se encuentra actualmente en su séptimo ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y cuenta con 15 integrantes de las cuales 3 son nuevas.

Este grupo se encuentra en una de las barrios más pobres de la ciudad de Asunción conocida como Pelopincho. Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se pueden destacar la venta de comidas, bebidas, despensa, además de venta de ropas, reciclaje entre otras cosas.

Un ejemplo es el de la señora Viviana F. se dedica al reciclaje y nos comento que en este ciclo pondrá en condiciones su herramienta de trabajo, que es un carrito recolector de modo a juntar mayor cantidad de material reciclable.

El comité presenta buena comunicación entre sus miembros lo que facilita la relación interna y el respeto entre sus integrantes.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise such as clothes (T-shirts, pants, shirts, footwear), fruits, vegetables, meat, milk products, baked goods, sugar, etc. for resale or making goods for sale.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed thanks to the ladies Sinecia R. and Fany Lezcano, who were informed about the Foundation and the Enterprising Women Committee Program thanks to another lady friend that already was participating actively in another committee that had been formed in the neighborhood.

The ladies are members of a neighborhood commission of the Neighborhood María Auxiliadora where the Port of San Antonio is located. We can speak of some of the members; in this case Marta Amarilla, who is a single mother of two small children. They live in a humble house set along the Paraguay River in the Port of San Antonio. She rises early in the morning to get the first fresh fish, because in those hours she can select the best. She then cleans and cuts up the fish to subsequently make foods such as scalloped fish or fish soup or for the sale of the raw fish.

The other ladies are dedicated to the sale of fruits, vegetables, foods, cosmetics, or coal and to running pantries or salons.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señoras: Sinecia R., y Fany Lezcano, quienes se enteraron acerca de la Fundación y del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras gracias a otra señora amiga que ya estaba participando activamente de otro comité que se había formado en el barrio.

Las señoras son miembros de una comisión vecinal del Barrio María Auxiliadora donde se encuentra el Puerto de San Antonio. Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: Marta Amarilla, quien madre soltera de dos hijos pequeños, Ellas vive en un humilde casa frente al Río Paraguay, en el Puerto de San Antonio, se levanta por la madrugada para recibir los primeros pescados frescos, pues a esas horas puede elegir los más lindos. Luego limpia y desmenuza para posteriormente, elaborar comidas como milanesas y sopas de pescado o la venta de los mismos sin crudos sin elaboración.

Las demás señoras se dedican a la venta de frutas, verduras, comidas, despensas, venta de cosméticos, carbón y otras se dedican a la peluquería.

;

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, fish, cleaning products, comestibles, carbonated drinks, milk products, baked goods, canned goods, etc. for resale or for making products for sale.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
The contact for the formation of the present committee was Señora María Valdovinos, who resides at km7 Ciudad Nueva of Ciudad Del Este. She invited the other companions to form the committee. Said ladies are known for carrying out handicrafts; all work together in this capacity. In addition each one of them has her specific work. The committee is called "Miraculous Medal "in honor of these supportive and very hard-working ladies.

The activities that these ladies carry out and for which they request the loan is detailed subsequently: Teodora Álvarez: Sale of Clothes.

Lilian H.: Sale of Clothes.

María A.: Sale of Clothes.

Mariana M.: Sale of Shoes.

Severiana Benítez: Pantry.

María D.: Pantry.

Rosalía S.: Sale of Seasonings.

Alicia Ramírez: Pantry.

Dorila Candía: Salon.

Bernarda B.: Sale of fruit salad

María D.: Seamstress

María R.: Sale of carbonated Water.

María R.: Sale of Fruit.

Carmen Díaz: Sale of Clothes

Eliza G.: Sale of Silver Jewels

Ninfa Fernández: Sale of Coverlets.

Pearl M.: Salon

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El contacto para la formación del presente comité fue la Sra. María Valdovinos, quien reside en km7 Ciudad Nueva - De Ciudad Del Este. Ella invitó a las demás compañeras para formar el comité. Dichas señoras se caracterizan por realizar manualidades; todas juntas trabajan en este oficio, aparte de eso también cada una de ellas tiene sus labores específicos El comité se denomina “Medalla Milagrosa “en honor a las señoras muy trabajadoras y solidarias.

Las actividades que realizan estas señoras es como se detalla a continuación y para los cuales ellas solicitan el crédito: Teodora Álvarez: Venta de Ropas.

Lilian H.: Venta de Ropas.

María A.: Venta de Ropa.

Mariana M.: Venta de Zapatos.

Severiana Benítez: Despensa.

María D.: Despensa.

Rosalía S.: Venta de Condimentos.

Alicia Ramírez: Despensa.

Dorila Candía: Peluquería.

Bernarda B.: Venta de Ensalada de Fruta

María D. : Costurera

María R.: Venta de Gaseosa.

María Rodríguez: Venta de Fruta.

Carmen Díaz: Venta de Ropas

Eliza G. : Venta de Joyas de Plata

Ninfa Fernández: Venta de Cubiertos.

Perla M. : Peluquería

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, fruits, vegetables, coverlets, fabric, consumer staples and other items for resale and/or making items for sale.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
The committee named Virgin of Mercy was formed 11 months ago. They are a group that is in its 4th loan cycle. They belong to the zone known as Laurelty of San Lorenzo.

The ladies are dedicated to the sale of various products such as clothes, remedies and foods. As a group they are a stable committee. They make their payments responsibly both to the Foundation and inside the group as well. They have a savings of 1,749,000 Guarani. They also carry out activities as a group such as raffles and dinners to build an emergency cash fund for the times when someone becomes ill or to be able to advance payments as a group in the Foundation.

In this cycle the effort of the ladies to get ahead is notable and the support of this group has been fundamental to grow their economic activities and also their self-esteem that has developed due to they way that they put themselves forward and have become important through their work in the group.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité Virgen de las Mercedes se formo hace 11 meses, son un grupo que esta en 4to. Ciclo. Pertenecen a la zona Laurelty de San Lorenzo.

Las señoras se dedican a la venta de productos varios , las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios y comidas. Como grupo es un comité estable pagan con puntualidad sus cuotas en la Fundación y dentro del grupo también, poseen un Ahorro de GS.1.749.000. Ademas realizan actividades en conjunto como rifas y polladas para lograr un fondo de Caja de Auxilio para los casos que alguien se enferme , o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

En este ciclos se nota el esfuerzo de las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo de su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cheeses, eggs, animals in general, new and used clothes, and footwear.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has had a carpentry workshop in his house for the past 35 years. He has his own machines and employs three people. He works with melamine and fine woods for homes. The loan that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of carpentry materials. Antonio would like to buy more machines that are specialized for modern carpentry.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 35 años, Antonio tiene su taller de carpintería en su casa. Él cuenta con máquinas propias y da trabajo a 3 personas más. Antonio hace trabajos de melaminas y maderas finas para residencias. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los invertirá en la compra de materiales de carpintería. Antonio quisiera comprarse máquinas más moderna y especializadas en carpintería.

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials that he needs for his workshop

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Two years ago, Zoila sold dairy products and cosmetics by taking orders. However, she decided to rent a location and start a general store, since she wasn't making sales every day by taking orders. Now she has her own business very close to her home. She offers all types of basic products.

Zoila also continues to sell cheese and beef wholesale, according to the orders she receives.

She has used the loans she has received as capital to invest in her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 2 años, Zoila vende productos lácteos y cosméticos por pedidos. Sin embargo, luego decidió alquilar un local y poner una bodega, ya que las ventas por pedidos no eran diarias. Ahora, ella tiene su propio negocio muy cerca de su casa. Ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad.

Asimismo, Zoila sigue vendiendo queso y carne de res por mayor, según como reciba pedidos.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado como capital para invertir en su bodega.

loans.use: To invest in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica has worked selling cheese and meat for the past year and a half. Her sisters-in-law motivated her to invest in this business, as they already have relatives who send them food products from the province. In addition, for the past 2 years she has provided loans for her friends and trusted acquaintances. Verónica had a store, but she had to sell it because of health problems. The loans that she has applied for have been invested in her food sales business. Verónica would like to rent a locale and open a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica se dedica a la venta de queso y carne desde hace 1 año y medio. Sus cuñadas le animaron a incursionar en este negocio, ya que tienen familiares quienes le mandan los comestibles desde provincia. Asimismo, desde hace 2 años ella brinda préstamos de dinero para sus amigos y conocidos de confianza. Verónica tenía una tienda, pero tuvo que cerrarla por motivos de salud. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los ha invertido en su negocio de venta de comestibles. A Verónica le gustaría alquilar un local y abrir una bodega.

loans.use: To invest it in a food sales business

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
Donatila has worked selling cheese and meat for the past 30 years. She has regular clients who place wholesale orders, the majority of whom are businesspeople. They send Donatila these food products from the province, but she also orders from Lima for different products like fruits. The loans that she has received have been invested in the wholesale purchase of more products. Donatila would like to buy a piece of land and build a construction material and hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Donatila se dedica a la venta de queso y carne desde hace 30 años. Ella tiene sus clientes fijos quienes le hacen pedidos por mayor. La mayoría son negociantes. A Donatila le mandan desde provincia estos comestibles, pero ella también manda desde Lima hacia allá diversos productos como frutas. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en la compra por mayor de más productos. A Donatila le gustaría comprarse un terreno y construir una tienda de materiales de construcción y ferretería.

loans.use: To purchase the products that she sells wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario has hand-made earrings for the past year and a half. Before that she worked making earrings and selling them independently, but the business fell apart and she decided to work for other people and offer her service of making earrings. Rosario also cooks once a week for the popular restaurant that is close to her house. The loans that she has requested will help her invest in materials that she needs to make earrings. Rosario would like to set up an internet café and copy service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario hace aretes artesanales desde hace 1 año y medio. Antes ella trabajaba haciendo los aretes y vendiéndolos de manera independiente, pero el negocio decayó, por lo que decidió trabajar para otras personas y ofrecer su servicio de confección de aretes. Rosario también cocina una vez por semana en el comedor popular que está cerca de su casa. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le servirá para invertir en la compra de los materiales que necesita en la confección de los aretes. Rosario quisiera poner unas cabinas de Internet y servicio de fotocopiadora.

loans.use: Invest in the materials she needs to make earrings

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro has had a soldering and locksmith workshop in his home for the past 25 years. He has various machines and two assistants. His clients are his neighbors and friends and he also makes house calls. Sporadically, he does jobs as an electrician. The loans that he has received have been invested in more materials for his workshop. Mauro would like to have a wider portfolio of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mauro tiene en su casa un taller de soldadura y cerrajería, desde hace 25 años. Él cuenta con varias máquinas y 2 ayudantes. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos. También trabaja a domicilio. Esporádicamente, hace trabajos como electricista. Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en comprar más materiales para su taller. A Mauro le gustaría tener una cartera más amplia de clientes.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for his workshop

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has had a general store in her home for one year. She used to sell only bread, but her neighbors were requesting more products from her, so she was motivated to start a general store.

Silvia has also sold tamales for two years. Her husband prepares them, and she offers them in her store.

Silvia also participates in a milk delivery program for poor children in her neighborhood.

She has used the loans she has received to supply her store with more products and to furnish her kitchen.

Silvia would like to purchase land in another area to construct a store there.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Silvia tiene una bodega en su casa desde hace 1 año. Ella antes solo vendía pan, pero luego sus vecinas le fueron pidiendo más productos y por ello se animó a instalar una bodega.

Asimismo, Silvia vende tamales desde hace 2 años. Su esposo es quien los prepara y ella los ofrece en su tienda.

Silvia también participa del programa de reparto de vaso de leche a niños pobres en su barrio.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en surtir su tienda con más productos y en amoblar su cocina.

Silvia quisiera comprarse un terreno en otra parte y construir una tienda allí.

loans.use: To supply her store with more products and to be able to furnish her kitchen.

loans.name: Thea Sopheap Group

texts.en:
The loan group, led by Mrs. Thea S., consists of four people living in Beong Krum Kraom Village in Kandal Province. All of the members are married and have different business activities. For example, Mrs. S., who breeds cows and pigs, lacks sufficient money to buy cow and pig food. Thus, she is requesting a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sao Thon, is a farmer who earns additional income by watering villagers’ rice fields.

Mrs. Thea S. is 58 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed as security guards earning $37 each per month. 

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.
