She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups. It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy everyday, either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With this loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice, and assorted meat. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, and assorted meat.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama Y. is a 36 year old wife and mother of three kids, who are all in school. She has been a food vendor for three years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups. It is a delicacy many Ghanaian enjoy everyday, either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice, and assorted meat. She hopes this loan would help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, and assorted meat.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is 36 year old wife and mother of three kids, who are all in school. She has been a food vendor for three years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups. It is a delicacy many Ghanaian enjoy everyday, either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She also sells fried rice.

Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice, and assorted meat. She hopes this loan would help her increase her savings to improve her family's wellbeing. She would be very grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, and assorted meat.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris P. is 31 years old. She has four children, who are all currently in school. She trades in maize in the local market of Obuasi, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Her major difficulty is obtaining enough funds to support the business. She is requesting this loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk in order to grow her business and scale up her sales. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education and give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Corn Buyers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory by buying maize in bulk.

loans.name: Aliatu

texts.en:
Aliatu H. is 49 years old. She has three kids who are currently in school. She sells maize in the local market of Obuasi, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of maize to grow her business and scale up her sales.

Aliatu says her major challenge has to with the kids' school fees, which she works hard to provide. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids' education to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Corn Buyers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana B. is 48 years old. She lives with her children in her own home, located on street number 4, of the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. She is the principal of a school and has a lot of experience as a teacher, but she makes little money. This is why she needs your help. The loan she is requesting will be used to make repairs to her home.

Mrs. B. is one of our oldest clients and due to her good credit history she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer

Ana B. de 48 años de edad tiene casa propia y vive con sus hijos en la calle 4 de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como directora de un colegio y tiene mucha experiencia como profesora pero no gana mucho dinero, por eso necesita de su ayuda. El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su casa. La señora es una de nuestras clientes más antiguas, por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To make repairs to her home

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia G., a 60-year-old merchant, is married with nine kids. Five of them are currently schooling and four have completed college. She sells cereals such as maize and rice on top of a table in the local market. She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of maize and rice to grow her business and scale up her sales.

Afia says her major challenge has to with the kids' school fees. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids' education to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called Corn Buyers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more maize and rice for re-sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth L. owns her home at Alley “July 16”, Caupolican Street, Tembladerani district, La Paz. She has two children, is a teacher and works at the Ignacio Calderón school, which is located on Canónigo Ayllón Street in the same district. She will use the requested loan to renovate her bathroom. The initial work has been completed – all that remains are the finishing elements. The bathroom will be for her children’s use. Elizabeth is an Impro client and makes her payments on time. Therefore she qualifies to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Elizabeth L. vive en casa propia (callejón 16 D. julio, calle Caupolican D. la zona Tembladerani D. la ciudad D. La paz) tiene dos hijos, ella es profesora y trabaja en el colegio Ignacio Calderón que esta ubicada en la calle Canónigo Ayllón D. la misma zona. El crédito solicitado es para la refacción D. un baño, se hizo la obra bruta, lo que falta es la obra fina, ese baño será exclusivamente utilizado por los hijos. Es cliente D. Impro y paga muy bien. Por lo tanto, califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas E. M. owns his home in the Pasankeri district, a suburban area of La Paz. He is a public transportation driver and his wife runs a small grocery store out of their home. The loan will be used to lay a cement floor for the eventual construction of a bedroom for their children. This is the first time Tomas is requesting a loan. The socio-economic analysis Impro has conducted qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El señor Tomas E. M. tiene domicilio propio ubicado en la zona de Pasankeri, área suburbana de La Paz. Tomas trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa atiende una modesta tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. El crédito solicitado será destinado en construir una loza de cemento para la futura construcción de una habitación, futuro dormitorio de sus hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente.

loans.use: Bedroom construction

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Maria Q. A. lives in her parents’ house in the Las Lomas district, which is on the west end of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two daughters. Maria makes knitted sweaters as part of a contract with a local shop. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. With the savings they accumulated from several years of work, they purchased a lot on the outskirts of the city. They will use the loan to pay for the design and foundation – that is, dirt removal and grading – of their new home. This is the second time they are requesting a loan. The socio-economic analysis Impro has conducted qualifies them for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Maria Q. A. vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus dos hijas. Maria trabaja tejiendo chompas en un convenio con una tienda, su esposo es empleado en un taller de carpintería. Con sus ahorros, producto de varios años de trabajo compraron un terreno en las laderas de la ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado al trazado y replanteo de la nueva vivienda, es decir, al traslado de tierra y al terraseo de la misma. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Bartolina

texts.es:
La Sra. Bartolina tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo una es menor de edad y esta en la secundaria, los tres mayores son independientes y profesionales.

La Sra. Morocha como es conocida por todos sus familiares y amigos se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos de alimentos y golosinas dentro de un Colegio de la comunidad, ofrece el desayuno y la merienda en nutritivos menús para los estudiantes de la etapa secundaria del colegio, este trabajo lo viene realizando hace 6 años.

Se inicio primeramente con la venta ambulante fuera del colegio y como cada día sus clientes fueron aumentando la directora del colegio le ofreció estar responsable de la cantina dentro de la misma cobrándole una suma de alquiler por el local, desde entonces su negocio ha crecido no solo en tamaño sino también en servicios ya que la sra. Bartolina anexo un pequeño comedor para los profesores que debían trabajar doble turno.

Esta feliz con su trabajo, por que el entusiasmo de estar rodeada de gente joven con mucha energía y vitalidad le da fuerzas para seguir brindando lo mejor de ella.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: golosinas, gaseosas, hamburguesas, panchos, helados, jugos, galletitas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bartolina is 54 years old; she is married and has 4 children. Only one of them is a minor and is in high school while the three older ones are independent and professionals. Mrs. Morocha, as she is known by all her family members and friends, sells edible products and candy at a school in her community. She offers healthy menus of breakfast and snacks for high school students. She has been in this line of work for 6 years.

She initially started her sales on foot outside of the school, and since each day her clientele grew in size, the school principal offered her to be responsible for the snack bar inside of the facilities and charges her a fee for the space. Since then, her business has grown not only in size, but also in the amount of services since Mrs. Bartolina has annexed a small dining area for the teachers who have to work double shifts.

She is very happy with her work because she finds the enthusiasm of being surrounded by young people with lots of energy and vitality gives her strength to continue giving it her all.

She is asking for a loan to purchase items such as candy, sodas, hamburgers, 'panchos', ice cream, juice, cookies and more.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items such as candy, sodas, hamburgers, 'panchos', ice cream, juice, cookies and more

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy Yuira M. owns his home in the Lomas district, a suburban area of La Paz. He is married and has three children. Eloy works as a driver in a city construction company and his wife does embroidery work for a traditional costume shop. They requested a loan for building a bedroom on the second floor of their home. This is the first time they are requesting a loan. The socio-economic analysis Impro has conducted qualifies them for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El señor Eloy Y. M. tiene casa propia en la zona de las Lomas, área suburbana de La Paz. Eloy esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Su ocupación es la de chofer en una constructora de la ciudad y su esposa realiza bordados para una tienda de trajes folklóricos. Solicitaron un préstamo para la construcción de una habitación en el segundo nivel de su vivienda. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y pueden acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Bedroom construction

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon M. runs a shop at Buguruni Mtambani in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of items including cereal crop products, such as wheat flowers, maize flowers, rice, and beans. He purchases the items from the wholesale shop in Kariakoo shopping center. His business plan is to run a wholesale shop. He requests a loan of $550 to meet his business demand.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha R. C. lives in her parents’ home. She has a 10-year-old daughter and is separated from her husband. Martha is a street vendor. She sells music videos and movies in the city of La Paz. She plans to use the loan to complete construction of a bathroom in her home, which is in the Pasankeri district. This is the fourth time she has requested a loan. The socio-economic analysis Impro has conducted qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Martha R. C. vive en casa de sus padres, tiene una hija de 10 años y esta separada del marido. Martha es comerciante ambulante, vende videos de música y películas, su territorio es la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado para terminar la construcción de un baño en su domicilio, vive en la zona de Pasankeri. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina S. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos menores, ambos estudiantes de la educación primaria.
La Sra. Catalina es propietaria de un vivero hace más de 10 años, se inició con esta actividad gracias al amor que tiene hacia las plantas, las flores, en la naturaleza en sí, gracias a su suegra por la donación de un terreno empezó a realizar sus primeras compras de diferentes plantas de estación, asi también, como árboles frutales y para reforestar la tierra.
Sus clientes fueron sumando al correr del tiempo y su terreno fue quedando cada vez más pequeño para la gran cantidad de mercaderías, a la que se fueron sumando los productos de alfarería y adornos de jardín, como cántaros, imitación de aves y otros.
Compró otro terreno y así fue creciendo, actualmente cuenta con 4 terrenos explotados como vivero.
Comenta que la paz de estar rodeada por la naturaleza le ayuda a seguir cada día ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: Plantas diversas, flores de estación, árboles frutales, plantas ornamentales y otros.
texts.en:
Catalina S. is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children who are currently in primary school.

Catalina is the owner of a greenhouse and has been so for more than 10 years. She started her business thanks to a love she felt for plants, flowers, and all of nature. Her mother-in-law gave her the land she needed and soon after she started to make her first purchases of perennial plans, as well as fruit trees and trees for reforestation.

Her clientele started to grow with time and her plot of land seemed to be getting smaller but only because she had so many plants. She sarted having more and more alfalfa products and garden decorations, such as water jugs, bird statues and others.

She purchased another plot of land and so it kept on growing, and today she has 4 plots of land where she grows her plants.

She feels enormous peace when she is surrounded by nature and this helps her to make each day a better one offering the best service to her clients.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise items such as: various plants, flowers that are in season, fruit trees, ornamental plants, and others.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise items such as: various plants, flowers that are in season, fruit trees, ornamental plants, and others

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra Margarita tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores que están estudiando en la secundaria.

La sra. Margarita es propietaria de un copetín en su casa propia, inició su microempresa como vendedora ambulante de frutas en el Aeropuerto, luego consiguió un puesto en la aduana dentro del aeropuerto, después de unos años ahorro y decidió renunciar para iniciar su negocio propio, y habilitó un comedor para ofrecer los servicios de desayunos y almuerzos a los funcionarios del aeropuerto.

Después de varios años de trabajo, cayo enferma y tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente, esto la obligó a trasladar su negocio en su casa, que sigue hasta la fecha con una antigüedad de 1 año. En su copetín además colocó mesas de billar lo que le provee de un muy buen ingreso extra ya que ella alquila las mesas para jugar en su local.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otros.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old, is single, and has 2 children, still minors and attending high school.

Margarita is the owner of a small cafe run right our of her home. She started running a business by walking about selling fruit in the airport, but later she managed to get herself a a job at customs inside the airport. After some years she saved up enough money and decided to start her own business. She remodelled an old restaurant to provide breakfast and lunch meals to the airport workers.

After many years of hard work, she fell ill and she had to have a surgery, this pushed her to move her home in her house, and she has been doing this for the last year. In her cafe she put up some billiard tables that have earned her a good amount of extra income. She rents these talbes out to players.

She requests a loan to purchase drinks of all sorts, such as soft drinks, beers, and wines among others.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks of all kinds, such as soft drinks, beers, and wines among others.

loans.name: Sensa

texts.en:
Sensa M., a Tanzanian woman, is a food vender. She lives in Buguruni Mnyaman in Dar-es-Salaam. Her business is located at the Buguruni business market and her customers come from all around the market. She manages to meet her family's daily needs from her business income. 

She needs a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Sra Maria Luisa tiene 51 años de edad, esta en pareja, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad y la menor esta estudiando.

La Sra. Maria se dedica junto con su marido a la venta de quinielas en forma ambulante (Venta de juegos de azar), hace más de 25 años, trabajaba inicialmente como empleada se servicios domésticos, cuando conoció a su esposo y vinieron sus hijos decidió realizar una actividad por cuenta propia ya que su empleo anterior tenia que dedicarle el tiempo completo y sus ingresos eran bajos.

Esta actividad requiere de mucho esfuerzo y por tal motivo la sra. Maria decidió que este crédito será para la construcción de una vivienda más sólida y así iniciar una microempresa dentro de su propia casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos,tejas.cementos y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa is 51 years old, married, with 3 children, two of whom are adults and the youngest is still studying. Maria, along with her husband, have sold lottery tickets (games of chance) as street vendors for more than 25 years. She initially worked as a domestic employee, when she met her husband and they had their children she decided to pursue a job of her own as her previous work was full time and the pay was low. This activity requires great effort and therefore Maria decided that this loan will be used for the construction of a home that is more solid and in this way start a microbusiness in her home. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as: bricks, tiles, cement, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as bricks, tiles, cement, and more

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is 55 years old. She is a widow with nine children. Unfortunately, she has lost three. The remaining six are currently in school. She is a local manufacturer of soaps and bleaches and sells used clothes as well. Yaa has been in business for ten years, and she sells to support her family with income.  Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business to scale up. With the loan, Yaa wants to buy more materials to increase the production of her soaps and bleaches. She is with Harmony Group Trust, and the group members guarantee for each other as collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To be able to purchase more raw materials for her soap manufacturing, and to also buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge G. tiene 43 años de edad y su esposa la Sra. Gladys de 39 años de edad tienen 4 hijos todos en edad escolar. Don Jorge y su esposa viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos.

El señor Jorge desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una carpintería de donde aprendió la profesión de carpintero, gracias a ese interés por aprender se hizo un profesional.

Hoy en día Don Jorge ya no es empleado por que ya tiene su propia carpintería la que pudo montar en el año 1989 mediante el esfuerzo de haber trabajado siendo muy joven y también por que pudo ahorrar para comprar sus herramientas.

Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya en el año 2006, dichos préstamo fue de gran utilidad por que mediante ese apoyo pudo tomar compromisos con empresas. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de maderas y otras materias primas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge G. is 43 years old and his wife, Gladys, is 39 years old. They have four school-aged children. Jorge and his wife live in their own home together with their children.

Jorge started working at a young age as a carpenter’s assistant, where he learned the trade. Thanks to his interest in learning, he became a professional carpenter.

Today, Jorge is no longer someone else’s employee but instead has his own carpentry business. He started it in 1989, through a great deal of effort and because he has worked since he was a youngster. He was also able to save money with which to buy tools.

He started working with Fundación Paraguaya in 2006. Said loans were very useful to him given that, with their help, he was able to take orders from companies. The loan he is seeking is for the purchase of wood and other raw materials.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and other materials.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris K. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Tachiemantia, a suburb of Sunyani where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 47 years old and married with five children, who are all currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Doris wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Harmony Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. Doris is pictured above at her work.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene 44 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una en edad escolar, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos.

La señora María tiene una despensa ubicada en su casa en la Ciudad de V. Hayes. Inicio su negocio en el año 1988 gracias a un pequeño ahorro que pudo juntar su ya difunto marido.

Doña María esta llevando el negocio adelante con mucho esfuerzo con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores quienes ya trabajan y le ayudan económicamente para que el negocio vaya progresando y que el cliente se sienta a gusto cuando esta de compra.

Ahora pide préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, y otros.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, has three children, 2 grown and one still in school, she lives in her own home with her children.

María has a small store located in her home in V. Hayes city. She began her business in 1988 thanks to some small savings that her now deceased husband had gathered.

María is taking her business forward with great effort and the help of her older chidlren whom now work and help her economically so that her business continues to grow and her customers feel comfortable while shopping.

Now she asks for a loan to buy more merchandise: rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store: rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk and more.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna L. is a Tanzanian business woman. She is thirty-nine years old with one kid. Her son is in form three in secondary school. She runs two salons in Dar-es-Salaam city center. Profit from the business helps her to pay the school fees for her son and meet her family's daily needs. She requests a loan of $1200 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Emma Brunilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Emma Brunilda U. is originally from Bluefields. She is 59 years old and is married to Mr. Arturo Cassanova, who is currently unemployed. They have two grown children. Suffice it to say that Mrs. U.'s only income is from second-hand clothing sales. Mr. U. has been selling used clothing for 15 years and has clients from local communities who prefer her business because she offers a variety of clothing (children's clothing, bed linens, men's and women's clothing for all ages). Mrs. U. needs second-hand children's clothing and at the moment does not have the capital needed to purchase more packages. For this reason she needs a loan in order to buy 1 package of children's clothing at $300.00/package. With this investment she will increase her income and be able to satisfy client demands.

Tranlsated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Emma Brunilda U. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Arturo Cassanova quien se encuentra desempleado, ambos tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad, cabe señalar que el único ingreso de la Sra. U. es el de la venta de ropa usada. La Sra. U. vende ropa usada hace 15 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de la comunidades que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades). La Sra. U. tiene mas demanda de paca de ropa de niño y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa para niño y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa para niño a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase: 1 package of used children's clothing

texts.en: Grace Y. is 29 years old and mother of one child. Her seven years old child is currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling food stuff like Onions, plantain, beans and groundnuts and drinks in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family. Grace is a member of the group called Asempa Trust Group which literally means (Good News). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taking during their group meetings.

loans.use: She needs the loan to purchase her goods directly from the farmers such as Onions, Groundnuts, beans and drinks etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is 29 years old and mother of one child. Her seven years old child is currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling groceries stuff like Onions, plantain, beans and groundnuts and drinks in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income and also to out ways her competitors activities  to support her family. Grace is a member of the group called Asempa Trust Group which literally means (Good News). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taking during their group meetings.

loans.use: She needs the loan to expand business to overcome competitors

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio Candía Romero está casado con la Sra. Amada Ramona Núñez, tienen 2 hijos (un varón y una nena) los dos adolescentes, el señor Antonio tiene un comedor en el Taller de la Municipalidad ya hace 15 años. Antonio le provee desayuno, almuerzo y merienda a 200 funcionarios municipales que habitualmente trabajan en ese lugar. Sin embargo, necesitan este préstamo para la compra de vacas faenadas que el señor Antonio se va a traer de la ciudad de Caazapá.

Además de la compra de frutas frescas y verduras que lo hacen diariamente, debe pagar al municipio un impuesto por la utilización del predio del comedor. Ellos son felices con este negocio que les permite estar más cerca de sus hijos que trabajan con ellos. Este será su primer préstamo con la Fundación.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio Candía Romero is married to Mrs. Amada Ramona Núñez. They have two children, a boy and a girl, both adolescents. For 15 years, Mr. Antonio has had a cafeteria in the Municipal Repair Shop. Antonio provides breakfast, lunch, and afternoon snack to the 200 municipal workers who regularly work there. Nevertheless, they need this loan to purchase beef that Mr. Antonio is going to bring from the city of Caazapá.

In addition to the daily purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables, he has to pay a tax to the municipality for the use of the space for the cafeteria. They are happy with this business that allows them to be closer to their children, who work alongside them. This will be their first loan with the Foundation.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, rice, sugar, oil, milk, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Virginia Fátima

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia Fátima M. D. is originally from Bluefields. She is 30 years old and married to Mr. Juan López, who works in the city's harbor which provides a minimal salary that does no cover basic costs. They have 3 young children who are in primary school. Mrs. M. has sold used clothing for the past 5 years, and has regular customers from the community of Kukra Hill, who prefer her business because she offers a variety of clothing (children's clothes, bed linens, men's and women's clothing for all ages). Mrs. M. has more demand for package of women's clothing varieties, and at the moment does not have enough capital to purchase them. For this reason she needs a loan to buy 1 package of women's clothing variety at $275.00/package. With this investment, she will increase her earnings and be able to satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Virginia Fátima M. D. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan López quien trabaja como esquivador en la portuaria de esta ciudad el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad quienes cursan estudios primarios. La Sra. M. vende ropa usada hace 5 años, esta microempresaria viaja a la comunidad de Kukara Hill teniendo como clientes los habitantes de esta comunidad que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropa (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades). La Sra. Marin tiene mas demanda de paca de ropa mixta para mujeres y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa mixta para mujeres y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa mixta para mujeres a $ 275.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase: 1 variety pack of women's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anaju

texts.es:
Mrs. Anaju G. R. is originally from Bluefields. She is 34 years old and married to Mr. Wilber Espinoze, who works selling nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish) and fresh juice which brings in a small salary that does not cover the costs of basic needs. They have 2 young children who are in primary school. With the income of her baking business, where she makes puddings, cookies, cakes, and breads, Mrs. G. helps pay for the school costs for her children and some basic services. For 6 years Mrs. G. has baked puddings, cookies, cakes, bread and meringues. Her clients are in transit from work to home or members of the neighborhood who prefer her home-made products. Mrs. G. does not have enough capital to purchase the ingredients she uses in large quantities, to cover her needs she must buy: 10 lbs. of butter at $2.00/lb.; 5 boxes of eggs at $.400/box; 100 kilos of flour at $50.00/100 kilos; 25 lbs. of sugar at $1.00/lb.; 10 lbs. of margarine at $1.00/lb.; 1 box of milk at $25.00/box; 2 units of pastry bags at $22.50/unit; 6 units of food coloring at $15.00/unit; and 2 units of molds for bread at $20.00/unit. With these supplies she will be able to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Anaju G. R. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Wilber Espinoza quien trabaja vendiendo nacatamales y frescos naturales el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 2 hijas menores de edad quienes cursan estudios primarios, con el ingreso del negocio de la venta de pudines, galletas, tortas, pan la Sra. G. ayuda a pagar los estudios de sus hijas y algunos servicios básicos . Hace 6 años la Sra. G. horna pudines, galletas, tortas, pan y picos sus clientes son los transeúntes y habitantes del barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer productos caseros. La Sra. G. no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar en grandes cantidades los ingredientes de sus productos, por eso necesita comprar: 10 libras de Mantequilla a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 5 cajillas de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares la cajilla,1 quintal de harina a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal, 25 libras de azúcar a $ 1.00 dólar la libra,10 libras de manteca a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 1 caja de leche a $ 25.00 dólares la caja, 2 unidades de mangas pasteleras a $ 22.50 dólares la unidad, 6 unidades de colorante para el merengue a $ 15.00 dólares la unidad y 2 unidades de molde para pan a $ 20.00 dólares la unidad con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To purchase: butter, eggs, flour, sugar, margarine, milk, pastry bags, food coloring for merengue and bread/cake molds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 29 years old and the mother of a seven year old child, who is currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling drinks and grocery items (like onions, plantain, beans, and groundnuts) in the neighborhood to loyal customers. She also trades at a community called Tachiemantia.

She says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory. This will enable her to make a better income to support her family and compete against other sellers' activities. Grace is a member of the group called Asempa Trust Group, which literally means Good News. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of drinks and grocery items.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cece, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 48 year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with six children. With income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Cecilia says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

Cecilia is a member of a group called Yesu Nimenidaso Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taking after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Elias José

texts.es:
Mr. Elias José B. F. is originally from Bluefields. He is 35 years old, married to Mrs. Raquel Montiel, and they have 2 young children who are in primary school. For 5 years Mr. B. has sold Hot Dogs and Sandwiches to clients who are in transit and prefer hand-made products. Mr. B. does not have the capital necessary to purchase large quantities of the ingredients that he uses in his products. He needs to buy 6 gallons of Mayonnaise at $7.00/gallon; 10 gallons of Ketchup at $6.00/gallon; 3 gallons of mustard at $5.00/gallon; 10 pounds of butter at $2.00/lb.; 40 pounds of sausage at $2.00/lb.; 25 pounds of salami at $2.00/lb.; and 33 bags of bread at $1.00/bag. With this investment he will be able to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Elias José B. F. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Raquel Montiel, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad quienes cursan estudios primarios. Hace 5 años El Sr. B. vende Hot Dog y Sándwich sus clientes son los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer productos caseros. El Sr. B. no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar en grandes cantidades los ingredientes de su productos, por eso necesita comprar: 6 galones de mayonesa a $ 7.00 dólares el galón, 10 galones de salsa de tomate a $ 6.00 dólares el galón, 3 galones de mostaza a $ 5.00 dólares el galón, 10 libras de mantequilla a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 40 libras de salchicha a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 25 libras de mortadela a $ 2.00 dólares la libra y 33 bolsas de pan a $ 1.00 dólar la bolsa con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To purchase: mayonnaise, ketchup, mustard, sausage, salami, and bread

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Married with a child who has successfully completed high school, Elizabeth is forty years old. She sells home products, like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She makes her sales by "hawking," which is door-to-door sales.

Elizabeth is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use this loan to buy stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell to her customers. She is a member of the community group called Yesu Nimenidaso Group, meaning God is My Hope. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She is pictured here after a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Janeteh Peralta

texts.es:
Janeteh Peralta A. is 41 years old and single. She has three children. Yader Alberto Peralta is 22 years old and works. He holds a bachelor's degree in economics. Luis Carlos is in his third year of an engineering degree. Tania is 17 years old and is studying business administration. Their father abandoned Janeteh and her children, and Janeteh dreams that her business could grow larger, so that she can provide a better quality of life for herself and her children. Janeteh runs a restaurant from her home, on the north side of the Guadalupe park 2c. west 20vrs. north. Though Janeteh holds a degree in business administration, she couldn't find work, so three years ago Janeteh started her restaurant. She had a vision that she'd like to cater to the many students who move to Leon to attend university there, and she was right on the mark. Janeteh would like to use a loan partially to buy prime materials and partially to purchase furniture and equipment. She says that this loan will help her provide better service to her clients, serving lunch and dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

su nombre es janeteh peralta A.,41 años de edad su estado civil es soltera,tiene 3 hijos sus hijos son: yader alberto peralta de 22 anos lic en economia y trabaja,luis carlos y cursa el 3 año de igenieria y tania que tiene 17 años y cursa el 1 año de administracion de empresa. el conyugue no esta con ella el la abandono con sus hijos,ella sueña que su pequeño establecimiento llegue a ser un poco mas amplio para poder tener mejores condiciones para ella y sus hijos,el tipo de negocio que ella tiene es de comideria en el cual expende comida y este esta ubicado en su propia casa de habitacion que es costado norte parque guadalupe 2c.oeste 20 vrs. al norte, el tiempo que ella tiene de tener este negocio es de 3 años, ella comenzo el negocio porque quedo desempleada porque aun asi que ella es una profesional,es lic.En administracion de empresa no encontro trabajo de lo que ella podia desempeñarse. tuvo la vision de que podia cuidar estudiantes a los cules les ofrece sus servicios, tomando en cuenta que leon esta nombrada la ciudad universitaria teniendo en cuenta que en leon vienen muchos estudiantes de los departamentos a estudiar y ella acerto en su negocio,el fondo ella lo piensa usar para comprar una parte de materia prima y la otra parte para la compra de mobiliario y equipo.ella dice que el credito le ayudar par poder darle un mejor servicios a sus clientes, lo que mas ella sule vender es el almuerzo y la cena.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Janneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Janneth del Socorro R. S. is 34 years old and a widow. She has three children. Fernando Salvador R. is 18 years old and in his first year of university, earning a degree in hotel administration and hospitality. Karen Vanesa is 16 years old and in her third year of high school. Stacy Janeth Lopez R. is 13 years old and in her first year of high school.

Janeth would like to finish her beauty school so that she can educate children from low-income families. The business that Janeth now manages is located on Rigoberto Lopez Perez, Radio Morena 1 1/2c. and offers technical classes in cosmetology and hair styling. Janneth has 15 years of experience as a stylist and 4 years as an instructor. She started this business because there were no beauty academies in her area and the organizations that did offer beauty instruction were not accredited. Janneth would like to use a loan to improve her establishment and pay more attention to her clients. Janneth says that all of her loans have benefited her, including helping her sell products like straighteners, dyes, perms, and manicures.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

su nombre es janneth del socorro R. S. su edad es de 34 años de edad su estado civil es viuda, tiene 3 hijos los cules son:fernando salvador R. de 18 años que cursa 1 año de administracion turistica y hotelera, karen vanesa de 16 años cursa el 3 año de bachillerato, stacy janeth lopez R. de 13 años cursa el 1 año de bachillerato. su estado civil es soltera no tiene conyugue,su sueño es de terminar su academia de belleza para poder preparar jovenes del sector mas vulnerable.el negocio que ella posee es enseñanza tecnica en belleza y estilismo este se encuentra ubicado en el reparto Rigoberto Lopez perez, radio morena1 1/2c. al sur el tiempo que ella tiene de tener su negocio es de 15 años como estilista y 4 años de instructora. ella empezo este negocio porque cuando inicio no habia academia de belleza y la que se encontraba no estaba acreditada. ella piensa usar el financiamineto para mejorar el establecimiento y asi poder brindar una mejor atencion a su clientela. ella dice que a todos sus creditos ha logrado darle buenos provechos,lo que mas logra vender ella es todos los productos para cabello alisado,tinte, permanente y maniquiur.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria J. M. is 59 years old, and married. She has three children who are 31, 38, and 35 years old. Rosa's partner works in farming and husbandry, and her children are all employed. Rosa would like to use a loan as working capital to invest in inventory and therefore satisfy demand. Rosa raises pigs in her home, and has been in this business in Malpasillo for more than 36 years. She began her business out of a need for work, and to support her family. With this loan she can do just that.



 Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

su nombre es Rosa Maria J. M., su edad es de 59 años,  su estado civil es  casada, tiene 3 hijos sus edades son: 31, 38 y 35, el nivel de escolaridad de los hijos es que no estudian trabajan , su compañero de vida trabaja en agricultura y ganaderia, su proposito es con el credito es poder invertir en capital de trabajo, de esta menera tener un inventario capaz de satisfacer la demanda, su actividad economica es el destace de cerdo, en su casa de habitacion teniendo mas de 36 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,este esta ubicado en malpasillo, el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 36 años, el negocio inicio con la necesidad de tener un trabajo de en el caso de poder mantener a su famila teniendo este financiamneto podra realizar lo q ya se ha dicho.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mery

texts.fr:
Madame A. Mery est née le 28 septembre 1982 à Tchamba, ville située au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et a deux enfants. Actuellement, elle habite avec son mari qui est un chauffeur de taxis, le quartier Agoè à Lomé après avoir quitté son village natal en 1999. Son activité principale est la vente de pagnes et de bijoux dans son quartier de résidence. Elle est revendeuse ambulante et vend de quartier en quartier. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle arrive à aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès  de WAGES et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 20 pièces de pagnes et 10 ensembles de bijoux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mery A. was born on September 28, 1982 in Tchamba, a town situated in the north of Togo. She is married and has two children. Presently, she is living with her husband, who is a taxi driver, in the Agoè neighborhood in Lomé, after having left her native village in 1999. Her primary business is the sale of "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored cloth, also known as wax prints) and costume jewelry in the neighborhood where she lives. She is a travelling sales person, walking from one neighborhood to the next to sell her wares. With the income from her business, she manages to help her husband cover the family's living expenses. She has already received one loan from WAGES which she appropriately reimbursed.

This second loan which she is requesting will permit her to bring her inventory back up to normal through the purchase of 20 lengths of "pagne" and 10 sets of costume jewelry.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and costume jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr:
Né en 1967 à Zowla dans la préfecture des Lacs, monsieur S. Ekoué est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a mis en place un centre de traitement de textes et de vente des articles scolaires depuis l’année 2000 et assure la charge de ses enfants. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. 
A l’approche de cette nouvelle rentrée scolaire, il sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter trente cinq (35) cartons de cahiers, quinze (15) livres de lecture et des stylos.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Zowla in the Prefecture of the Lakes, Mr. Ekoué S. is married and the father of 2 children. He established a center for word processing and the sale of school supplies in the year 2000 so that he can support his children. He has received one prior loan from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly.

For the new school year, he is requesting a second loan to buy 35 cases of notebooks, 15 readers, and some pens.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, dame V. Amah est née le 17 septembre 1960 dans le village de Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Depuis qu’elle s’est installée à Agoè à Lomé, elle exerce le commerce de céréales et a crée une cabine téléphonique afin de pouvoir servir tous ces clients. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a fait un prompt remboursement.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock de céréales par l’achat de deux (2) sacs de maïs et d’un sac du haricot. Ce renouvellement de stock lui permettra de bien de vendre et de gagner beaucoup de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Amah V. was born on September 17, 1960 in the village of Tchékpo-Dédékpoè. Ever since she came to live in Agoè in Lomé, elle has been selling cereals and has opened a telephone booth so that she can serve lots of customers. She has received one loan already and reimbursed it promptly.

This second loan that she is requesting will permit her to replenish her stocks of cereals by buying 2 sacks of corn and 1 sack of dried beans. This replenishment of her inventory will allow her to increase her sales and earn a lot more income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Dame Y. Adjo est née le 31 décembre 1964 à EKETO dans la préfecture d’Amou. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Depuis l’année 2004, elle exerce le commerce de piment et d’huile de noix palme dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a l’habitude de s’approvisionner dans son village natal afin de pouvoir vendre dans les marchés de la capitale et gagner beaucoup bénéfices. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 2 sacs de piments sec et de 10 bidons d’huile de noix palme.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo Y. was born on December 31, 1964 in Eketo, in Amou Prefecture. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. Since 2004, she was been selling hot peppers and palm nut oil in the Agoè district in Lomé. She is accustomed to going to the village of her birth to buy her goods so as to be able to re-sell them in the markets of the capital and earn a lot of profit.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to purchase 2 sacks of hot peppers and 10 containers of palm nut oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hot peppers and palm nut oil for re-sale

loans.name: Esperanza Del Este Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité la señora Rumilda Martínez quien vive en la Zona del km 10 Monday de C.D.E. contactó con el asesor de Fundación Paraguaya par informarse acerca de los programas de ayuda financiera que tiene la institución.

La Señora contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité de dicha zona. Luego de varias reuniones se formó el comité que se denomina Esperanza del Este y está constituido por 18 señoras todas de la misma zona.

Las señoras tienen actividades diferentes, como ser venta de ropas, comestible, confites, frutas, verduras y también algunas realizan trabajos particulares como limpiadoras a domicilio y cuentan con un ingreso semanal o mensual.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de 300.000 Gs c/u. Ellas retiran el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículo de primera necesidad, comidas y otros. Para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
To form the present committee, Mrs. Rumilda Martínez, who lives in the km 10 Monday de C.D.E. zone, contacted the Fundación Paraguaya consultant in order to learn about the financing programs available from this institution. Mrs. Martínez contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee from their area. The after various meetings, they formally formed a committee that the call “Esperanza del Este” (Hope of the East) and there are 18 women members, all from this area. The women have different activities such as selling clothing, food, fruit, vegetables and some also do jobs such as cleaning homes and they have a weekly or monthly income. The women are asking for a loan of 300.00 Gs for each member. They will use the loan to buy clothing, basic needs items, food, and more to then resell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eggs, fabric, corn, wheat flour, sugar, oil, oranges, bananas, apples, pants, jackets, powdered soap, moisturizer, basic needs and more.

loans.name: Rodolfo Manuel

texts.es:
The client Rodolfo Manuel asks for a loan to improve his home. He wants to improve his kitchen and in that way improve his family's life. Over time and through loans, he has been building his home. It is built of concrete with a ceramic floor, zinc roof, living room, two bedrooms, electric power, and drinkable water, but the kitchen is not in good condition. He works in the business of servicing topographers. He counts on the support of his wife who helps him with the household expenses. This young man is a professional that started working when he was young. He is humble and has a spirit of personal improvement. In his past loans, he has had good credit history, the will to pay, and responsibly assumes his credit commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El cliente Rodolfo Manuel solicita el crédito para mejora de su vivienda, requiere realizar mejoras en la cocina, de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar; con el tiempo y a través de créditos ha ido construyendo su vivenda, está construida de concreto, de piso de cerámica, techo de zinc, sala, dos dormitorio, energia electrica, agua potable, pero la cocina no esta bien acondicionada; labora en la empresa de servicio de topógraficos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que ayuda con los gastos del hogar, este joven es un profesional que desde pequeño inició su actividad laboral, humilde, con un alto espiritu de superación personal, en los créditos anteriores demostro moral crediticia, tiene voluntad de pago, asume con resposabilidad sus compromisos de crédito.

loans.use: Improvements to his Kitchen

loans.name: Josefa Dolores

texts.es:
Josefa Dolores U. is single and 48 years of age. She is an employee of the Asunción de Juigalpa, Chontale Hospital. She has 30 years of service as a nurse's assistant. In her job, she does 7 night shifts each month. She has 4 children who live with her who work and study to help her. She is asking for her fifth loan to use in the construction of a drain. With her previous loans and her Christmas bonus, she has been able to improve her home and that way get a decent roof for her children. She has stated that loans do good when they are well used. In her workplace, she is distinguished by her responsibility and abnegation to work in the service of those most in need.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefa Dolores U. es soltera, con 48 años de edad, trabajadora del Hospital Asunción de Juigalpa, Chontales. Tiene 30 años de servicio como auxiliar de enfermeria, dentro de su trabajo realiza 7 turnos nocturnos durante el mes, tiene 4 hijos los cuales habitan con ella, los que trabajan y estudian para ayudarle. Está solicitando su 5to. crédito para utilizarlo en la construcción de un sumidero, con sus créditos anteriores y su aguinaldo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y asi obtener un techo digno para sus hijos. Manifestó los créditos sirven mucho cuando son bien utilizados. En su centro de trabajo se ha destacado por su responsabilidad y abnegación al trabajo al servicio de los más necesitados.

loans.use: Purchase of Metal and Quarry Stone to Build a Drain

loans.name: Santos Efraín

texts.es:
Professor Santos Efraín, a single 43 year old, states that he used his two previous loans to start putting up a wall, but that strong rains ruined it. With this third loan, he will finish the 5 meters that remain. He also has as a project to change the roof of the kitchen of his house because it is in very bad condition. Señor Núñez said that after the death of his wife he had neglected his home, but that now he is trying to return to normal and to improve his home to give his daughter who is the only one who lives with him a decent home. His daughter is in her first year of university studies. The Professor has 19 years of service in the education sector as a teacher of physical education. And, he hopes that he can start a new life with his daughter and wants to start by upgrading his home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El profesor Santos Efraín soltero de 43 años plantea que con sus dos créditos anteriores comenzó a levantar un muro de contrucción pero que las fuertes lluvias se lo arruinaron, con este 3er crédito lo terminará ya que le hacen falta 5 metros, también tiene como proyecto cambiar el techo de la cocina de su casa porque está en pésimas condiciones. El señor Núñez manifestó que después de la muerte de su esposa él había descuidado su vivienda pero ahora está tratando de volver a la normalidad y mejorar su vivienda para darle a su hija quien es la única que habita con él, una vivienda digna. La joven está cursando estudios universitarios el primer año de su carrera. El profesor tiene 19 años de servicio en el sector educación como profesor de educación física. Y espera poder empezar una nueva vida con su hija, y quiere empezar por el acondicionamiento de su vivienda

loans.use: Improve his Kitchen's Roof

loans.name: Blanca Agustina

texts.es:
Señora Blanca Agustina M. has been an employee at the Asunción de Juigalpa Hospital as an operator of sterilization equipment and materials for 14 years. She is single with two daughters who are already married. She is responsible for her two grandchildren, a girl who is 12 years old, in fifth grade, and a boy who is 9 years old, in 4th grade. This client, in spite of being 50 years old, is very dynamic and responsible in her work. She is asking for a loan to build a porch for her home. She feels satisfied with the service AFODENIC has provided her and, therefore, she proudly explains that her house was covered in boards and "nicalit" (pressed sheets of asbestos, cement and cellulose) and has been for more than 10 years. On the date that my house is made of concrete, with a zinc roof, painted, etc., I will feel very proud of having a decent home for me and my grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Blanca Agustina M., trabajandora del Hospital Asunción de Juigalpa, desempeñándose como operadora de equipos y materiales de Esterilización, con 14 años de servicio, es soltera, con 2 hijas que ya están casadas, tiene bajo su responsabilidad 2 nietos una de 12 años que cursa el 5o. grado, un varón de 9 años que esta en 4to grado. Esta clienta a pesar de su edad 50 años es muy dinámica y responsable en su trabajo.Está solicitando su crédito para hacer un porche en su casa. Se siente satisfecha con la atención que AFODENIC le ha brindado pues orgullosamente comenta que su casa era forrada con tabla y techo nicalit y permaneció así por más de 10 años, a la fecha mi casa es de concreto, techo de zinc, pintada, etc. por lo que me siento muy orgullosa de tener una vivienda digna para mí y mis nietos.

loans.use: Construction of a Wall

loans.name: María De Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario tiene 43 años y está separada. Ella se dedica a la importación de mercaderías varias para proveer a pequeños negocios como despensas, kioscos, mini markets entre otros.

Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años. Importa de la Argentina: harina, cerveza, vino, dulces y del Brasil, pollo, de carne de cerdo, carne vacuna, embutidos, huevos. María tenía esta idea porque no había otra persona que se dedicaba a esta actividad, y su posición (ubicación) cerca de la frontera lo hace muy acertado.

Este será su primer préstamo con Fundación Paraguaya, sin embargo está muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le brinda con este crédito que le otorgamos. Con el dinero ella planifica traer otros artículos y así aumentar su stock. Además, ella espera tener otros créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Rosario is 43 years old and is separated. She is dedicated to importing different merchandise in order to stock small businesses like convenience stores, kiosks, and mini markets, among others.

She has had this business for ten years. From Argentina, she imports flour, beer, wine and sweets and from Brazil chicken, pork, beef, sausage and eggs. Maria had this idea since no one else performed this work and her location, close to the border, made it a good proposition.

This will be her first loan with Fundacion Paraguaya. Nevertheless, she is very happy to have the opportunity that comes with this loan. With this money, she is planning to bring other products and increase her stock. In addition, she hopes to obtain other loans with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, wine, oil, onion, flour, potatoes, beer, eggs, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Kary Gregorio

texts.es:
Kary Gregorio is 30 years of age and has 8 years of service with the state. He has two children, one is three years old and the other is one month old. His partner stopped working because of problems with her pregnancy. Señor G., with his three previous loans, succeeded in building his home. He will use this fourth loan to improve his home by adding “repello” (an extra coating of cement thrown onto the side of a wall) and tile. Further, he will build a porch to avoid water getting in the house when it rains heavily. His loans have been paid responsibly and he is known for being honest and responsible with many moral values. He tells us that, once he pays this loan, he will continue working with AFODENIC to succeed in painting his house and to have the decent home he has always dreamt of for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Kary Gregorio con 30 años de edad y 8 años de servivio para el estado, tiene 2 hijos: uno de 3 años y 1 de mes, su compañera por problemas del embarazo dejó de laborar. El señor Gonzalez con los 3 créditos anteriores logro contruir su vivienda, este 4to. crédito lo utilizará para mejorar la vivienda ya que realizará el embaldozado y repello, además construirá un porche para evitar que el agua penetre a la vivienda cuando llueve fuerte. Sus créditos los ha pagado con responsabilidad y se ha caracterizado por ser una persona honesta, responsable y con muchos valores morales, manifiesta que una vez que pague este crédito contunuará trabajando con AFODENIC, para lograr la pintura de su casa y tener una vivienda digna la que siempre ha soñado para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Coat and Tile

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, es una señora casada y madre de tres hijos. Ella se dedica exclusivamente a su despensa donde vende fideo, azúcar, arroz, yerba, bebidas entre otras cosas.

María, empieza a dedicarse a este rubro desde el año pasado con la ayuda de su esposo y con algunos ahorros con que contaba la misma, su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa.

María, con sus ganancias aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su esposo que trabaja en el aeropuerto de la ciudad de minga guazú, hacen frente a los gastos de su familia.

María, comenta que desde la apertura de su negocio a registrado nivel de ventas interesante. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a married woman and is the mother of three children. She owns a store, where she sells noodles, sugar, rice, herbs, and drinks, among other things. With the help of her husband and with some savings that were available to her, María has been working in this line of business since last year. Her business is located in her home. With her earnings, María contributes to the household income, and she and her husband, who works in the Minga Guazú airport, manage the family’s expenses. María says that since the opening of her business, she has achieved an interesting level of sales. Because of this, she wants to acquire more merchandise. In this way, she will be able to supply her clients’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like noodles, sugar, oil, herbs, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Señor Santiago P. is requesting his third loan to invest it in improving his home (putting a new roof on his house). He has worked as a teacher at the Nerpe El Triunfo school in Nueva Guinea for 10 years. This client has a 6-year-old son who is in first grade. His wife is in charge of taking care of the house and caring for their son. Don Santiago is a young, professional, responsible, honest, hard-working man. He lives in the region of La Flor, where there are few people. He is currently in his fifth year at the URACCAN University in Nueva Guinea. His dream is to keep studying and to have a stable career to help his family, who is very humble and doesn't have a lot of economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Santiago P. está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( cambierle el zinc a la casa), trabaja como docente del Nerpe El Triunfo en el municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, este cliente tiene un hijo de 6 años estudia su primer grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido del niño, don Santiago, es un hombre joven, profesional, responsable, honesto, trabajador, vive en comarca la Flor,en esta comarca son pocos los habitantes que viven en ella, actualmente esta estudiando quinto año en la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son familias muy humildes, de escasos recursos económicos

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación del presente comité fue la Sra. María Aquino integrante del comité “Mujeres Unidas 2” de la zona del km 9 Monday_ C.D.E. Ella es amiga de la Sra. Marina Carballo, la señora contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité. Esta señora es muy querida y respetada por sus vecinas, es muy activa y solidaria en el Barrio Yboty.

Marina vive con su conjugue Juan Ortiz tienen tres hijos, la misma se dedica a la venta de ropas, que ella misma confecciona este trabajo le genera un buen ingreso para el sustento de la familia, las demás integrantes del comité se dedican a actividades diferentes, como venta de frutas, verduras, lencería, condimentos, también comercios como kiosco y despensa. El grupo se caracteriza por ser solidario y responsable, el comité se denomina “Mujeres Activas” en representación de las integrantes muy trabajadoras.

Las actividades que realizan cada una se detalla a continuación: Zulma Beatriz Rodríguez : Costurera Petrona S. Martínez: Venta de cosméticos por catálogo De Lo Santa M.: Confección de Ropa. Nilda N. Dosantos: Costurera Heriberta Báez: Venta de Mercería Elpidia P. de Galeano: Venta de frutas y verduras Arminda González: Despensa Josefina Florentín: Venta de Ropas Eugenia M.: Costurera Marina G. Vera: Venta de Ropas Lucí Erodita García: Venta de Ropas Idolvina Sánchez de Benítez: Venta de gallinas Zulmira R. Molinas: Venta de condimentos Pablina Cáceres: Venta de Lencería Ramona Cáceres: Venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
It all started when Mrs Maria Aquino, who belongs to the committee "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) from the area around the km 9 Monday_ C.D.E, got in contact with Marina Carballo. Marina Carballo is a very active and supportive women who is well loved and respected within the "Barrio Yboty" neighborhood. Marina, then got in contact with friends and neighbors to build the "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women) group. The group can be described as very responsible and supportive, integrated by women with different professions. Marina lives together with her husband, Juan Ortiz, and their three sons; she sells clothes that she makes herself and the extra income allows her to contribute to the household budget. The activities undertaken by the different women from the "Mujeres Activas" group are: Zulma Beatriz Rodríguez : Seamstress Petrona S. Martínez: Sells cosmetics from a catalog De Lo Santa M.: Dressmaker Nilda N. Dosantos: Seamstress Heriberta Báez: Runs a small convenience store Elpidia P. de Galeano: Sells fruits and vegetables Arminda González: Runs a small groceries store Josefina Florentín: Sells clothes Eugenia M.: Seamstress Marina G. Vera: Sells clothes Lucí Erodita García: Sells clothes Idolvina Sánchez de Benítez: Sells chicken Zulmira R. Molinas: Sells spices Pablina Cáceres: Sells underware Ramona Cáceres: Sells cosmetics

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothes, cosmetics, groceries, spices, chiken and other articles

loans.name: Amparito Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Amparito is requesting a loan to finish constructing a room. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 17 years. She is a single mother of 2 sons. The oldest is 16, and the baby is 5 months. Despite being a teacher and not having another source of income, Amparito has proven to be a very reponsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She has a great spirit of improving herself professionally. Her dream for the future is to get her master's degree, to have health for her family, and to have a stable career.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Amparito está solicitando su crédito para terminar de construir una habitación. Trabaja como docente de Educación primaria desde hace 17 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones, el mayor de 16 años y un bebe de 5 meses, Amparito a pesar que es una docente asalariada y no depende de otros ingresos ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsables, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene gran espíritu de superación profesional y laboral, su sueño para el futuro es estudiar una maestría, salud para su familia y tener estabilidad laboral.

loans.use: To finish constructing a room

loans.name: Amelio

texts.es:
El señor Amelio se casó con la señora Marciana, tienen 4 hijos quienes tienen ingresos propios y viven en forma independiente.

Amelio se dedica en la panadería. El también tiene ingresos por servicio de taxi, pues le paga a un chofer para realizar dicha actividad por que el ya no tiene esos reflejos para seguir conduciendo, razón por el cual montó la panadería.

El señor Amelio necesita seguir trabajando por que a sus 66 años sigue teniendo ese espíritu emprendedor y no quiere depender de sus hijos económicamente ya que el no cuenta con ingresos de jubilación porque siempre trabajo por cuenta propia. El Crédito solicitado es para compra de bolsas de harinas para vender a los negocios de su barrio.
texts.en:
Amelio is married to Marciana. They have 4 children who earn their own living and live independently.

Amelio runs a bakery. He also has income from his taxi service. He pays someone else to drive his taxi because he no longer has the reflexes that he needs to continue driving. This is why he started his bakery.

Amelio needs to continue to work because at 66 years old he is still an enterprising man and because he does not want to depend on his children financially. He does not have a retirement account because he has also been self-employed. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase sacks of flour to sell to businesses in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 sacks of flour

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Señora Luz Marina is requesting her seventh loan to invest it in improving her home (to finish plastering the walls in her house). She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 25 years. This client is a single mother of 3 male children: the oldest is 24 and works in a distribution company; the middle son is 18, attends classes for his 5th year of secondary school at night, and works as a motorcycle mechanic during the day; and the youngest is 13 and is in the fifth grade. The two oldest help Luz Marina with the home's expenses. She is known for being humble in her work in the neighborhood. Her dream is to have a home in better condition and a stable job to help her eldery parents and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Luz Marina está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Terminar de repellar la casa), trabaja como docente de Educación primaria, desde hace 25 años, esta clienta es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos varones, el mayor de 24 años trabaja en una distribuidora, el otro de 18 años estudia su 5to año en la noche y en el dia trabaja como mecánico de motocicletas y el menor de 13 años estudia su 5to grado de Educación primaria, los dos hijos mayores le ayudan a Luz Marina con los gastos del hogar, ella se caracteriza por ser humilde en su labor de trabajo y en su barrio, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a sus encianos padres y a sus hijos

loans.use: To finish plastering the walls in her home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor José se casó con la señora Carolina, tienen 4 hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar.

El señor José se dedica en la compra de carbón en bolsas el cual empaqueta y lo vende en pequeña cantidad, esa actividad empezó hace cuestión de 3 años. Dicha actividad lo monto con los ahorros que iba acumulando de su salario, pues, cabe destacar que también trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un lote de carbón cuyo costo esta en oferta. El cliente tiene como meta apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en el día de mañana puedan tener una profesión.
texts.en:
José married Carolina, and they have four children who are in school.

José dedicates himself to purchasing charcoal in sacks, which he then repackages and sells in smaller quantities. He started this activity three years ago. Said enterprise was undertaken with savings he had from his salary as a security guard at a private home.

The loan he is seeking is for the purchase of a batch of charcoal which is being offered at a sale price. This client has as a goal to support his children in their educations so that tomorrow they can have a profession.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 100 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es:
Reyna Margarita is requesting her seventh loan in order to invest in improvements for her home (finish building the kitchen). She has worked as a teacher at the Salomon Ibarra Mayorga School for nine years. She has one son who is 8-years-old and is in second grade at the elementary school. Reyna is a single mother who lives with her mother. Although she does not have help from her son's father, she is a woman who has fought so that her child lacks nothing. She is a responsible, honest, hard-working woman who is loved by the residents of Angeles in the town of New Guinea. Currently, she is in her third year of studies at the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University. Her dream is to have a beautiful home, to work so that her son can get ahead, and to help her mother with the bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Reyna Margarita está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de construir la cocina), trabaja como docente de la Escuela Salomón Ibarra Mayorga desde hace 9 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria, Reyna es madre soltera que vive con su mamá, a pesar que ella no tiene la ayuda del padre de su hijo es una mujer que ha luchado para que a su hijo no le falte nada, es una mujer responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por habitantes de la colonia los Angeles del municipio de Nueva Guinea, actualmente está estudiando su 3 er año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish buliding her kitchen.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio Cesar is requesting a loan in order to invest in improvements for his home, such as building bathrooms. He has worked as a loan analyst for a bank in New Guinea for four years. Julio Cesar has three children, the eldest of which is 18 years old and is in her second year at university. The other is 13 years old and is in 6th grade and the youngest is 11 years old and is in 5th grade. His wife works as an accountant and both contribute to bills. Julio is a professional man who is responsible, honest, and hard working. He lives in the #6 area of New Guinea, where the population grows larger every day. Currently, he is studying for a post-graduate degree at the University URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. His dream is to continue studying, be in good health, have a beautiful home in the future and have job stability so that he can support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.
