El Sr. Julio César está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como lo es la Construcción de los servicios Higienicos, trabaja como Análista de crédito en un banco de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años, Julio César tiene 3 hijos, la mayor de 18 años estudia 2do año en la Universidad, la otra de 13 años estudia 6to grado de Educación primaria y la niña menor de 11 años estudia su 5to grado, su esposa trabaja como contadora, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. Don Julio es un hombre profesional responsable, honesto, trabajador, vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, actualmente está estudiando un postgrado en la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando, contar con buenasalud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Build bathrooms.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is requesting a loan in order to invest in improvements for her house (finish construction of the kitchen). She has worked as a teacher at the Ruben Dario School for ten years. She has a six-year-old daughter who is in the second grade at elementary school. She is a single mother: Her daughter's father pays some child support. Maria Auxiliadora is known for her honesty and she is very hard working. Currently, she is in her fifth year of studying for a Psychology degree at the Martin Lutero University. She lives in a neighborhood in the urban area of the town of New Guinea that is starting to be populated. Her dream is to finish construction on her house and enjoy the better conditions, provide an education to her daughter so that she needs for nothing, and have job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La clienta María Auxiliadora está solicitando refinanciamiento de su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de construir la cocina de la casa ), trabaja como docente en la Escuela Rubén Darío desde hace 10 años, tiene una hija de 6 años de edad la cual esta estudiando su 2do grado de Educación Primaria, es madre soltera, el papá de su hija le pasa una pensión alimenticia, María Auxiliadora se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando su quinto año de la carrera de Psicología en la Universidad Martin Lutero,ella vive en un barrio de la zona urbana que se está iniciando a poblar del municipio de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, darle estudios a su hija y que no le falte nada, tener estabilidad laboral

loans.use: Finish construction on her home's kitchen.

loans.name: José Virgilio

texts.es: El cliente José Virgilio está solicitando  su 4to  refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la Escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 10 años, este cliente tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de  18 años de edad estudia su 5to año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 15 años estudia su 3er año de Educación secundaria,  este cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesto, trabajador: Su esposa es comerciante, viaja a las colonias del Municipio de Nueva Guinea,  ambos comparten con los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia pobre pero unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, viven en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que estos van adquiriendo con AFODENIC, también desea estabilidad laboral y salud para su familia
texts.en:
José Virgilio is soliciting his fourth loan so as to invest in the improvement (construction) of his house. He has been working for ten years as a teacher in the César Augusto Salinas Pinell School. José has two children. The oldest child is 18 years old and is in his fifth year of secondary education. His daughter is 15 years old and is in her third year of secondary education. José is a responsible and honest worker. His wife is a retailer who travels to the Nueva Guinea municipality. Despite being a poor family, they are nonetheless united and thus divide the household costs. They intend on repaying the loan within two years. In the meantime, he intends on improving his home. His family lives in a neighborhood whose population is growing every day. His dream is to improve his home with every loan solicited from AFODENIC. For his future, he wants to maintain a stable job and provide a healthy lifestyle for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his home

loans.name: Donilda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Donilda is requesting her sixth loan to invest it in improving her house by laying tile in her home. This client has worked as a teacher in the Rubén Darío school in zone #5 in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea for 15 years. Currently she is studying in the URACCAN University in Nueva Guinea. She is known for being humble, responsible, honest, and having many dreams of improving herself. She has 5 children, 3 adults and 2 minors: a 13-year-old boy who is in his first year of secondary school and an 11-year-old girl who is in fifth grade. Her husband works as a brick layer. Both of them share the family expenses. Her dream is to have a stable job, a nice house, and to have her children study so they can be worthy people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La clienta Donilda está solicitando su sexto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es ponerle la ceramica a la casa, esta cliente labora como docente de la Escuela Rubén Darío en zona # 5 de zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea desde hace 15 años, actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea; se caracteriza por ser humilde, responsable, honesta y con muncho deseos de superación personal, tiene 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 2 que estan están en su custodia, el niño tiene 13 años estudia su primer año de educación secundaria y la niña de 11 años estudia su quinto grado, su esposo labora como albañil, viven en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, en un barrio creciente, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda bonita y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de bien.

loans.use: To tile the floor in her home

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Young Deyanira is requesting her sixth loan in order to invest in improving her home (repairs). She has worked as a Loan Supervisor for two years. She does not have children but she helps her parents with their expenses. Her husband works in loan sales, and they both contribute to their housing expenses. They live in the urban zone of New Guinea in the Linda Vista neighborhood. This neighborhood was recently populated and each day, the population grows. Deyanira is a professional woman with aspirations of getting ahead both personally and professionally. She is responsible and loves her job. Her dream is to study next year, have stability, health and a beautiful house in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La Joven Deyanira está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( Repellar la vivienda), trabaja como Supervisora de Crédito desde hace 2 años, no tiene hijos pero ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como promotor de crédito, ambos asumen con los gastos del hogar, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en el Barrio Linda Vista este barrio recientemente se pobló y cada día se va aumentando su población, Deyanira es una mujer profesional con alto espiritu de superación personal y laboral, responsable, que ama su trabajo, su sueño es estudiar el proximo año una maestría, tener estabilidad, salud y una vivienda bonita para así pasarse a vivir en su nueva casa.

loans.use: Repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Damaris Nohemí

texts.es:
Young Damaris is requesting her second loan in order to invest in the improvement of her house (building a hygenic bathroom). She works as a teacher at the Buen Maestro School. Damaris does not have children but she helps her husband take care of his elderly parents by contributing to the family bills. Her husband is a taxi driver. Both help with the family expenses. Damaris is a young woman with aspirations of getting ahead. She is very responsible and she is a teacher who loves her job since she's able to help many children learn to read and write from San Juan, 4km from New Guinea. Her dream is to get her Science Education Certificate, have job stability, health and a house with better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La Joven Damaris está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de un servicio higienico), trabaja como docente de la Escuela El Buen Maestro, esta clienta no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su esposo a cuidar a sus ancianos padres con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista, ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la familia, Damaris es una joven con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños a aprender a leer y escribir de la colonia San Juan a 4 km de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es terminar de estudiar la Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y una vivienda con mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Construction of a hygenic bathroom.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.es:
Sylvia would like to put up protection around her home as a year ago there was an attempted break-in. As the thief couldn't get in he went next door to where Sylvia's parents were asleep and so took many valuables. This is why she would like to be more secure.

Her husband, Jesus Barraza, works as a solderer. He himself is going to put up protection and the loan is to buy the material needed (as they do not need to hire anyone as he can do it all himself). She would like $500.

Portion translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Sylvia M. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances. Sylvia desea poner protecciones en su casa por que dice que hace un año intentaron robar en su domicilio. El ladrón al no poder abrir, se paso a la casa de un lado con los padres de Sylvia que se encontraban dormidos y así provecho y robo cosas de valor. Es por eso que ella prefiere estar más segura.

El Señor Jesús Barraza es esposo de la señora M., el trabaja como empleado de soldadura. El mismo va a fabricar las protecciones, el préstamo es para comprar solamente el material el comenta que ya no es necesario contratar a alguien si el mismo lo puede hacer. Ella solicita $500 dólares.

loans.use: To put up protection/PONER PROTECCIONES

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Adilia lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is 34 and has four beautiful children who are 8, 10, 13, and 15. She is married to her husband, who works as a mechanic and is devoted to their family. The younger children are studying in primary school, and the 15-year-old is in secondary school. Their grandmother takes care of them because Señora Adilia works as a cook at a cafeteria. She is requesting the loan to start selling food in her home since she already has some capital saved so she can have more income with her own sales since she has a lot of knowledge of cooking. Her dream is that with this credit, she will be able to establish her business and be supported by it so that some day this business will start to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Adilia habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 34 años de edad, con cuatro hermosos hijos de 8, 10,13 y 15 años de edad, es casada su esposo trabaja de mecánico, y esta pendiente de su familia, los niños están estudiando en la primaria y el de quince años esta en la secundaria, a ellos los cuida la abuelita por que la Sra. Adilia trabaja de cocinera en un comedor. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para poner venta de comida en su hogar ya que tiene un capital ahorrado, para así poder tener más ingresos con las ventas propias ya que tiene todo el conocimiento en la cocina. Su sueño es que con este crédito pueda establecer su negocio y así poder empezar a vivir de él y que algún día este negocio pueda empezar a crecer.

loans.use: To start a small business of food sales

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: This the second time Mrs. Ouch S. is requesting a loan to improve her business. She sells vegetables in the local market located in Phsar Leur Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Ouch S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and she has fully paid it back. Because her business is prospering, Mrs. Ouch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to better satisfy her customers. Her husband, Mr. Um Sarom, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns some money to help support the family. Mrs. Ouch S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to reach her customers

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time for Mrs. Phann S. to ask for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a fruit seller and farmer in Kork Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  On her plantation, Mrs. Phann S. now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Phann S. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is a fruit seller. Previously, Mrs. Phann S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen in order to plow the field to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: This is the third loan Mrs. Hem S. has sought improve her business. She is a vegetable seller in the local market located in Kork Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Hem S. had obtained loans from AMK to start her current business, which she succeeded in paying off. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Hem S. decided to ask for a loan again to buy more vegetables to better meet her customers' demands. Her husband, Mr. Yath Saorin, is a construction worker who earns a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Hem S. has two small children who are both too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to meet customer demand

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan M. is a mother of two little kids and works with her husband growing various kinds of crops such as rice and vegetables. She and her husband can collectively make about 4.50 per day from selling their outputs to the brokers as well as to the people at a market. In order to make their farming work much better and do more faster, this couple would love to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a pair of cows.  They plan for the cows to help them by plowing their rice field and carrying heavy items for their farming activity. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Yan M. was not available).

loans.use: To purchase two cows to work on her rice field

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: This is the third loan that Mrs. Kong K. S. has sought in order to improve her business. She is a fishmonger in Dork Pon Village in Kampong Chhnan Province. Previously, Mrs. Kong K. S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business and has since paid it back in full. Because her business is prospering, she is asking for a loan purchase more fish for her custopmers. Her husband, Mr. Hor Phorn, helps her with the business. Mrs. Kong K. S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Him

texts.en: This is the second time Mr. Him Y. has applied for a loan to improve his business. He owns a small cart with which he transports coconuts to sell door-to-door. Since his business is doing well, Mr. Him Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more coconuts to resell. Mr. Him Y. is 38 years old and married to Mrs. Vann Nan, who owns a small grocery store in the local village; they have no children. Previously, Mr. Him Y. had obtained a loan from AMK to start his wife's business, which he has fully paid back.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for resale

loans.name: Kdan

texts.en: Mrs. Kdan H. is a villager in Kork Penh Village in Kampong Chhang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Veth Sath, are farmers. They have seven children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending school. In Mrs. Kdan H.'s plantation, she now faces a problem because her rice field has grown infertile so she has decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. In addition, Mrs. Kdan H. would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to control the insect population in order to produce a better crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase the farm's yield

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: This loan would be the second taken by Mrs. Duong K. to improve her living conditions. She and her husband, Mr. So Meun, are farmers in Chy Prong Village in Kampong Chhnang. On their farm, they cultivate twice a year. During the rainy season they cultivate rice, while they grow vegetables in dry season. They have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker; a third helps the parents on the field while the remaining three are attending school. Although the family members work hard, they still cannot afford to build a new house. Thus, Mrs. Duong K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To save for a new house for her family

loans.name: Kdan

texts.en: Mrs. Kdan H. lives in Kork Penh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store with which makes a meager living. Her husband, Mr. Lim Mon, is a rice farmer. His farm does not have enough animals to plow the field so his wife is seeking a loan to buy one more buffalo to plow the field alongside the old one. Mrs. Kdan H. is 53 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to plow the field

loans.name: Zarafo

texts.en:
Zarafo Z. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of three beautiful girls, aged seventeen, fourteen, and ten. Six months ago, she started a little business with the purpose of tending to her girls' needs. Her daughter’s father currently doesn’t live with them. Because of difficult living conditions, he moved to Russia two years ago to increase his earning potential.

Zarafo is now selling clothing for schoolgirls and schoolboys. She began the business with a very small amount of merchandise. Now, however, she wants to increase her inventory as her orders and sales have increased with the school season. To keep up with demand, Zarafo needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD). She promises to repay the loan within six months. The requested loan will positively help this woman achieve her goals and help fund her children’s educations.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to increase her merchandise inventory.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak S. sells chickens in the local market which is located in Trapaing Chhum Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Koem Un, is a firewood seller and pig breeder. Since Mr. Koem Un's firewood selling business is going well, he wants to sell it door-to-door.  Thus, Mrs. Prak S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport  firewood to sell door-to-door. Mrs. Prak S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, two of who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport firewood to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en: Mrs. Pek M. is a farmer in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. On her plantation, she faces a problem: she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more ox to plow the field with the old one. Her husband, Mr. Chhit Sophea, is a firewood seller who earns a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Pek M. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: This is the second time of Mrs. Vorng N. has sought a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Korng Hun, uses a motorbike to transport coal to sell door-to-door. Although Mrs. Vorng N. and her husband have different businesses, they have had difficulty improving their standard of living. Thus, Mrs. Vorng N. has decided to seek a loan to buy two cows for starting a cow-breeding business. Mrs. Vorng N. is 37 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or attending school. Previously, Mrs. Vorng N. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart for her husband's business, which she has fully paid back.

loans.use: To buy two cows to start a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: This is the second time Mr. Sao S. has sought a loan to improve his standard of living. He is a firewood seller in the village of Thlork Roling in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Horl Naom, is a farmer. On her farm, she does not have enough oxen to plow the rice field, so her husband is seeking a loan to buy one more ox to plow the field with the old one. Mr. Sao S. is 33 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to help plow the field

loans.name: Siti Murtafiah

texts.id: Siti Murtafiah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang ulet. Setiap hari Siti Murtafiah giat menjalankan usahanya membuat kue. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 500.000.- ia memulai usaha ini. Awalnya Siti Murtafiah hanya membuat kue donat dan roti kukus saja, kue tersebut dititipkan pada warung-warung terdekat. Dengan modal sedikit tentu saja keuntungan yang diperoleh sedikit dan itu hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Siti Murtafiah mempunyai 3 orang anak yang perlu biaya untuk pendidikannya, sedangkan suaminya hanyalah seorang pedagang sayuran keliling yang kini penghasilannya sangat kecil karena situasinya sangat sepi. Untungnya ada Yayasan Dinari yang memberi tambahan pinjaman modal. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membeli bahan-bahan seperti tepung, gula, telor dan keperluan pembuatan kue lainya sehingga Siti Murtafiah dapat tetap menjalankan usahanya. Bahkan kini Siti Murtafiah dapat melayani lebih banyak pelanggan, juga suaminya yang kebetulan juga berjualan keliling sehingga bisa menjual kue buatan Siti. Sekarang kue yang dibuat Siti Murtafiah bukan hanya satu jenis saja, tetapi bisa berbagai jenis dan juga melayani pesanan sesuai permintaan pelanggan sehingga keuntungan yang didapat menjadi lebih banyak. Dari keuntungan itu Siti Murtafiah dapat menyekolahkan anaknya dan juga memenuhi kebutuhan setiap hari,dan apabila ada sisa barulah kemudian ditabung
texts.en:
Siti Murtafiah is a diligent house wife. She has a cookies making business. She started this business with IDR 500 thousand (around USD 60). At the beginning, she only made donut and cup cakes. She put these cookies in the nearby food stalls. She only made small margin of profit from this business as she did not have enough capital.

She has 3 children who are in school. Her husband sells vegetables in the market. Dinari foundation gave her loan to add her working capital so she can buy more ingredients such as flour, eggs, sugars etc. She makes more than 2 kind of cookies now and her business is growing. She hopes with the increasing profit she can send her children to higher level of education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies ingredients (Membeli bahan baku pembuatan kue)

loans.name: Kasiati

texts.id: Kasiati mempunyai usaha sebagai Pedagang es batu  yang sudah ditekuni selama 3 tahun. Suaminya  sebagai seorang sopir. Kasiati harus berusaha agar bisa membantu pendapatan rumah tangga ,mengingat 4 orang anaknya membutuhkan biaya untuk sekolah. Dengan modal awal sebesar 2 juta rupiah Kasiati membeli sebuah lemari es untuk membuat es batu. Namun satu buah lemari es tidak bisa memenuhi kebutuhan pelanggan yang kini mulai meningkat. Langganan pembelinya adalah warung yang menjual minuman ringan dan pedagang ikan supaya ikannya tidak membusuk. Dengan satu lemari es tentu saja keuntungan yang didapat juga sedikit, karena satu bungkus es dalam plastik usuran 1 kilogram dijual seharga Rp.700. Keuntungan ini dipakai cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Karena kebutuhan akan es batu terus meningkat maka Kasiati mengajukan pinjaman modal ke Yayasan Dinari. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk menambah lemari es, sehingga kini Kasiati sudah memiliki 3 lemari es. Dengan tambahan peralatan tersebut diharapkan penghasilan serta keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat sehingga Kasiati bisa melanjutkan sekolah anak-anaknya ketingkat yang lebih tinggi lagi,dan Kasiati sangat berterimakasi kepada Yayasan Dinari karena sudah membantu dalam permodalan.
texts.en:
Kasiati sells ice cube/ ice block. She has been in this business for 3 years. Her husband is a driver. She has this business to help the family's economic condition as they have 4 school age children.

With the start up capital of IDR 2 million (around USD 220), she bought a refrigerator to make ice cubes. Her customers are nearby soda or soft drinks vendors and also the fish sellers. She sells 1 kg of ice cube for IDR 700 (around 10 US Cent).

However one refrigerator is not enough now as her customers are growing. Therefore she applied loan to Dinari foundation to enable her to buy more refrigerator. She now has 3 refrigerators. She hopes that this can help her expanding her business. She hopes she can send her children to higher level of education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy refrigerator (Membeli lemari es)

loans.name: Mbabazande, Luwayo Group

texts.en: Mariam M. was a farmer, while still with her husband, before she joined the retail shop business a year ago. She is now divorced and because she was sent away from her marital home, she had no land to farm anymore and hence opened up a shop. This is her first time with the group, and she is determined to make ends meet since she has been taught every skill concerning lending and loan repayments. She has 7 children, but their father is paying for 4 of them while she still cares for 3 primary school-going children. She has been able to include almost all that is needed in her shop, only in small quantities, and would like to increase the quantity of sugar, maize flour, and soap, plus a few other commodities. She has no dream of changing her business right now but only of making it better.

loans.use: Mariam would like to increase the quantity of sugar, maize flour, and soap, plus a few other commodities.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Ёкубова Раъно девушка в возросте 26 лет замужем. Имеет высшее образование , после окончания университета она уже 3 года как работает кассиром в сотовой компании "Мобильные линии Таджикистана ". Раьно живёт в трёх комнатной квартире, со старым ремонтом. Она уже давно планирует провести капитальный ремонт своей квартиры. Но никак не может накопить денег для этого.Узнав что в Микроинвесте можно получить кредит для потребительских нужд, Раъно решила обратится для получения займа. Она вполне сможет погасить кредит из своей заработной платы. Раъно благодарна инвесторам КIVA ,за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Rano Y. is 26 years old and married. She has a bachelor's degree. After graduating from the university, she started working as a cashier at a telecommunications company "Mobile lines of Tajikistan," where she has been working for the past 3 years. Rano lives in an old apartment that had not been remodeled for a long time. She had already planned a major remodeling a while ago, but she couldn't save enough money to start. When Rano found out that she could obtain a loan from Microinvest for personal use, she decided to take advantage of those services. She is confident she can pay off the loan using her salary. Rano is very greatful to Kiva loaners for support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel an apartment

loans.name: Botur

texts.en:
Botur Y. is 30 years old and married with three children. Botur has been providing taxi services as a business for about five years. This business is the main source of income for his family. A hard worker, Botur gets up early and goes to bed late in an effort not to lose any clients. While he has no higher education, he dreams of being able to provide one for his children. His children are very talented and clever, and they are asking their father to buy them a computer.

In order to better provide for his family, Botur plans to fix his car and provide higher quality taxi services in the future and thus earn more money. Botur is requesting $600 USD that he plans to repay in twelve months. With the money, he will purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of his family is in your hands. If you help them by contributing to the growth of Botur’s business, they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for his car to improve his taxi business

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.en:
Sharafniso S. is 48 year old widow with three children. Sharafniso has almost never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead. For fifteen years she has worked as a baker, making the national Tajik bread, “lepeshka”. Sharafniso works hard to earn an honest livelihood. She gets up early and bakes lepeshka so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. Initially Sharafniso only baked the bread and was not involved in selling it. Gradually, however, the business expanded as her children grew up. Today the bakery is a family business where Sharafniso’s children help her. Sharafniso sells her bread in the local market place where she has many clients. These sales allow her to improve her family’s income.

Today Sharafniso requests 3400 Somoni (1,000 USD) in order to purchase flour and firewood for baking lepeshka. She assures lenders that she will be ready to repay the loan in twelve months and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her. The well-being of her family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing of flour and firewood to bake national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that Ahmad has truly taken to heart. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his two children, for whom he cares with much love. He does this in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. Ahmad works in farming and also has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables depending on the growing season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping care for their cows, and she also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children.

Ahmad and his wife would also like to open a small business some day; until then, they will continue working in their fields. To improve their farming and save money for this future endeavor, Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD, that he plans to repay in ten months, to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Let’s support Ahmad in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon S. is a 47 year old fisherman. He fishes at Tunle Sap Lake, earning about US$3.00 per day. His wife, Mrs. Y Seat is 50, and is a farmer, earning about US$1.60 per day. Phon has four children, one of whom is married. They live in Anglung Samnor Commune, Siem Reap Province. Phon is seeking a loan of US$375 to buy fishing equipment. The loan will improve his fishing business and increase their family's income. Phon's wife is pictured because Phon was unavailable.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Jina's Asaa Kheri Group

texts.en:
Jina is 33 years old and is married with 5 children ages 13, 9, 7, 5 and 2. She has been selling charcoal and firewood since 2003. She works from 7am to 6pm everyday of the week and earns a monthly profit of about $30.

Jina has previously taken out 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to start her business and has successfully repaid them both. Jina now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with fish and bites sales, clothing sales, tailoring, firewood and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mr. Hak S., 48, fishes at Tunle Sap Lake, earning about US$2.50 per day. His wife, Mrs. Luy Sheav, is 38 and sells groceries, earning about US$1.25 per day. Mr. Hak has four children, all of whom are living in the family's home and two help Mr. Hak with his fishing. They live in Koktlok Kram Commune, Siem Reap Province. 

To increase the family's income, Mr. Hak is seeking a loan to purchase a battery-charge machine. He will provide this service in his village, and he believes that his new investment will improve his family's financial stability. Mr. Hak's wife is pictured feeding her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a battery-charge machine

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is 50 years old. She is a widow with 3 children aged 10, 19, and 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to open a new business. Amina is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, firewood sales, bites sales, and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business

loans.name: Abdul Bashir

texts.en:
A. Bashir is married. He lives in a household of 8 members, and he has a shoe shop, a business that he started in Pakistan 8 years ago. After the collapse of the Taliban, he came back to Afghanistan and now he is continuing his business in Kabul. He wants to enlarge his shoe shop.

So he wants to take out an individual loan to buy new designs of shoes and complete his stock to make his business in Afghanistan strong so as to help his family here better.

Bashir is very happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan. People can use this kind of opportunity to make their lives better and expand their businesses. A. Bashir wants to open more shops in the future. He would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy new styles of shoes

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: This is the second time of Mrs. Sin S. has sought a loan to improve her business. She is a farmer and pig breeder in Taing Trapaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She now faces a problem: she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sin S. is seeking a loan to buy one more buffalo to plow alongside the old one. Her husband, Mr. Arn Noeurn, is a firewood seller whose small income supplements hers. Mrs. Sin S. is 48 and the mother of six children, two of whom are farmers while two help out with their father's business; the remaining two are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sin S. had obtained a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field; she has fully paid back the loan. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: Mr. Heam M. is a villager in Angk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Khoem Sokha, is a pig breeder. Since her pigs have grown, she does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed them. Thus, her husband is seeking a loan to buy more pig feed. Mr. Heam M. is 21 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed to keep the pigs healthy

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday O. is into the sale of electronics. He is 39 years old. He is married with 4 children. He lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells electronics like television sets, VCD machines, radios, and cassette players. He has been in this business for the past 12 years. He is also a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more electronics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Niazllah

texts.en:
Niazllah is a young and uneducated man. He works in agriculture. He did not manage to obtain an education because of economic reasons. He has the responsibility for his hifamily. His father is dead and he has a small sister and brother. His mother is a home-maker, so she is not able to help with their family expenses. Therefore Niaz is the only bread-winner for the family.

He needs a loan. It is very necessary for Niazllah because he is unable to plant all his land, so he needs a lot of money to further his business and keep his family going. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy more seeds and complete his stock to cultivate all his land.

Niazllah is happy. He would like to thank both AFSG and Kiva for making this process of small loans possible in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership and he wishes to contribute other workers in agriculture in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and complete his stock

loans.name: Mo

texts.en:
Mr. Mo R., 40, and his wife Mrs. Loeung Kounn  are are both farmers who live in Spean Tnot Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Loeung also raises pigs. They have eight children, three of whom work on plowing machines earning US$1.80 combined per day. The others are students.

Because their rice crop provides the main income for the family, he is seeking a loan of US$625 to plow more farmland and purchase fertilizer and pesticide. The loan will allow him to expand his farming business. Mr. Mo hopes the loan can increase the family's income. Mrs. Loeung, Mo's wife, is in the picture because Mo is unavailable.

loans.use: To plow more farmland and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N. is a vegetable farmer in Kraing Khmer Village in Kanpong Chhnang Province. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pigs have grown so much, she is having trouble buying pig feed. Therefore, Mrs. Bun N. is seeking a loan to purchase pig feed, using a portion of it to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Bun N. is a 53-year-old widow with a child who has emigrated to work as a housewife in Malaysia and usually sends money once a month.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn U. is 30-year-old widow with no children. She is a farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from farming, she sells desserts in the local market to supplement her income. On her farm, Mrs. Moeurn U. faces a small problem because she does not have the oxen to plow the rice fields for cultivation, so she needs to hire a labourer with oxen to plow her field. Unfortunately, Mrs. Moeurn U. does not have enough money to do this. Thus, she is seeking a loan to help her get her fields cultivated.

loans.use: To hire a labourer with oxen to plow her rice fields

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca U. sells baby items, like baby cream, flasks, dresses, etc. She is 32 years old, and she is married with 6 children. She lives in Uromi Town, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1998. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more baby things for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Pach

texts.en: This is the second time that Mr. Pach L. has requested a loan to improve his living conditions. He is a construction worker and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Tuon Kunthea, is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. Unfortunately, she now cannot cultivate rice because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, her husband is seeking a loan to buy two oxen to plow the field for cultivating rice. Mr. Pach L. is 34 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Pach L. had obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding. He has paid back that loan in full.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow the rice fields

loans.name: Haem

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Haem H. is asking for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. On her plantation, she usually gets only a meager revenue because she owns a small piece of land. Thus, Mrs. Haem H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy another piece of land in order to expand her rice revenue. 

Mrs. Haem H. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Heng Nak, owns a small kiln where he can make charcoal to sell in order to support their family. Mrs. Haem H. is 22 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Haem H. obtained a loan to buy household equipment (plates, spoons, baskets, etc.) She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: to buy another piece of land to farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 64 years old. She is married with 6 children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. Rose sells clothes, and also she is a tailor and a hair stylist. She has been in this business for the past 25 years. She is also a LAPO client  and needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Mao M. has asked for a loan to improve her business. She is a farmer in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business, she has pig breeding business. Mrs. Mao M. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets and she has fully paid it back. 

Since her pigs now grow bigger and bigger, Mrs. Mao M. does not have enough money to buy a pig food So she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy two piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Haem Pheap, owns a small coal kiln where he can make coal to sell to support his family. Mrs. Mao M. is 33 and the mother of six children, three of whom are attending school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiev S. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Toy, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. These family members have only two business activities which can make only a small income and cannot improve their lives.

In order to improve Mrs. Khiev S.'s family's living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Khiev S. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Mrs. Muth Y. is a farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Krib Song, is a house constructor and pig breeder. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

Although these family members have different business activities, they still cannot improve their living conditions so Mrs. Muth Y. has decided to ask for a loan to start a cow breeding business. She hopes to improve her life with this loan. Previously, Mrs. Muth Y. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: to start a cow-breeding business in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph I. is 63 years old and married with 14 children. He lives in Uromi Town, Edo State, Nigeria. He farms and has a cassava mill. He learned the skill of farming from his father. He has been in the farming business for 10 years. He  needs the loan amount of $875 to start selling drinks when he doesn't go farm.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale and also for farming purposes

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeurn K., 24, is a villager in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, she cultivates rice while she grows vegetable in the dry season.

On her plantation, Mrs. Hoeurn K. now does not have animals to plow; thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow the rice field for cultivation. Her husband, Mr. Hael Pheun, owns a small kiln where he can make charcoal to sell in order to assist his wife in paying the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two oxen to plow the rice field for cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 50 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fruit in her community. She has been in this business since 2001. She needs the loan of $550 to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich N. is a farmer in Trapaing Tonlorp Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Meth Ra, is a poultry and pig breeder. Since his pigs grow bigger and bigger, Mr. Meth Ra does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed them. So his wife, Mrs. Pich N., decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. Pich N. is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are all too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Sang S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Teng Channy, is a cow and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other one is too young to work or study. 

Although Mrs. Sang S. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve Mrs. Sang S.'s standard of living, she decided to ask for a loan to build a new house for her household. Previously, Mrs. Sang S. had obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.,

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is 50 years old, and she is married with 10 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business of selling palm oil and groundnut oil since 1995. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years. She needs the loan amount of $550 to buy more palm oil and groundnut oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more groundnut and palm oil for sale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Meas R. has taken out a loan in order to improve her business. She is a pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Meas R. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, and she has fully paid back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Meas R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Heng Thorn, is a farmer and a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine in the local village. Mrs. Meas R. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Menyikwa Jua-Kali Group

texts.en:
Wilfred is a leader and member of Menyikwa Jua Kali Self-Help Group. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and is married with two young children. Wilfred enjoys working for himself and appreciates that he doesn't have to carry stock for his business like others in his group do. He says that he makes around 600-1000 schillings per day ($9-15). His expenses include licenses, fuel, oil, and general maintenance. Wilfred is grateful for the fact that his loans have enabled him to own his home, buy food, and save for his children's future school fees.

With this loan Wilfred hopes to purchase an additional motorbike and employ a driver on commission. Eventually, he would like to have a fleet of vehicles under his ownership. Since the area of Kisii is rugged and contoured, the town has a high demand for small transportation vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase another motobike and expand taxi services

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N. is a farmer and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Mao Lim, is a construction worker. They have four children, two of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Currently, the youngest child has cancer, which costs around $1000 to cure. Unfortunately, Mrs. Mao N. does not have enough money to afford the price above, so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to cure her child.

loans.use: To cure her child of cancer

loans.name: Luz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luz Elizabeth P., only 25 years old, lives in Lourdes Colon. She has a small son that she supports and raises on her own, since she has been a single mother for the past six years. Despite filling the role of both mother and father, Luz Elizabeth has always looked ahead and expressed her entrepreneurial spirit by opening a small bakery with her mother two years ago. The bakery represents her only means of income, and the vehicle through which she helps her family financially as she lives with her parents and two brothers. With a strong desire to get ahead, Luz is soliciting a loan to invest into her business. The loan will help her buy an industrial oven and prime ingredients to allow her to grow economically and provide a better future for her family and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Elizabeth P. vive en Lourdes Colon, con tan solo 25 años de edad, Luz tiene ya un hijo pequeño, a quien cría y mantiene como madre soltera desde hace ya seis años. A pesar de ser tanto padre y madre de familia, Luz Elizabeth ha mirado siempre hacia el frente, y denotando emprendedurismo abrió junto a su madre una panadería propia hace ya 2años. La panadería constituye su única fuente de ingresos, y el medio mediante el cual ella ayuda a su familia, pues vive con sus padres y dos hermanos. Con un vivido anhelo de superación, Luz solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, y así comprar un horno industrial y materia prima que le permita crecer económicamente y proveer un mejor futuro para su familia e hijo.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven and prime ingredients.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en: Fedelia U. is 35 years old, and she is married with 7 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, coolers, and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more clothes for sale. She expresses her gratitude to all.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoung V. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Prok Chan, is a cow breeder. They have three children, two of whom are attending school while the third is too young to work or study.

Even though Mrs. Phoung V. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Phoung V. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house for her household.

loans.use: to build a new house for her household in order to improve their living conditions

loans.name: José Fredy

texts.es:
José Fredy G. lives in Lourdes Colon, in the department of La Libertad.  For a number of years now his dream has been to become a doctor, a vision that he has pursued since he was very young.  To reach his goal, José Fredy opened a beauty salon 18 years ago as a means to generate income.  The business has helped him to finance his education and pay for his basic living expenses.  After years of sacrifice, José graduated with his degree in nursing which constituted the first step in reaching his vocational goal.  José Fredy has maintained his salon with much perseverance and effort, and he is now studying medicine at the University of El Salvador.  To make his dream – and vocation – a reality, Fredy is soliciting a loan to invest into his business.  He would like to purchase a shampoo station table and various supplies (such as hair dyes, combs, gels, etc.).  These items will help his business and, in turn, mitigate the high cost of his chosen profession so he can get one step closer to the white doctor’s coat he so yearns for. 

 Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer. 

José Fredy G. vive en Lourdes Colon, en el departamento de La Libertad, desde hace ya varios años, su sueño ha sido convertirse en medico, sueño que ha perseguido desde muy joven.  Para alcanzarlo, José Fredy abrió hace 18 años un negocio de estilismo profesional en cabello, como vehículo que le generase  ingresos, y que  le ha servido para costear sus estudios, además de cubrir sus gastos de vida.
Tras años de sacrificio, José se graduó como Lic. En Enfermería, lo que constituyo el primer paso en su visión vocacional. Acompañado de perseverancia y esfuerzo, José Fredy ha mantenido su negocio de estilismo y estudia ahora Medicina en la Universidad de El Salvador. Para completar su sueño y vocación, Fredy solicita un préstamo para re-invertir en su negocio, comprando un mueble de lavado de pelo, e insumos (tintes, peines, gelatinas, etc), que le permitan costear los altos gastos de su carrera y dar un paso más, hacia su ansiada bata blanca.

loans.use: Purchase of a shampoo station table and various supplies (hair dyes, combs, gels, etc.)

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
This is the second time Mr. Saem C. is asking for a loan to improve his business. He is a construction worker and pig breeder in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.

Previously, Mr. Saem C. obtained a loan to start his pig breeding business and he has fully paid it back. Since his business is going well, Mr. Saem C. wants to expand it so he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

His wife, Mrs. Um Sean, owns a small rice field for cultivating rice and vegetables. Mr. Saem C. is 43 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Asha's Jiimarishe Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 2, 3 and 4. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 6 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asha now seeks a loan to buy charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sikudhani.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Radhia

texts.en:
Radhia is 25 years old and is married with a 1 year old child. She has been selling perfumes, domestic utensils and clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 10am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Radhia has previously taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business and has repaid it in full. Radhia now requests a loan to buy more items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Shean

texts.en:
Mrs. Shean U., 46 years old and widowed, sells groceries. She has been selling groceries along Tonle Sap Lake since 2000 and earns around US$3.33 per day. Her business depends on Tonle Sap Lake. She has two children, one of whom is married. Ms. Chenglean Phon, her eldest daughter, is 23 years old and raises pigs, earning about US$2.50 per day. Together they live in Anlong Somor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Shean is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase groceries and pig food. The loan will generate more profit and help to better sustain her family. Her daughter, Ms. Chenglean, is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and pig food

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris O. is 42 years old, and he is married with 4 children. He lives in Uromi Town, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the ice cream and drink selling business for the past 9 years. He also sews clothes and renders laundry services. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Sri Handayani

texts.id: Pinjaman kali ini sudah merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Sri Handayani (39). Pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar Rp.700.000 sudah dipakai sebagai modal usaha. Pada pinjaman kali ini Sri ingin menambah jumlah pinjaman menjadi Rp.1.000.000, dan akan dipergunakan untuk menambah omzet penjualannya. Usaha warung makanan yang dijalaninya saat ini menjual nasi goring, cap tjai dan makanan laut. Sekarang ini klien juga menambah dengan jualan pisang goring dan tahu goreng. Pada pagi hari Sri handayani menjual nasi kuning. Usaha yang dilakukan klien ini cukup berhasil dan dia berharap bisa terus mengembangkan usahanya dengan bantuan modal usaha dari KIVA dan DINARI. Saat ini Sri Handayani masih tinggal di Sidakarya Denpasar bersama suaminya Made Lubis dan anak tunggalnya Melly (9).
texts.en:
This is 39-year old Sri Handayani's second loan. Her previous loan of Rp.700.000 (US$ 75) was used as working capital for her business. Sri wishes to borrow Rp.1.000.000 (US$ 108) this time around, intending to use it to increase sales turnover. At present, the food stall that she runs sells fried rice, sauteed vegetables and seafood. Now, since the addition of fried bananas and fried tofu to her menu, she is seeing an increase in customers. In the early morning Sri Handayani sells yellow rice. Her business is reasonably successful and she hopes it can continue growing with the help of a loan from KIVA via DINARI. At this time Sri Handayani still lives in Sidakarya Denpasar with her husband Made Lubis and her only child, 9-year old Melly.

Translated from Indonesian by Aarati Sivasubramanian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nanik

texts.id: Pinjaman kali ini sudah merupakan pinjaman kedua bagi Nanik (53). Usaha yang telah dijalaninya cukup mengalami peningkatan sampai saat ini. Kali ini dia mengajukan pinjaman lebih besar dari sebelumnya, karena pembayaran sebelumnya berjalan dengan baik. Kalau sebelumnya dia meminjam Rp.700.000, kali ini dia berharap diberi pinjaman Rp.1.000.000. Keuntungan yang didapat dari usahanya sekarang bisa mencapai Rp. 100.000 perhari dipotong biaya untuk belanja dan makan, dia bisa mendapatkan laba bersih sekitar Rp.50.000 per hari. Rencananya pinjaman kedua ini akan dipakai untuk menambah isi warung jamu dan obat kuat, selain juga untuk menambah jumlah menu dan makanan diwarungnya. Saat ini, Nanik masih tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Suwung Denpasar.
texts.en:
This will be 53-year old Nanik's second loan. Her business is experiencing reasonable growth up to this point. This time she has applied for a larger loan than her first, because she was able to manage those repayments comfortably. Where she borrowed Rp.700.000 (approx. US $75) last time, this time she hopes to borrow Rp.1.000.000 (US$ 108). The earnings from her business now often reach up to Rp.100.000 (nearly US$11) a day, and after she accounts for shopping and meals, her net proceeds are around Rp.50.000 (US $5) a day. The plan for this second loan is to increase the selection of traditional medicines she carries in the stall, and also to offer more varieties of eatables on her menu. At this time, Nanik still lives on a street called Jl. Mertasari Suwung Denpasar.

Translated from Indonesian by Aarati Sivasubramanian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Hari

texts.id: Setelah melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama, Hari P. (34) bermaksud untuk meminjam lagi ke KIVA melalui DINARI dengan nilai yang lebih besar. Pembayaran untuk pinjaman pertama berjalan lancar, dengan didukung oleh usahanya yang juga cukup berhasil. Usaha furniture yang dijalaninya memiliki banyak peminat, dan terus berkembang. Lemari, kitchen set dan perabotan rumah tangga merupakan contoh barang yang dibuatnya. Dengan dibantu oleh empat orang tenaga kerja, dengan gajian perhari maupun perminggu. Hari P. sangat berterimakasih untuk pinjaman sebelumnya dan berharap bisa diberi bantuan modal lagi untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini. Bersama dua orang anaknya, saat ini Hari P. tinggal di Jl. Palapa Denpasar.
texts.en:
After having paid off his first loan, Hari P. (34) now intends to borrow again from KIVA via DINARI - this time a slightly bigger loan. The repayments for his first loan went smoothly, thanks to a business that is doing fairly well. There is a lot of interest in his furniture business and it gets a lot of activity, so it continues to flourish. Examples of his creations include cupboards, kitchen sets and sundry household items. He has the help of four employees, who receive daily as well as weekly wages. Hari P. is extremely grateful for the previous loan and hopes to get help with working capital in the form of this second loan. Hari P. lives with his two children on a street called Palapa Denpasar.

Translated from Indonesian by Aarati Sivasubramanian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is 38 years old, married with 3 children. He is into the sale of palm kernel, cocoa and cashew seeds and pods. He lives in Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in this business since the past thirteen years. He needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more palm kernel for sales.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel seed for sales

loans.name: Ushauri Jaribu Group

texts.en:
Nathan A. is the group chairman of Ushauri Jaribu which is a collection of micro-business owners in the village of Suneka, near Kisii town.  

Nathan has two wives and a total of 15 children. Six of his children still live with him; the others are adults.  His businesses have improved so that he is able to provide for his extensive family.  

Nathan rents out four commercial shops as well as owning cows and chickens.  He charges an average of 3000 schillings per month ($45) for each rental property, some more, some less depending on the size.  He owns four dairy cows which produce about 5000 schillings per month profit in milk sales ($75).  

Recently, his one hundred chickens died because of a disease.  He still made a profit from the chickens by selling their eggs, but was unable to sell the meat due to the disease.  For the next loan he is hoping to buy one more cow and one hundred chickens to replace those that died.  He has been disinfecting and cleaning out the chicken coop in preparation.

As a group Ushauri Jaribu is mostly made up of elderly or retired people.  According to their loan officer, they are very organized and cohesive, and were not seriously impacted by the post-election crisis.  Business in the town of Suneka has for the most part maintained stability.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and one hundred chickens
